Title: Hale Koa Hotel
Content: The Hale Koa Hotel on Fort DeRussy Armed Forces Recreation Center is a resort serving members of the U.S. Armed Forces and their families. The Hotel was built and financed by service men and women from their own funds and now operates on a self-sustaining basis. Please visit the website for eligibility. The Hale Koa Hotel is nestled on a 72-acre tropical oasis fronting the finest stretch of beach in Waikiki. We invite you to treat yourself to an experience that will create lasting & cherished memories of your tropical vacation in the islands. The Hale Koa Hotel offers an array of dining experiences for you to enjoy on property. The Hale Koa also offers a multitude of entertainment opportunities beyond just fun in the sun.

Title: Hotel Renew
Content: Friendliness reigns at the modern, sophisticated Hotel Renew, according to the New York Times. Located steps from Waikiki Beach and world-class shopping and dining, Hotel Renew offers guests a personalized and intimate experience that leaves them feeling renewed and rejuvenated. As Oahu's only true designer boutique hotel, acclaimed designer Jiun Ho created a casually elegant oasis of tranquility a subtle and calming contrast to the vibrant energy of Waikiki. Balance and harmony are the hallmarks of Ho's overall design vision, which is immediately evident upon entering the property which provides guests a beautiful and elegant beachside retreat that places their well-being ahead of everything else. The 72-room hotel echoes the natural environment of Oahu, incorporating basic natural elements such as water, earth, and fire into the overall design.

Title: Queen Kapiolani Hotel
Content: We enthusiastically greet each malihini (guest) with a genuine friendliness that comes from our love of hospitality, our cultural heritage of outgoing warmth and our desire to ensure that you have a memorable visit to our island paradise. Named for Hawaii's beloved Queen Kapiolani, our Honolulu/Waikiki Beach hotel is ideally located near the foot of the majestic Diamond Head Crater and just a block away from the famous Waikiki Beach, the sandiest beach in the area fronting Kapahulu Pier. The 108-acre Kapiolani Park, Honolulu Zoo and Waikiki Aquarium are adjacent to the hotel. Shopping, dining and plenty of entertainment venues are all within walking distance perfect for a family vacation, sporting event or a romantic getaway. Of course, tour groups are always welcome! There are quite a few things to do in Honolulu, so be sure to allow plenty of time for exploration.

Title: Waikiki Resort
Content: Steps from the world famous white sands of Waikiki Beach and located in the heart of Waikiki, we'd like to introduce you to your next home away from home while in the islands. You'll love the convenience of being a few minutes walking distance from shopping, dining and night life. All of our 275 hotel rooms and suites were refreshed and renewed with our recent remodel in 2008. Whether on business or leisure, you'll find comfort, convenience and location at an affordable price. Seconds to the beach, convenient, comfortable, and easy to get into and out of Waikiki Resort Hotel.

Title: Sunquest Vacations
Content: Find one of the largest inventories of exclusive private homes and condos for vacation rentals located along the Kona-Kohala Coast. In business for 31 years, SunQuest Vacations now offers online airline booking services and booking for various island activities. They also have special contracted rates with Avis Rent A Car.

Title: Turtle Bay Resort
Content: Turtle Bay Resort is a gem, the only Oʻahu resort of its kind on the North Shore set amid an idyllic location and situated to provide an authentic North Shore experience. This is your home base while enjoying a range of activities such as snorkeling, surfing, SUPing, kayaking, horseback riding, exploring on a Segway, or taking a ride in a helicopter. Its also ground zero for a round of championship golf on two courses designed by Arnold Palmer and George Fazio. Dining on Hawaiian sea-to-table cuisine is a must at Paakai as well. And, of course, you'll want to indulge in a multi-sensory spa, salon and fitness experience at Nalu Kinetic Spa, voted a Top 10 Organic Spa by Organic Spa Magazine.

Title: Ilima Hotel
Content: Looking for Waikiki hotel deals? The 'Ilima is centrally located in the heart of Waikiki beach close to shops and restaurants. Our Waikiki hotel is the family specialist and offers large rooms, full kitchens and modest prices to help stretch your budget. Our staff welcomes you in the spirit of Aloha and ohana, or family, ready to make your accommodation in Waikiki beach hassle free and pleasant, because, for a small hotel were largely accommodating!

Title: Hilton Waikiki Beach/ Mac 24/7
Content: Enjoy close proximity to many local attractions including International Marketplace, Honolulu Zoo and Kapiolani Park, or explore the numerous shops and restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. Enjoy an energizing workout in the 24-hour fitness center, lounge on the sundeck by the outdoor pool or relax with a refreshing cocktail at the pool bar. Enjoy a delicious meal at MAC 24/7 and dine on mouthwatering American dishes in contemporary, up-scale surroundings. Come join us for MAC 24/7's famous Pancake Challenge. Want to try? Bring it on! Just want to watch? Bring that on too! We welcome all comers.

Title: Polynesian Cultural Center
Content:
Polynesian Cultural Center takes guests on an interactive tour of multiple Pacific cultures through eight villages and exhibits, plus enjoy hands-on fun with its "Go Native" program. Delve into the lifestyle skills and performing arts of Samoa, Aotearoa (New Zealand), Tonga, Fiji, Tahiti and Hawaii. Taste Tahitian coconut bread, try Tongan ta nafa (drumming), gaze at the six-story Fijian temple, twirl poi balls, paddle and outrigger canoe and dance Hawaiian hula. And that's not all! Many of the stores have longstanding ties to Laie, the North Shore and Polynesia, and offer distinctive items not available at any other visitor attraction or shopping center in Hawaii. Parking is free and there's no admission just for the marketplace.

Read our article about the History of Polynesian Cultural Center here.

We’re giving away 5 premium ukulele in August.
All you need to do is visit Polynesia.

Now there’s another reason to drop by the Polynesian Cultural Center this August. With our end of Summer bonus, you could win one of five high-end, locally-made ukulele valued up to 2,495!
- Kamaka Pineapple Long Neck Ukulele ($1,595)
- Kanile'a Koa Hawaiian Island Inlay Concert Ukulele ($2,395)
- Kanile'a Premium Koa Honu Inlay Tenor Ukulele ($2,495)
- Kanile’a Deluxe Curly Koa Silk Tenor Ukulele ($2,345)
- Kamaka Koa Tenor Ukulele with Saddle Volume Control & Ukulele Case ($2,145)

Just purchase any ticket or package and visit the Polynesian Cultural Center by August 31st, and you’ll be automatically entered to win. Enjoy all the amazing activities, dining and entertainment at the Center, and then in September we’ll let you know if you’ve won!

Visit polynesia.com or call (808) 293-3333

Must purchase a ticket or package and actually visit the Center on or before 8/31/23 in
order to be entered into this contest. Only 5 winners will be selected and notified in
September. Some restrictions apply.

Title: Kaanapali Golf Courses
Content: Panoramic views are par for the course with 36-holes of championship golf in Kaanapali Beach Resort. Royal Kaanapali and Kaanapali Kai courses feature many options to choose from, including family golf, foot golf, couple's packages, golf and dining or shopping and junior golf specials. You can also find historical site markers describing the legend and lore behind the location in various spots along these resort courses, not to mention Humpback whales breaching off shore and native birds on the greens.

Title: Pacific Whale Foundation Eco-Adventure
Content: Pacific Whale Foundation has been a leading ocean activity provider on Maui for over 36 years. From snorkeling at Molokini, dolphin and whale watching adventures to sunset cocktail and dinner cruises, this nonprofit has pioneered award-winning, educational wildlife watching and ecotourism in Hawai‘i. Every ecotour has a certified Marine Naturalist on board who provides educational talks about Hawai‘i’s reefs, fishes and marine mammals along with tips on snorkeling and the best viewing. Special event and holiday cruises are also available.  Pacific Whale Foundation recently unveiled Ocean Guardian, its newest 149-passenger catamaran featuring two decks, shaded stadium seating on the bow, ADA compliant restrooms and more.

Title: Big Island Television
Content: Big Island Television...Broadcasting aloha since 1985. See volcanic eruptions, lava cascading into the sea and ancient lava tubes. Discover Hawai‘i's natural beauty, cultural history, exciting activities, shopping locations and delicious dining options. View all this and more on Big Island Television, "your best source of visitor information." With so much to see and do, Big Island Television delivers all you want to know. Daily programs include "Our Circle Island Tour," "Hawaii at its Best," plus get to know island residents on "Discover Hawaii." It's all on Big Island Television, channel 130 or find them on your hotel channel guide.

Title: Body Glove Hawaii
Content:
Body Glove Cruises located in Kailua Kona, on Hawaii Island, offers premium snorkeling, historical dinner/sunset cruises and whale watching!

Come aboard our super-raft or catamaran and experience the Pacific to its fullest!
- Snorkel and Scuba Adventures
- Afternoon Lunch Cruises
- Historical Captain Cook Dinner Cruises
- Sunset Cruises
- Dolphin Watch Tours
- Whale-Watching Tours (Seasonal)
- Private Charters

Title: Fair Wind Big Island Ocean Guides
Content:
Imagine swimming in clear water that shimmers in alluring shades of blue. A few feet below sits a thriving coral reef that’s home to schools of colorful fish. This is what awaits at Kealakekua Bay when you head out on a snorkel tour with Fair Wind Big Island Ocean Cruises.

“A common comment we get from guests is that it was the best part of their vacation,” says Director of Sales and Marketing Penn Henderson, who’s been with Fair Wind for 16 years. “Often times, people visit Hawai‘i and simply enjoy the beach and pool at their resort. But once people actually decide to take a snorkel cruise, they’re blown away with everything from the beautiful coastline sights while cruising to the magnificent underwater world they get to experience while snorkeling. Plus they’re getting breakfast and lunch, and get to learn a little bit about Hawai‘i’s history from our knowledgeable crew.”

Fair Wind is coming up on nearly 50 years of serving visitors and residents, and has had time to perfect the snorkel tours and optimize their vessels. They offer four ocean cruises—three daytime snorkel cruises to various locations, and an evening manta ray snorkel adventure.

“For first time snorkelers, we always recommend going out on the Fair Wind II vessel to Kealakekua Bay,” says Henderson. “It’s a large boat with easy access stairs to the water. Plus, there’s no better place than Kealakekua Bay, which is renown for its calm and clear waters with abundant marine life.

“We encounter all sorts of wonderful things during our cruises!” he adds. “Depending on the season, we’ll see whales, dolphins and turtles. While snorkeling, it’s pretty much a showcase of various fishes in a kaleidoscope of colors. Sometimes we’ll see eels and octopus too.”

Henderson says they provide a lot of education about what it means to be eco-friendly and eco-conscious, and how guests can take specific steps in their everyday lives to make a difference. He adds, “One of the big things right now is educating people about the importance of using only reef-safe sunscreen and/or covering up with UV clothing when possible. In fact, starting this year, our guests are no longer allowed to use anything but reef-safe sunscreen that only contain zinc and titanium dioxide as active ingredients.”

As of press time, something new and exciting is in the works for Fair Wind.

“We’re very excited to be launching new tours later in 2020 that will provide guests with the opportunity to partake in actual scientific research on the reef and marine life,” shares Henderson. “Documenting the health of coral, taking water samples, identifying fish populations, etc. These will be smaller charters with one-on-one interactions with marine life experts. So stay tuned!”

An exciting ocean adventure is one thing, but Henderson adds that “One of the biggest takeaways for our guests after a snorkel tour is their newfound understanding and appreciation for the environment.” Enjoy an eye-opening experience in more ways than one with Fair Wind!

Title: Hamakua Macadamia Nut Company
Content: Honey Mustard, Hula Jalapeno, Original Wasabi, Chili Peppah, Butter Garlic & Herbs and more! Is your mouth watering to try these distinct and yummy flavors? You'll have to make a pit stop at the factory where you'll observe the mac nut process from tree to table. Pick up gift items too: mac nut popcorn and cookies, Kona coffee and more.

Title: Hawaii Forest & Trail
Content:
We could have said, “Rob Pacheco gazes at stars for a living.” Or, “Rob Pacheco studies birds for a living.” In fact, he does all of those things, and thousands of Hawai‘i visitors are the better for it.

When Pacheco arrived on the Big Island in 1990 to take a job as a beekeeper, the Northern California native did not know he would settle in Hawai‘i permanently. “I would go to school, travel, go broke, and go back to school. This was just another adventure along the way.”

Fate would change the course of Pacheco’s life. “First, I met my wife in Kona. Then on a Friday night after work I parked my Dodge Aspen station wagon at a Wailuku River trailhead. I got lost. I hiked to a fence line, found a road and 40 minutes later a pickup truck pulls up and the driver says, ‘What are you doing on my property?’” That turned out to be the proverbial “lucky break.” The owner of the property, Freddy Nobriga, was the first person to allow Pacheco to conduct hiking tours on private property.

Fast forward almost 30 years, and Hawaii Forest & Trail’s mission to “share Hawai‘i’s beauty and foster a deep connection between people and nature” has hiked over to O‘ahu. Their Farm to Forest Experience takes visitors from sea to mountain in a farm to forest adventure.

“On our Honolulu Heights Tour, guests learn about the island’s volcanic past at ancient eruptive sites,” says Pacheco. “The Birds and Wildlife of Oahu adventure allows our guests to discover native wildlife along the beach up to a forest reserve.”

Hawaii Forest & Trail’s newest “Sunset on the Ridge” tour is a photographer’s dream with access to restricted Pālehua. A moderate hike takes you to sweeping views of O‘ahu’s west side.

Hike with people who hike for a living. Waikīkī and Ko Olina pick ups are available.

Title: Hawaii Tropical Botanical Garden
Content:
If you could imagine a Garden of Eden on this earth, this would be it. Meander along nature trails wandering through a tropical rainforest, cross bubbling streams and pass beautiful waterfalls. This Garden in a Valley on the Ocean is a museum of living plants within a natural greenhouse dedicated to preserving plant species.

Last entry at the gate is 4pm | Closed for Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year's Day
Bring: Comfortable Shoes with grip, Sunscreen, Bug Repellent, Full Bottle of Water (no bottle fill tap) and Snacks/Lunch

Title: Kamanu Charters
Content: You’re adrift on the Pacific Ocean, bathed in warm orange light and surrounded by a glistening sea. You’re no castaway. You’re not having to figure out the shipping lanes for a rescue. You’re simply enjoying a sunset cruise off the Kona coast with Kamanu Charters. And best of all, a delicious libation sits next to your outstretched hand. Kamanu Charters offers daily ocean tours, but there’s no better way to end the day than with a leisurely relaxing cocktail cruise aboard their custom 36-foot Kamanu catamaran. And if romance is in the air, a sunset outing is perfect! The Kamanu provides a large stable platform with an expansive trampoline or webbed netting for guests to lie on. Take in the orange glow above or deep blue passing swiftly below. Bring a swimsuit and towel if you’re looking to jump in the water. Appetizers, a light meal and beverages are included. Kamanu Charters offers daily ocean tours aboard the Kamanu and their newest and fastest boat, the Kamanu ʻElua, a state-of-the-art rigid inflatable boat. Snorkel with turtles, dolphins or manta rays at night. Their destination of choice is Pawai Bay, a protected marine preserve offering clear water, caves, caverns, arches and a coral reef system. Daily tours from Honokohau Harbor.

Title: Kau Coffee Mill & Visitor Center
Content:
The Big Isle’s gourmet coffees are grounds for celebration! Kona coffee is grown in the North and South Kona Districts while Ka‘u coffee is named after its large, sprawling southern district. These award-winning, regional coffees are handpicked when red-ripe and carefully milled, dried and roasted to ensure quality. While each grower contributes to coffee quality through farming techniques, processing steps also contribute to the taste and aroma of coffee. When buying coffee, read labels. Kona Coffee “blends” are only required to contain at least 10 percent Kona coffee. Also note that coffee labeled as “Hawaiian” can be sourced from anywhere in the state. Peaberry coffee, which makes up about five percent of the crop, is coffee made from coffee cherries that contain only one bean—instead of the usual two. This unique, sought-after coffee has its own flavor profile and is sold at a premium by producers.

The Hawai‘i Department of Agriculture established a coffee-grading standard to distinguish the quality of green Kona coffee; the top grade is Kona Extra Fancy, followed by Kona Fancy, Kona Number One and Kona Prime. Some coffee brands include these grades on packaging. It’s best to sample all roasts to determine your favorite. In addition, coffees labeled as “estate” are those produced and entirely controlled by one plantation—from tree to packaging. Farm and processing tours are offered by some producers to share first-hand information for best appreciating the Big Isle’s highly intensive coffee industry.

Title: Kohala Zipline
Content:
If you’re nervous about ziplining but really want to try it, then consider Kohala Zipline in Hālawa. Located on the isle’s northern tip, Kohala Zipline offers a course with nine ziplines and five suspension bridges that take you from tree to tree, ending with an exciting rappel. “We offer a unique element that appeals to the more cautious adventurer,” says Owner Rob Pacheco. “We have a built-in Rider Control System that allows riders to control their own speed.”

No matter the speed, guests get to experience a forested, stream rich terrain with magnificent canopy trees. Adds Pacheco: “Our goal has always remained the same: to operate a world-class canopy tour for Hawai‘i Island, and we are proud to say that we do.”

Title: Seaquest Night Manta Experience
Content: Keauhou Bay, is located just a few minutes boat ride away from the Kona Coast's most successful manta ray snorkeling location. This means more time in the water with the mantas, and less time getting to them. Take in a spectacular Kona sunset and watch for the green flash phenomenon as your captain leisurely navigates the vessel to the home of "Big Bertha", Kona's most famous manta ray.

Title: The 4D Adventure Ride At The Shops At Mauna Lani
Content: The 4D Adventure Ride at The Shops at Mauna Lani will take you swimming with tropical fish, dolphins and whales, riding a tropical coaster, visitng alien worlds, the Antarctic and more! Hawaii's only 4D Disney-style theater features 3D movies with full-range motion seats and special effects including wind and water. It's fun for the whole family!

Title: Waikoloa Village Golf Club
Content: This Robert Trent Jones Jr. design features generous fairways and well guarded greens. “The layout is excellent,” says This Week Big Island General Manager Ed Chung. “Robert Trent Jones is a great golf architect. This is a course you can play every day.” Located at approximately 1,000 feet of elevation, golfers are treated to views of five volcanoes and the Kohala coastline. The second oldest golf course on the Big Island and a local favorite, Waikoloa Village Golf Club is situated in an arid location, which virtually assures good playing conditions 365 days each year. Tee times daily.

Title: Kauai Sea Tours
Content:
The Na Pali Coast is one of the most beautiful locations in the Hawaiian Islands, and for that matter the world. Explore this amazing coast with KAUAI SEA TOURS departing from Port Allen on raft adventures or the deluxe Lucky Lady catamaran.  

Na Pali means the cliffs, it’s an amazing sight from the sea. Gaze upon 3,500 foot heights, lush valleys, cascading waterfalls, sea caves and pristine beaches along this remote wilderness coastline. The Lucky Lady vessel offers prime viewing of Na Pali from the bows to stern with seating all around the main deck, on the upper observation deck and shaded cushioned seating in the lower protected cabin area, with conveniently located restrooms, a waterslide, and swim platform. Ride the bows with dolphins skimming the waves below.  Our friendly professional crew share history and legends of Hawaii with Aloha.  Continental breakfast and deli sandwich buffet lunch on the morning snorkel tour and a delicious casual 3 course dinner on the sunset cruise. Cold soft drinks served all day and beer, wine and Mai Tai’s are available after water sports so bring your I.D. along.

 

Our experienced, US Coast Guard Licensed Captain will entertain you on this journey with history and legends of Kauai and marine life ecology. The friendly attentive crew will serve you refreshments and keep a watchful eye out for your comfort, safety and enjoyment. After the Captains safety briefing we start off the day with a continental breakfast of fresh baked scones, muffins, tropical fruits, juice and coffee as we get underway for an adventure offshore.

Experience the majestic Na Pali coast, Kauai, on our spacious 60 foot, custom designed “Lucky Lady” catamaran. As we head up north to NaPali along the south west coast of Kauai you’ll see views of the island of Ni`ihau and the ridges of Kokee Waimea State Park in the distance. Thrill to the sight of playful spinner dolphins skimming and leaping out of the waters before you, curious sea turtles, sea birds and Humpback Whale watching in season (December – April) and more. After we pass by Polihale, the longest stretch of white sand beach in Hawaii, we turn north for the spectacular NaPali coast.

For a ride on the wild side try one of the Raft adventures. Explore the "nooks and crannies" of N?pali...go under waterfalls and into sea caves when conditions permit, encounter playful dolphins, sea turtles and whale watch December - April. Rafting is a moderate thrill ride suitable only for the physically fit.

What sets Kauai Sea Tours apart from others is a special DLNR State Park permit to access to this remote Na Pali beach and LAND their rafts at Nu`alolo Kai.  This Ultimate Rafting Snorkel Adventure includes a cultural and archaeological experience on Na Pali for hiking, snorkeling and a hearty picnic lunch.  Join your crew on a guided narrated hike on a trail into the past through this ancient Hawaiian village.  Enjoy great snorkeling and a gorgeous remote beach to bask in the sun or relax in the shade as you enjoy a delicious picnic lunch and cold beverages.

Encounter playful dolphins skimming the waters nearby, see curious sea turtles and much more. Dive in to snorkel over a thriving reef ecosystem, snorkel equipment and expert instruction provided under the watchful eye of our crew.  Our experienced USCG licensed Captain and fun loving crew will entertain you with history and legends of their island home and the marine life you’ll encounter.

With over 32 years of experience, we have helped shape the NaPali coast tour boat industry. Our experience at Kauai Sea Tours set the Coast Guard standards for NaPali raft adventures.  This is not your average Snorkel tour.

Title: Safari Helicopters - Kauai
Content:
One of Hawai‘i's longest-running helicopter tour companies, Safari Helicopters, offers customers 30 years of experience, knowledge and seasoned customer service.

Approximately 80% of Kauai is uninhabited, remote and wild. A helicopter tour over Kauai reveals the incredible history, geology and beauty of the island.

Kauai, known as the “Garden Isle,” is the lushest and oldest of the Hawaiian Islands. This green and romantic isle has been the back-drop for countless Hollywood films.

Kauai is the oldest of the main Hawaiian Islands. The island rose from the floor of the Pacific Ocean about 5.1 million years ago. Exposure to the elements over millions of years carved out vast valleys and sculpted ridgelines, making the island topography quite different from that on the youngest island of Hawaii, a.k.a. the Big Island. Some areas of Kauai have countless waterfalls from the abundant annual rainfall, while others are quite dry and desert-like.

Notable regions on Kauai include Mount Waialeale , Waimea Canyon, and the Na Pali Coastline. All our Kauai helicopter flights take you to these locations, as well as other regions on the North Shore and interior of Kauai (weather permitting). Our Refuge Eco Tour extends the experience by landing at a remote, private location owned by the Robinson family, missionary descendants who also own the island of Niihau.

 

Book A Safari Helicopters Tour Today!

Canyon Landing Safari - Lihue

Land at a secluded botanical preserve! The flight portion is the same as the Deluxe Waterfall Safari, approximately 60 minute tour covering over 100 miles of amazing Kauai scenery.

1.5 Hrs.

DETAILS

Deluxe Waterfall Safari - Lihue

Experience the view from above in the comfort of a state-of-the-art helicopter in this approximately 60-minute tour covering over 100 miles of amazing Kauai scenery.

1 Hr.

DETAILS

Title: AAA Hawaii
Content: You'll be ready to kick off your vacation on the right foot with the help of the travel pros at AAA Hawaii. Personal service and competitive pricing on every aspect of your vacation is the name of the game. Ask about free maps and guide books for members.

Title: Snorkel Bob's
Content:
"Snorkel Bob's snorkel gear rentals put you in contact with the ultimate tourist site. It's cheaper, cleaner and more memorable than any restaurant or shop. You can't beat the efficiency of a day or week on the reef.

"Snorkel Bob's designs and engineers quality snorkel gear featuring Seamo Betta™ and Lil Mo Betta™ RX masks in adult and kid format, Moflex performance fins and Bigfoots (15-17) for the full-figured fella, Ultima Bubba™ and L'il Bubba dry snorkels (on EVERY set), and MoflO2 and MoflO2RS snorkels with double-valve twin chambers for fresh air on every breath and more umph in your glug.

"FREE 24-hour interisland gear return makes it easy to pick on one island and return on another. Don't want to schlepp your gear? Ask about Interisland Pick-Up (IPU) service for a fresh set on the next island.

"For the Discriminating Snorkeler Seeking Adventure: quality and service with boat trips, luau, surf lessons, heli tours and more. Book 2 seats on most adventures and get a free turtle beach bag or boogie board  for the week ($26 value).

"I, Snorkel Bob, get it right with real value for you. Here is THE BEST from the only snorkel equipment builder in the world a step and a stumble from the reef. Now who's gonna know what works and what won't?

Title: Expedia Local Expert
Content: Let the travel experts at Expedia take your Hawaiʻi vacation to a whole new level! They’ll help you plan, reserve and book activities wherever your adventure takes you on Oʻahu. Make the most of your time in paradise—let Expedia do the work for you.

Title: Blue Hawaiian Helicopters - Kauai
Content: Witness Kauaʻi’s majestic sights from the sky with Blue Hawaiian Helicopters. Ride high in Kauaʻi’s first “quiet-technology” Eco-Star helicopter offering first-class seating, a wide cockpit and aviation-grade noise-canceling headsets, all while soaking up panoramic views of Hanapēpē Valley, Nāpali Coast, Waimea Canyon and more. Opt for the Kauai ECO Adventure package, or arrange a private air charter. Don’t leave Kauaʻi without experiencing the Blue Hawaiian difference!

Title: Makani Kai Helicopters
Content: Soar high above the everyday and take in breathtaking views of Oahu from renown North Shore surfing spots to historic Pearl Harbor and beautiful Hanauma Bay. Get a dramatic perspective of the island while riding in air-conditioned comfort with Bose headsets and sound system, and a personalized DVD or video of your experience. Daily flights weather permitting.

Title: Aloha Golf Tours
Content: Feel like squeezing in a game of golf, but lack equipment or reservations? Call Aloha Golf Tours and they'll set you up with one of Oahus 18-hole courses, golf clubs, balls, tees and transportation from any Waikiki hotel. Courses include Royal Hawaiian Golf Club, Koolau Golf Club and Hawaii Kai Golf Course, just to name a few. You'll automatically be paired with another guest for the next available tee time.

Title: Hawaii Polo
Content: Ride atop a thoroughbred polo horse on a 100-acre beachfront ranch on Oahu's wild North Shore. Make it your escape from the bustle of busy Waikiki and breathe in the fresh salt air while exploring one of many trails at your own pace. Go as a group, with your sweetheart, during a spectacular sunset or by the light of a full moon. Rides are 1-1.5 hours long.

Image Description: recd 8.12 fr ruth limtiaco for hawaii polo club only

Title: Pearl Harbor Aviation Museum
Content:
See historic footage of the Pearl Harbor attack, aircraft and exhibits that give insight into World War II as it was fought in the air. The museum, ranked as one of the “Top 10 Aviation Attractions in the Nation” by TripAdvisor.com, is housed in Hangars 37 and 79 that still bear the scars of our nation’s first aviation battle; they are designated National Historic Landmarks. On the Aviator’s Tour, see the Restoration Shop that houses vintage aircraft awaiting work for future displays. Become a pilot in the museum’s interactive Combat Flight Simulator. A gift shop and cafe are on the premises.

Informative exhibits and vintage aircraft in historic airplane hangars invite you to learn about World War II as it was fought in the air. Admission. 

credit: Pearl Harbor Aviation Museum

Title: Roberts Hawaii Tours and Transportation
Content: Roberts Hawaii is the state’s largest tour and transportation company, with an unmatched fleet of approximately 950 vehicles and a full line of tours, entertainment options and ground transportation services on four islands: Hawaii, Kauai, Maui, and Oahu. One of Hawaii’s premier entertainment providers, the company also owns the award-winning Magic of Polynesia show. Established in 1941 with a single taxi cab on the island of Kauai, Roberts Hawaii has grown to become the largest employee-owned business in the islands. With over 77 years of experience, Roberts Hawaii's commitment has always been to its customers, constantly striving to offer first-class service with a genuine aloha spirit.

Title: Sea Life Park
Content:
Anchoring East Oahu is Sea Life Park, a must-do for anyone who wants to get up close and personal with marine life. Dolphin encounters offer the chance to touch and play with adorable bottlenose dolphins, and you can swim with sea lions, Hawaiian rays and even sharks! It's small enough to enjoy on foot, but diverse enough to enjoy as a full-day destination.

Try the interactive shark experience—Shark Tank Scuba. Novice and experienced divers are invited to immerse themselves in the 300,000-gallon tank and swim among native Hawaiian sharks and rays. Scuba equipment, general and one-on-one instruction are provided. Shark Tank Scuba is available daily; call for reservations.

Visitors and residents can now save up to $20 on three different experiences to O‘ahu attractions. Select from the Pearl Harbor Tour & Sea Life Park Admission; Diamond Head State Monument Tour & Sea Life Park Admission; and Diamond Head State Monument Tour, Pearl Harbor Tour and Sea Life Park Admission. For details: (808) 259-2500 or sealifeparkhawaii.com/pacifichistoricparks.

Title: Waikiki Aquarium
Content:
Stealthy sharks, nebulous jellyfish and endangered Hawaiian monk seals are just a few of the aquatic animals you'll see at the second oldest public aquarium in the United States.

See the 7,500-gallon “Edge of the Reef” exhibit, a Hawaiian green sea turtle exhibit, and the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands exhibit that’s home to over 7,000 marine species, a quarter of which are found nowhere else on Earth. You’ll also see one of the ocean’s rarest creatures, the Peppermint Angelfish, the only one on display worldwide. The Hawaiian Monk Seal Habitat holds two male Hawaiian monk seals, Maka Onaona and Hoailona, who were rescued as pups and spent their lives at the aquarium. Come say hello to these ambassadors of their critically endangered species.

Waikiki Aquarium also hosts lots of fun, educational programs for the kids. Admission: $12/adult, $5/kids 4-12, under 3 are free.

Title: Haleakala Bike Company
Content: Get a thrill cruising downhill from 6,500 feet on Haleakalas slopes going at your own pace on a self-guided ride. The most popular trip is the Sunrise Special to watch the sun rise at 10,000 feet above sea level, then bike down. Bike tours include downhill specific mountain bikes, helmets, gloves, backpacks and more. Many start times and tours.

Title: Hike Maui
Content:
Experience the sights, sounds and smells of Maui on a hiking adventure through tropical rainforest, into Haleakala, past waterfalls, or off-road around Hana. Experienced, knowledgeable and entertaining guides provide insight into cultural, historical and biological aspects of each area. Open to all ages, from 8 to 80 years old. Reservations required. 

About Hike Maui

Experience authentic Maui, and adventure with us into lush rainforests, jump off stunning waterfalls, hike into the silence of Haleakala Crater, and venture through the splendor and romance of the Hana Highway.

Our highly trained guides will provide the most epic day of your vacation. With their naturalist backgrounds and entertaining personalities, our guides will lead you safely through all our Hike Maui adventures.

Hike Maui has been exploring the island of Maui with our guests for over 35 years.

Book A Hike Maui Tour!

Haleakala Crater Hiking Experience

A visit to Maui is not complete without experiencing Haleakala Crater—a magnificent amphitheater of silence, and a place of beauty that always evokes awe. 

7 Hrs.

8 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Kayak, Snorkel & Waterfall Combo Tour

Do it all – ocean kayak and snorkel, waterfalls, and rainforests – in one 7.5 hour trip. On the ocean: 2.5 hours kayaking along South Maui’s dramatic lava-covered landscape. 

7.5 Hrs.

6 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Morning Waterfall Walk

This is the perfect choice if you want a short, easy walk to two waterfalls in our gorgeous Maui rainforest valley.

3 Hrs.

4 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Afternoon Waterfall Walk

Fun, easy, and great for families, or if you are limited on time.

3 Hrs.

4 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Waterfall & Rainforest Hiking Adventure

This is our most popular hike in an amazingly unique valley. Dazzling waterfalls from 10 to 40 feet high, large clear swimming pools under each of the falls, magical rainforests, and freshwater streams.

5 Hrs.

6 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Zipline & Waterfall Adventure Combo - Kahului

Jump from waterfall ledges, take a refreshing “shower” under a Maui waterfall, and end your day with the adrenaline thrill of ziplining on the lush slopes of Haleakala.

6.5 Hrs.

8 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Title: NorthShore Zipline Co.
Content:
Breathe in the scent of giant eucalyptus trees on 7 ziplines and fly to heights of 70 feet across the scenic, lush north shore of Maui. With speeds up to 40 mph on a zipline 900 feet long, youll have the ride of a lifetime. Multiple platforms, tree-to-tree suspension bridges. Kids from 5 years and up are welcome. ACCT trained guides. 

Book A NorthShore Zipline Tour Today!

Maui's Freestyle Zipline Tour

Enjoy freestyle zipping as you soar high through the canopy of the giant eucalyptus trees. Experience 7 zipline runs, entwined with multiple platforms, tree-to-tree bridges, giant towers, and unsurpassed views.

2 Hrs.

5 Yrs. & Older

DETAILS

Title: Pukalani Country Club
Content: Play a round of golf in Maui's cool and lofty upcountry at an elevation of 1,100 feet. This golf course was named in the Golf Digest list of best places to play, and featured on the "Golf Channel's Destination Golf Hawaii" show. Besides the awesome scenic views, there's a double green on Hole 3. Morning, noon and twilight rates are available.

Title: Skyline Eco-Tours Haleakala Zipline
Content: Imagine yourself soaring over gulches and through the trees along the slopes of one of the world's largest volcanoes. The Haleakala Skyline Tour blends a short hiking experience with five picturesque zipline crossings, an “Indiana Jones” style swinging bridge, and an introduction to Hawaii’s unique and fragile landscape. Our award winning adventure promises to be one of the most unforgettable parts of your Maui vacation, so step to the edge . . . and cross the line!

Title: Lyman Museum & Mission House
Content: Get a glimpse into the story of Hawaii and its people at this nationally accredited museum and mission house. See life as it was 150 years ago, as well as state-of-the-art exhibits of Hawaiian natural history and culture and special exhibitions. The gift shop offers museum items, and supports local artisans with a selection of Hawaii-made crafts.

Title: Skyline Eco-Adventures
Content: Take the leap into adventure with Skyline Eco Adventures and soar over three valleys on your choice of two tours, either a five-line family fun tour or eight-line adventure tour. The first zipline eases riders into the experience; by the last one, you’ll be riding like a pro and admiring the beautiful emerald mountains and panoramic ocean views.

Title: CJM Country Stables
Content: The first cowboys in Hawaiʻi were hired by John Palmer Parker of Parker Ranch fame. They were Mexican vaqueros, highly skilled horsemen who then trained his Hawaiian ranch workers. Eventually, the paniolo spread to other islands including Kauaʻi, which to this day still has a significant horse culture. Every July for 21 years, Joyce Miranda of CJM Stables hosts the Paniolo Heritage Rodeo. When the feisty 74-year-old owner isn’t hosting this amazing three-day event, she’s taking care of her riding guests at their Poʻipu ranch. “ We want our guests to slow down and be in the present when they ride with us,” says Joyce when we ask her of her mission. CJM guests choose from two amazing trails: the Māhāʻulepū Beach Ride, which meanders through ranchland with coastal and mountain vistas, across a sand bar and stream near one of Hawaiʻi’s most spectacular beaches; or the Secret Beach Picnic Ride, which is ideal for families and small groups. Most of the horses at CJM are in service to give visitors the best riding experience, whether they’re expert riders or novices. “We match our horses up to the skill level of our guests,” explains Miranda. “Horses sense human emotions before humans even register them. They sense confidence and anxiety, happiness or sadness. Some horses prefer women, some men.” For reservations and more information about rides and July’s rodeo, visit www.cjmstables.com.

Title: H. Hawaii Media
Content: Tune in to local radio on Kauai, brought to you by H Hawaii Media. Three different stations offer listeners a choice. On 99.9 FM, you'll hear classic hits from the 70's to 90's with hourly AP news updates. For Hawaiian music hits, listen to 98.9 FM and for contemporary and hip hop sounds, listen to JAMZ on 98.1 FM.

Title: Kauai Lagoons Golf Club
Content: Experience outstanding golf on Kiele's championship 18 holes. The Jack Nicklaus redesign is breathtaking and features the longest continuous stretch of ocean holes in Hawaii. It continuously garners top awards from leading publications. The inland Waikahe Course is great for junior players. Ask about special rates after 12 noon.

Title: Kiahuna Golf Club
Content: Tee off for 18 holes of aloha on the isle's fastest greens in beautiful Poipu and see remnants of ancient Kauai on the course. The friendly staff can guide you to the driving range, putting green and golf instructors. Get special twilight, military and bounce-back rates.

Title: Koloa Zipline
Content:
Koloa Zipline, Kauai ATV, and Koloa Bass Fishing are the essence of aloha on the island of Kauai. Whether it’s the history and culture of the south shore, amazing vistas, or adventure you’re after, these folks deliver. Koloa Zipline offers the longest consecutive ziplines on the island with lines up to ½ a mile long!  Learn to fly head first over the jungle like your favorite super hero with the original “Flyin’ Kauai’an Harness” or soar into the sunset on our incredible Sunset Tour. Koloa Zipline has 8 lines located on historic Grove Farm land that features simultaneous ocean and fresh water reservoir views.
  Kauai ATV has been a part of the community for over 15 years. The longest ATV tour on the island offers hidden secrets like the Wilcox Tunnel, WW II bunkers, and a quiet little waterfall for swimming at the base of Mt. Kahili. Jungle fun, red dirt, bamboo pole fishing, and unexpected rainbows are just a little taste of what Kauai ATV offers. Grab the wheel of a two or four seater buggy and hit the backroads of island history. Koloa Bass Fishing is a 4 hour catch-and-release fishing excursion on the majestic and private Waita Reservoir.  The largest reservoir in the state of Hawaii is the host to Peacock Bass, Large/Small Mouth Bass, and Tilapia. The fishing rods, boat, and bait are furnished, you bring the fun and family. All three of these companies are proud supporters of community programs and offer guests discounts on tour photos based on in-house donations to area programs such as the Kauai Humane Society, Bandwagon Music School for Children, Kanuikapono Hawaiian Cultural School, and the Kauai Food Bank. True believers in responsible tourism, Kauai ATV, Koloa Zipline, and Koloa Bass Fishing give you the opportunity to play in the jungle and pay it forward.

Title: National Tropical Botanical Gardens
Content:
Here is where you’ll see Kaua‘i living up to its nickname. NTBG encompasses three gardens: McBryde and Allerton Gardens on the south shore; and Limahuli Garden on the north side.

McBryde Garden makes its home in Lawa‘i Valley. See collections of palms, flowering trees, heliconia, orchids and many other flora collected by botanists and biologists. Allerton Garden is unique, part garden and part outdoor art exhibit. See garden rooms, exotic plants, sculptures and water features.

Recently reopened, Limahuli Garden requires visitors to now make advance online reservations at the NTBG website for self-guided tours in order to mitigate the impact of traffic and vehicles on the surrounding community. Hawai‘i residents with ID and North Shore Shuttle riders are exempt. Shuttle system info at kauainsshuttle.com. Guided tours are available at all three gardens with advance reservations.

Title: Puakea Golf Course
Content: Great views of Mt. Haupu with scenic 18-holes on a challenging course layout. The friendly and hospitable staff ensure a memorable golf experience. Other features include a practice facility and golf instruction. Mid-day and twilight rates. The Ho'okipa Cafe offers a delicious breakfast, Thursday-Sunday; also serves breakfast, lunch, pupus and signature cocktails.

Title: Affordable Tours
Content: Your perfect vacation, honeymoon or anniversary is a phone call away. Affordable Tours offers a number of sightseeing tours on Oahu including guided tours, cruises and ocean activities, luau, overnighters to neighbor islands and combo packages. Whether you're looking for an ocean adventure, evening show or romantic cruise, you'll find it here. Activities are available at a discount for same day or same week bookings.

Title: Alamo Rent A Car
Content: Check Alamos Hot Deals and see how to be an Alamo Insider. Find internet-only car rental exclusives and last-minute specials. Ask about great rates for jeeps and convertibles. Skip the line at the counter and get your family to their destination faster with the easy Online Check-In. Alamo features GM vehicles.

They try harder so you travel easier.

Title: Dollar Rent A Car - Maui
Content: Reduce your time at the counter with Dollars Rapid Rental Check-in when you go on-line to provide your information. Get weekly rentals, unlimited mileage. Book at a rate lower than a mid-size car and get a mid-size or larger vehicle. Receive friendly, courteous service from their knowledgable staff. Earn miles with American Airlines Advantage.

Title: Enterprise Car Rental
Content: Ranked number one in customer satisfaction seven times in national surveys. Be highly satisfied with your rental car experience, plus choose the option to rent from a fleet of ecologically friendly HyBrids and electric cars. Select vehicles from a fuel-efficient fleet and discover more places to explore. Attractive daily rates.

Title: Special Ticket & Tour
Content:
There’s a whole lot of things to see and do on the island, and if you’re not sure where to begin, stop by Special Ticket & Tour to speak with the folks in the know who can provide options best suited for you and your budget.

   “We opened in May 1999 and love to share the beauty of the islands,” says Crystal Hanh, owner of Special Ticket & Tour. “We help visitors experience the best of the island with the best service and prices at our convenient location in Waikīkī.”

   They can put together customized tours, as well as offer island tours and attractions based on your preferences. What does Hanh suggest for families with young children or first-time visitors?

   “I suggest the Grand Circle Island Tour, Pearl Harbor Tour or the Polynesian Cultural Center,” says Hanh. “We guarantee visitors will get the best prices in town without the hassle or attending a timeshare presentation. Visitors will have an
amazing experience with our company.”

Title: National Car Rental
Content: Go Like a Pro with an Emerald Club membership and get convenient benefits. Pass the counter, select your car and own the road. Book online and find last-minute specials and some of the lowest rates. Select vehicles from a fuel-efficient fleet. Get to your destination on time when you add a Garmin GPS navigational system to your car rental.

Title: Thrifty Car Rental
Content: Pick a Wild Card and get either a compact vehicle or larger. Join one of several free member programs, like the Timesaver to speed through counter check-in. With the Blue Chip program, easily earn free days, travel rewards and receive VIP treatment. Earn miles with American Airlines Advantage when you rent.

Title: Roberts Hawaii
Content: Join Roberts Hawaii on the Island of Discovery for sightseeing adventures led by highly-trained guides. Take a step into the silver screen to visit the island’s famous movie locations on the Hawaii Movie Tour. Discover the “Grand Canyon of the Pacific” and float down a freshwater river regaled by enchanting songs and stories of ancient Hawaii.

Check in at The Beach Shack.

Title: Atlantis Submarines Kona
Content: An unforgettable 45-minute journey aboard an Atlantis 48-passenger submarine, as featured in National Geographic television specials, where guests explore a 25-acre natural coral reef and its marine inhabitants! A new adventure awaits you at depths up to 100 feet! Enjoy the view in air-conditioned comfort and safety.

Title: Big Kahuna Watersports Hawaii
Content: How deep do you want to go? Down to 40 feet, 55, 80 or 135 feet? A variety of dives feature healthy coral reefs and an array of marine life that includes vibrant fish, turtles, eels, perhaps even an endangered monk seal. Groups catering to beginners and certified divers are small, ensuring personal attention. Ask about certified classes.

Title: Boss Frog's Snorkel, Surf & Cycle - Kauai
Content: Get snorkel equipment, body and surf boards, beach chairs and bicycles. Rent everything you need to play outdoors in Kauai. Learn about deals on popular activities too. Specializing in air tours, land tours, ocean activities and luau.

Title: Dolphin Star - Waikiki
Content:
Relax aboard Oahu’s largest island catamaran on this best value Sunset BBQ & Cocktail Cruise that conveniently departs from Waikiki! Savor a tasty Mai Tai and BBQ dinner freshly grilled onboard with breathtaking ocean views of the sunset and the city skyline.

Your tasty dinner features an entrée of Tenderloin of Beef & Teriyaki Chicken, Waipoli Baby Romaine with Grape Tomatoes, Sesame Star Puff Pastry and Caesar Dressing, Rice Pilaf, Sautéed Fresh Vegetables, Maui Gold Sweet Pineapple with Coconut Flakes, Poi Roll with Butter and the Chef’s Dessert of the Day.

Alternative Entrée of Chicken and Grilled Vegan Garden Burger also available with 48-hour notice. Additional beverages are available for purchase.

You’ll cruise in the comfort of the open-air, 2-deck Dolphin Star catamaran, featuring covered seating, restrooms, and panoramic walk-around decks.

Join us for a memorable time. Our crew is ready to welcome you with Aloha!

Book A Dolphin Star Cruise Today!

New Year's Eve Midnight Waikiki Cocktail Cruise

Welcome the New Year aboard our Cocktail & Fireworks Cruise! Our island catamaran offers 360° views from both decks of the fireworks and Honolulu city lights along the coastline.

1.75 Hrs.

21 Yrs & Older

DETAILS

Waikiki Sunset Cocktail Cruise

Sip a tasty Mai Tai, snack on deluxe dry snacks, and unwind to island tunes as you take in majestic views of Diamond Head, the beautiful Hawaiian sunset, and other famous Honolulu landmarks.

2 Hrs.

DETAILS

Waikiki Sunset Cocktail Cruise & BBQ

Relax aboard Oahu’s largest island catamaran on this best value Sunset BBQ & Cocktail Cruise that conveniently departs from Waikiki!

2 Hrs.

Title: H2O Sports Hawaii
Content: Be like a superhero when you fly the Jetlev Jet Pack! This is the only place in Hawaii where you can experience this water-propelled pack. A certified flight instructor will get you up in the air up to 30 feet high! Other activities include parasailing, jet skiing, scuba diving, surf lessons, banana boat and bumper boat rides and snorkeling at Hanauma.

Title: Wet N Wild Hawaii
Content:
The original concept behind Wet’n’Wild Hawaii began with Dr. Harrington in 1994 as he swam in the Pacific Ocean after being turned away from the crowded pools at Maui’s Grand Wailea Resort. Wouldn’t Hawai‘i be an ideal place for a year-round water park?

Twenty years later, Wet’n’Wild continues to keep it fresh for its customers with new events such as the “dive’n’movies” at the wave pool and dry movies on the grounds of Chief’s Luau. There are also new food items, constantly refurbished cabanas for a true VIP experience, and new rides and attractions every couple of years.

Looking for a white knuckle ride? Then head to Shaka. Reach speeds up to 31mph as you fly on a raft in forward and reverse motions on a giant U-shaped slide, plunging down a sheer 36-foot drop at an angle of 70 degrees—almost vertical! You’ll totally get the feeling of “zero gravity!” 

Not all the thrill rides are “adult only.” The newest and most popular is Waimea Whirl, a two-person, rainbow-colored ride the whole family can enjoy. Gravity keeps riders on the walls as they swirl into a funnel-shaped bowl before being flushed down a long slide that ends in a splash pool. 

A fun whitewater rafting experience for the family is Ohana Highway. Slide seven stories down the cliffs of Kapolei, winding over 600 feet along the walls, around sharp turns and descents of more than 40 feet!

What makes Wet’n’Wild THE place for families? The park has rides for all ages—26 in all—to relax and cool off, as well as get an adrenaline boost. And if you reserve a seating area or private cabana, it becomes your place to rest between rides, grab a mid-day meal or snack, or check your email using the park’s free wifi.

Choose to stay for an action-packed evening at the five-star Chief’s Luau and experience Polynesian culture, history and dance. Enjoy cultural activities followed by a meal of authentic Hawaiian food, cocktails, world-class performances and a fire show that includes the world’s only female fireknife champion, and world fireknife champion himself, Chief.

Title: The Reef Dancer
Content: Float effortlessly underwater without ever getting wet at all on a comfortable, air-conditioned semi-submersible vessel where every seat has a window. See Mauis only personalized Dive Show while an experienced diver explains the sights. Kids ages 5 and under are free with one paying adult. Reservations are recommended for daily tours.

Title: Captain Zodiac
Content:
Captain Zodiac will take you to explore some of Hawaii’s most amazing sights along the Kona Coast. The destination is Kealakekua Bay which boasts some of the best snorkeling in the state of Hawaii. “This remote marine preserve features hundreds of colorful fish and beautiful coral,” says Owner Dave Burns. “The bay is a key place in Hawaiian history and site of the Captain Cook Monument, and guides ‘talk story’ about these cultural and historic events.”

Up-close encounters with marine life are an opportunity not to be missed on Captain Zodiac rafts. “We see pods of Hawaiian spinner dolphins, humpback whales (seasonal), pilot whales, sea turtles, and other rare species,” says Burns. “The small-group atmosphere of the adventure allows for a personal and intimate tour.”

Captain and crew are well versed in marine science, animal behavior, geology of the island’s lava flows, Hawaiian history, culture, and folklore. This makes for tours that are informative as well as fun. The captains are part-entertainer and all pirate!

Only highly maneuverable 24-foot Zodiac Hurricane RHIB can get in close to the sea caves, lava tubes, rock archways, blowholes and amazing scenery along the coastline. “With only a maximum of 16 passengers per raft, everyone has a great seat” adds Burns.

Tours depart from Honokohau Harbor daily.

Book A Captain Zodiac Boat Tour Today!

Private Charter

Choose your own adventure and book an exclusive private rafting adventure with Captain Zodiac, the Pirates of the Pacific!

4 - 5 Hrs.

Kealakekua Bay Snorkeling Tour

Our destination is Kealakekua Bay, which is a National Marine Park and the site of the Captain Cook Monument. This area is one of Hawaii’s premier snorkel spots with incredible visibility and calm conditions.

4 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="captainzodiac" items="174861" sheet="252368" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] LEARN MORE [/lightframe]

Kona Snorkeling - Beat the Crowd Tour

Same great Kealakekua Bay snorkeling tour, just with an earlier start time to beat the crowds. Check in is at 9:45 AM, Monday - Friday.

5 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="captainzodiac" items="174865" sheet="252368" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] LEARN MORE [/lightframe]

Pelagic Wildlife Excursion

Enjoy a morning wildlife watching tour with our experienced Naturalist captains and crew, who share a passion & respect for the ocean and its inhabitants.

4 - 5 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="captainzodiac" items="245544" sheet="252368" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] LEARN MORE [/lightframe]

Whale Watching Tour - Seasonal

Encountering the humpback whales on 24-foot Zodiac boats is an amazing experience and onboard hydrophones allow you to listen to the beautiful whale song.

4 Hrs.

Title: Dolphin Discoveries
Content: Dolphin Discoveries provides exciting and exhilarating ocean tours for all. View dolphins and other marine life in their natural habitat. Aboard one of many tours, immerse yourself in two of the island’s best snorkel sites—Kealakekua Bay and Place of Refuge. All trips include a trained marine mammal naturalist guide. You’ll see sea caves and lava tubes along your journey, as well as other year-round marine life like Spinner, Spotted and Bottlenose dolphins and Pilot whales. State-of-the-art adventure rafts have shaded canopies. The evening tour takes guests on an experience of a lifetime on a nighttime snorkel with elegant and graceful manta rays feeding in Keauhou Bay. Explore the ocean with Dolphin Discoveries!

Title: Dolphin Quest - Big Island
Content:
Did you know that the Hilton Waikoloa Village is home to a family of dolphins? These ocean ambassadors live in the saltwater, sandy beached tidal lagoon filled with filtered sea water, the Dolphin Lagoon, and are part of Dolphin Quest’s mission to better connect people with marine mammals, other marine life and our oceans.

Through educational, experiential learning programs, the human-animal bond is strengthened, and is meant to educate and inspire guests with compassion, empathy and the desire to make a difference in the future of dolphins and all ocean wildlife.

In addition to being a fun and educational experience, swimming with dolphins at Dolphin Quest directly supports wild dolphin conservation efforts.

To date, Dolphin Quest has contributed over $4.8 million in support of vital marine mammal conservation, education and scientific studies. These efforts directly aid wild dolphin populations, and it’s all due to guest participation—you can make a difference with Dolphin Quest.

Title: Kona Boat Rentals
Content:
Kona Boat Rentals offers a unique opportunity for those who want to be their own captain and get away from the crowds. They’ve provided fully equipped, Coast Guard-inspected, center console runabouts for the last 19 years in Kona.

“With Kona’s leeward calm waters and visibility second to no other spot in Hawai‘i, Kona is the perfect place for boating,” says owner Eric G. McCormick.

No license is required, but some experience is needed. “We’re licensed by the state to provide the training and skills necessary for a safe adventure,” says McCormick. “Our staff provides an orientation to familiarize each guest with the local rules and regulations. We have a full set of charts (maps) of the coastline, as well as color chart plotters that help map their course.

“Our mission is to find out a client’s interest whether it’s snorkeling, fishing, swimming (with dolphins), whale watching (in season) or just cruising the coast,” he says, “and helping them develop a plan that helps them manage their time and get the most of the day. We’re also committed to adhering to federal and state guidelines in regard to mammal and animal conservation. It’s part of our philosophy and orientation to ensure our beauty and wildlife are respected and maintained.”

McCormick adds that safety is the number one concern and goal with Kona Boat Rentals. When weather or ocean conditions are deemed uncomfortable or unsafe for the average boater, they err on the side of safety, and cancel, reschedule or refund as necessary. As island residents for 39 years, they’re very familiar with the island climate.

“We often hear ‘This is the best thing we did on our vacation,’” says McCormick. “The reasons are obvious. A lot of people, especially those who have their own boats on the Mainland, want to be on their own where they have the freedom and autonomy to go where they want to go and do what they want to do on their own schedule. From a value aspect, many people find that it’s less expensive for the family than a snorkeling cruise. Plus they can do it all for one price—fish, snorkel, sightsee and cruise.”

Depart from Honokohau Harbor.

Title: Sea Paradise
Content: Snorkel at night amid majestic manta rays as they glide by. It will truly be one of the best experiences of your life! Learn about these creatures and see them up close as they feed on plankton and microscopic larvae. If you don't see manta rays, rebook for a free tour. Morning and afternoon snorkel and sailing tours to pristine and historic Kealakekua Bayhome to vibrant marine life are also available.

Title: Alii Kayaks
Content: Peacefully paddle the waters of the winding Wailua River, past sacred ancient cultural sites. Then hike through a tropical rainforest on a moderate hike that leads to the breathtaking Secret Falls. Wear a swimsuit, bring a lunch, towels and change of clothes. Its fun for the entire family! Beginners are welcome.

Title: Blue Dolphin Charters
Content:
The only company on Kaua‘i offering guaranteed dolphin sightings on their morning tours is Blue Dolphin Charters—if the captain confirms no dolphins were sighted, then guests get a complimentary ride on the same tour!

Two other factors that differentiate Blue Dolphin from other companies is the opportunity they offer customers to upgrade from snorkeling to scuba diving on two of its tours, as well as being able to accept keiki (kids) as young as 2 years old because of the vessels’ design and build.

“Our 5.5-hour Deluxe Na Pali Snorkel Tour is recommended for our families,” says Jade Casmass, Blue Dolphin’s senior reservationist. “The tour is aboard one of our custom-built 65-foot catamarans and travels far up the Nāpali Coast where guests can snorkel or dive among turtles and tropical fish. It also includes a continental breakfast and deli-style lunch. The highlights include a waterslide, snorkeling, riding the bow of the boat and the highest probability of seeing wildlife.”

For those seeking a wild ride and adventure, Casmass suggests the 5-hour Na Pali Raft Snorkel Tour aboard a 25-foot rigid hull. You’ll snorkel for an hour or so, enter multiple sea caves (weather permitting) and get up close with dolphins. Deli lunch included.

Casmass adds, “Our captains have their own style, but all have amazing knowledge of the Nāpali Coast and Kaua‘i’s history. They’re well seasoned; a few have been with us for 25-plus years.”

As senior reservationist, Casmass must have a favorite tour. “It’s the 7-hour Niihau Na Pali Snorkel Scuba Tour,” she says. “I’m in love with the snorkel and dive spot, which is between Ni‘ihau and Lehua Rock, a bird sanctuary, with lots of shearwaters and albatross soaring around. Lehua Rock is also home to a few resident Hawaiian monk seals, which we often spot while snorkeling and diving.”

Title: Catamaran Kahanu
Content: Looking for something to do? Call Catamaran Kahanu. This ocean activity charter has it all. Cruise along the stunning Napali Coast and learn about this rugged and isolated coastline from locally born and raised Capt. Lani. Swim and snorkel or take a delightful sunset dinner tour. Experience an exciting whale watching excursion from Dec.-April. Tours depart from Port Allen.

Title: Liko Kauai Cruises
Content: Experience Napali through Hawaiian Eyes If you’ve never been on an ocean cruise along the 16-mile-long Napali Coast, then be sure to make it one of the top three activities you do while on the Garden Island. On the other hand, if you’ve already witnessed the majesty of this stunning coastline, then who’s to say you shouldn’t do it again? Whether it’s your first time or not, you’ll definitely be thankful that you did. It is SO worth it! Lose yourself in the magnificent beauty of the Napali Coast while listening to the stories of the islands with Liko Kauai Cruises. The ancestors of the knowledgeable and friendly captain and crew are rooted in the Hawaii of old whose passion was riding the open sea—it’s the spirit that continues to this day. Together with Liko Kauai Cruises, experience the wild and rugged Napali on the Ultimate Napali Boat Cruise, a true adventure of a lifetime. The turquoise-hued Pacific Ocean is rich in marine life; you may very likely observe endangered sea turtles or honu, seabirds taking flight amid the dramatic cliffs, playful mammals like the resident Spinner and Pacific Bottlenose dolphins, lightning fast flying fish, the endangered Hawaiian monk seal and even visiting humpback whales in season (December through April). Distinctive features include spectacular sea caves such as Pirate’s Cave, the largest sea cave on the Napali Coast. Feel the cool spray of a waterfall as you access the cave and adjust your eyes upon entry to see bright green moss above and white calcium streaks created by natural freshwater springs, and breathe in the moist and musty scent that is the Pirate’s Cave. Activities are dependent on the weather and ocean, but when conditions are right, get ready for even more fun! You’ll also enjoy cascading freshwater waterfalls like Rainbow Falls; see famous Honopu Arch—the largest natural arch in the state—where the epic movie “King Kong” was filmed, peer into deep and uninhabited green valleys, and be amazed by miles of pristine white sand beaches. In between these beautiful diversions and stops for photographs and videotaping, you’ll easily feel like part of the family as the crew shares fascinating island history and Hawaiian folklore for an engaging and entertaining half-day adventure. Daily excursions are aboard the U.S. Coast Guard-certified Napali Kai III, an extremely fast and comfortable 49-foot catamaran powered by twin 315 horsepower Cummins diesel. It’s the perfect size for exploring sea caves and offers unobstructed views of dramatic cliffs and mountain peaks. Padded seats are all forward facing too. Amenities include a shaded area, freshwater shower and restroom. Tours are five hours with either an 8 a.m. or 1:30 p.m. check-in time departing from the nearest harbor to the Napali Coast, Kikiaola Small Boat Harbor. This enables the ability to see more of the coast in a shorter time. Tour includes snorkeling equipment (prescription and optical masks are also available) and easy-to-follow instruction for a close-up glimpse of isle marine life in their native habitat. A deli lunch is provided that includes beef, ham, turkey, veggie and peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, plus cookies and beverages (bottled water, juices, soft drinks). Prepare as if you were headed out for a day at the beach—slather on the sunscreen, wear a hat and swimwear, and bring a towel. Did you know that when the crew goes fishing, you can witness the excitement? They like catching the big ones and you can watch them reel the fish in—‘ono (wahoo), ‘ahi (yellowfin tuna), kahala (amberjack), mahi mahi (dorado or dolphin fish) and even barracuda. It’s just one more facet to the Napali Coast experience shared by Liko Kauai Cruises!

Title: Nukumoi Surf Company
Content:
The community-minded Nukumoi Surf Shop located in sunny southside Po‘ipū, is family owned and operated, and has been for nearly 25 years. Opened by Bob and Christine French next to their first business, Brennecke’s Beach Broiler, Nukumoi is named after Nukumoi Point, an advance break located off the beach fronting the store.

It’s all in the family with sons Hoku and Kainoa, daughter Kelly and son-in-law Joe running the day-to-day operation, assisted by other daughters Rochelle (a former surf pro) and Jessica.

It’s here that you’ll find some of the best quality beach and surf accessories, beach apparel and equipment rentals—everything you’ll need for a day of fun at the beach. “If we don’t have it, then you don’t need it!” states Kelly with pride. 

What’s more, they offer surf lessons at Po‘ipū Beach too—“a great location for maximum success.” With its consistent surf, easy rides, sandy beach, fun environment, and located within walking distance of the shop, it can’t be beat.

Kelly says they may not have their own surf school, however, the ocean has been a constant throughout each of their lives. “We’re known for providing the best choices for whatever experience level you’re at,” she says. “From beginner to experienced, we find the best way for all to just get out there and have fun; just being in the ocean is what it’s all about!

“In Hawai‘i, we’re exposed to the ocean at a very young age,” she shares, speaking from experience. “We’re very blessed to enjoy it and so we provide the resources for those who decide to enjoy its magic. We’ve got the total package—great location, great service, great products! We’re proud of the environment we’ve created, and will continue the tradition from generation to generation.”

Title: Smith's Fern Grotto Cruise
Content:
Unwind and leave your troubles behind on a riverboat ride. Throw away the watch and shift into low gear for a lazy cruise along the serene Wailua River to lush Fern Grotto. As your shaded riverboat winds its way through tropical rainforest, take in a family tradition to enjoy the hula dancers moving to the sounds of Hawaiian music.

Read our review of the Wailua River Cruise here.

Content: Renting a car is easy with Advantage Rent A Car. Make your getaway in one of their vehicles designed for the traveler in mind. You've got the advantage with nationwide and statewide locations, plus discounts for government employees. Book online. Adventure awaits!

Title: K1 Speed
Content:
Rev up your adrenaline as you get behind the wheel of an electric kart at this indoor raceway that now sports a redesigned track layout with an all-new Protex karting barrier system. Racers will enjoy greater visibility going through corners and hairpins and greater impact absorption. After a short intro, gear up, then hit the gas, easing into tricky hairpin turns, then racing down the straightaway at speeds of up to 45mph. Great fun for the family! Perfect for novice and more experienced racers alike!

NEW, EASY PRICING FOR 2015: 1 Race - $19.95, 2 Races - $35 (save $5), 3 Races - $45 (save $15). Annual License - $6 (good at all locations). SPECIALS: K1 Speedpass - $49 (includes 2 Races, Annual License, T-shirt). Weekday Special - 3 Races for $39 (Monday through Thursday).

Title: Dole Plantation
Content:
One of the most popular visitor attractions in Hawai‘i, Dole Plantation is located past the small community of Wahiawā and a few miles before the surf town of Hale‘iwa. It’s a little oasis of greenery with towering trees, a garden, the Pineapple Express Train and the three-acre Pineapple Garden Maze crafted by 14,000 colorful Hawaiian plants.

There’s something for everyone—young keiki will love riding the train, which features audio narration about the pineapple and agriculture industry along with music by local recording artists, Manoa DNA. Young adults will want to make their way through the maze, recognized in 2008 by Guinness World Records as the world’s largest. And older adults will enjoy the Plantation Garden, a self-guided tour that tells the story of O‘ahu’s plantation days, which played a huge role in shaping our island’s culture.

When hunger hits, you’ll want to stop at the Plantation Grille for local favorites, burgers, salads and more—and, of course, you can’t leave without trying the world-famous Dole Whip! Perfect for a hot day under the sun! Merchandise and souvenirs are also available in the gift shop.

Title: Magnum Helicopters
Content:
Magnum Helicopters is unlike any other helicopter company—jump on their "Doors Off Adventure" tours and you'll hear, see and feel the difference! Feel the wind in your face and enjoy unobstructed views, and experience the most excellent rush of your life as you take in panoramic views across the island from Makapu‘u Point to the North Shore.

And if their helicopters look familiar, it's because they've been used in CBS's "Hawaii Five-O" and "Magnum P.I." television series.

Tours are weather permitting.

Title: Hawaii Cabriolet Tours
Content: Schedule your own agenda on an exclusive private tour of Oahu with Hawaii Cabriolet Tours. Feel the tropical sun on your face and wind in your hair with the islands only convertible tour. No need for maps; just jump in the car and travel at your own pace with a knowledgeable local guide at the wheel. Seating for one to three passengers is available. Tours daily.

Title: Live Bait Sportfishing
Content: Live Bait Sportfishing takes you out to deep waters off the Makaha coast where large pelagic predatory fish congregate. Beneath the surface, giant blue marlin, mahimahi, wahoo, yellowfin, bigeye and skipjack tuna roam the waters, and this is where you'll find some of the best sportfishing experiences in the islands. Don't miss out on your chance to explore Hawaiʻi's majestic marine life. Tours daily.

Title: Dolphin Excursions
Content:
Perhaps you’ve cruised along the Waikīkī coastline on a ship or raft and seen the city lights and dense collection of manmade structures. Here’s an option that will help you breathe deeper—a dolphin or whale watch outing with Dolphin Excursions.

The company is located on O‘ahu’s west side and based out of Waianae Boat Harbor where there’s less of a crowd competing for the view. 

“The harbor is in the middle of the Leeward coast,” explains Jenna Morris, senior captain and marine biologist, “where many species of mammals are found nearshore including whales, dolphins and monk seals.”

So hop aboard Nai‘a I and you’ll cruise along the coast from Barber’s Point all the way to remote Kā‘ena Point, passing maybe a couple of condos, the electric plant and the small communities of Nānākuli and Wai‘anae. But what you’ll be unprepared for is the wildly beautiful, uninterrupted stretch of the Wai‘anae mountain range. It’s definitely worth the drive to the west side!

Dolphin Excursions provides an open-ocean, safari-style dolphin tour that follows federal protocols for passive viewing of resident Spinner dolphins. This allows for flexibility to search for marine life and includes stopping at the best snorkel sites, as well as catering to guest requests. Marine biologists and naturalists, and at least one certified lifeguard for every six guests (maximum of 22 per tour) are part of the crew. They also assist with marine research by submitting photo identification of dolphins they encounter.

“There’s something about our boat that makes each interaction with wildlife special,” says Morris. “Our boat is quiet and sits less than three feet above the water allowing not only us to see the wildlife, but for the wildlife to see US. I’ll never forget the first time a 45-foot whale gently swam up to our 32-foot boat, and made eye contact with me. I try to share experiences like that with guests from all over the world to inspire and educate about how significant and fragile our ocean ecosystem is.”

During humpback whale season, join one of their dedicated whale tours. “We offer three-hour whale tours through March,” says Morris. “We snorkel with turtles and search for whales, and a picnic-style lunch on the boat is included.” And if you don’t see a whale on the tour, each guest receives a free return trip voucher! Same goes for the dolphin tour. 

Roundtrip transportation from Waikīkī and Ko ‘Olina hotels is also included, but if you’re driving, you’ll find lots of free parking available at the harbor. They also have their own bathrooms, changing rooms and outside showers. Plus enjoy a complimentary lunch at Spinners Cafe following the tour (if lunch isn’t provided on the boat).

Situated in Wai‘anae, Dolphin Excursions keeps community ties strong by making local donations of service that include funeral boat outings to celebrate the life of a deceased family member. They also assist with state ocean safety rescues and work closely with local, state and federal marine mammal research programs.

Book a Dolphin Excursion Today!

View Spinner Dolphins in their natural environment. Bottlenose, Spotted and other larger dolphins are usually also found.

Title: Climb Works - Keana Farms
Content:
The CLIMB in CLIMB Works Keana Farms stands for Challenge. Learn. Inspire. Master. Believe.

At CLIMB Works Keana Farms you’ll get to experience the best zipline course on Oahu. There are eight side-by-side zipline runs, designed so you can see the North Shore’s famous beaches, farms and lush mountains with the person of your choice right next to you.

The adventure starts with a 10-minute, two-mile ATV ride to the top of the mountain. “You’ll go by farms, through the jungle and up the mountainside,” says General Manager Jesse McVey, “seeing some of the best landscape Hawaii has to offer.

“Along the tour you’ll encounter rappels, sky bridges, scenic boardwalks, and a couple surprises,” says McVey. “They make for some fun activities that challenge you in a safe and controlled way.”

Title: Paradise Cruisers
Content: There's something to be said for exploring the island via a guided tour. It's comfortable, worry free, plus you'll invariably learn tidbits about Hawaii's history and culture through a narration. But if you prefer taking your vacation into your own hands, and believe that wrong turns are just another opportunity for adventure, then you'll want to look into a vehicle rental. The choices abound so do your research. You can also opt to Cruise Paradise in Style with a motorcycle, bicycle, moped or Baby T-Rex rental from Paradise Cruisers. Imagine cruising around the island under a warm tropical sun on a solid V-Twin Harley-Davidson. It doesn't get much cooler than that. Or how about zipping along on a 150cc or 600cc motorcycle. Bicycles and mopeds are perfect for shorter distances.

Title: USS Battleship Missouri Memorial
Content: Having served with honor through three wars with a crew that spans three generations, the Mighty Mo is dedicated to preserving the experiences of her former crew members and sharing her story and place in history. See the plaque that marks the site where the Instrument of Surrender was signed, officially ending WWII and beginning a new era of friendship and peace. General admission includes a guided or audio tour. You may also upgrade to the Heart of Missouri Tour, which takes you deep into the battleship to learn the mechanics behind its speed and firepower.
