Title: Nau Wale No Tours
Content: Private Tours of the island through the eyes of a local. This is for the traveler that seeks something new, different, authentic, and personalized to their interests. Explore Hidden Gems and learn about Hawaiian History and Culture. Go off the Beaten Path!

Title: The North Shore Beach Bus
Content:
The North Shore Beach Bus is a great way to explore the beautiful beaches of Honolulu, Hawaii. The bus stops at several popular locations on Oahu's North Shore, such as Waimea Bay, Shark's Cove and Sunset Beach. The bus runs throughout the summer months and allows visitors to explore these serene and stunning beach destinations with ease. The North Shore Beach Bus is an affordable and convenient way to discover Hawaii's stunning north shore. The bus runs on a regular schedule, so you'll never miss out on the chance to experience the breathtaking views of these beaches. The bus also provides passengers with access to restroom facilities along the route and complimentary WiFi for those who wish to stay connected while enjoying a day at the beach. The North Shore Beach Bus is a great option for those looking to make the most of their Hawaiian vacation. The bus offers an easy and affordable way to explore one of the world's most beautiful places without breaking the bank. So join The North Shore Beach Bus today and see all that Honolulu, Hawaii has to offer!

Book The North Shore Beach Bus Today!

Tour of North Shore & Sightseeing

Visitors can save time and money by participating in this fun and exciting tour with informative and passionate tour guides and drivers.

8 - 9 Hrs.

Title: Jack's Diving Locker
Content: Boasting the most complete line of scuba and snorkel gear on the Big Isle, Jack's Diving Locker has been in business since 1981. With a state-of-the-art dive facility in the heart of Kailua-Kona, Jack's offers a variety of boat dives, manta ray night snorkels, dolphin/whalewatch & snorkel cruises, kids and teens activities, dive instruction, careers in diving, private charters and retail store. Beginners welcome.

Title: Adventure X Boat Tours
Content: Adventure X Boat Tours travels up north for a secluded, first-hand look at humpback whales in season, monk seals, turtles, manta rays and dolphins. Enjoy resident spinner dolphins from the vessel or jump in the water to watch them in their domain. With small, intimate tours of no more than 20, Adventure X caters to guests with local hospitality and shares knowledge of the isles and ocean. Departs Puako Boat Ramp.

Title: Kōloa Rum™ Company Store & Tasting Room
Content:
Kōloa Rum is truly a unique find on the island. Their award-winning, premium Hawaiian rum is available in a variety of flavors—the most popular are Kaua‘i Coconut Rum and Kaua‘i Dark Rum. The newest release is their first Aged Rum—Kaua‘i Reserve Aged Rum—in a single 12-barrel batch, aged at least three years in once-used, charred American oak barrels. It comes in at 92 proof with notes of mellow oak, orange peel and toasted vanilla. Enjoy it mixed sipped neat or on ice (highly recommended!). All products and gift items are available at the tasting room (valid ID required) and store at Kilohana Plantation.

Sample the wide variety of rums using Hawaiian "tall cane" sugar and tropical rainwater at the Tasting Room & Company Store at Kilohana Plantation. See the 50-gallon copper demonstration still and shop for a variety of rums and island-style gifts and souvenirs. Tastings every half hour starting 10 am daily.

Title: Hawaii Shark Encounters
Content: You're about to experience one of lifes most powerful moments as you dangle in a cage above the ocean floor surrounded by Hawaii's native sharks. See a Galapagos, Sandbar or rare Tiger shark up close behind a Poly Glass window. Fear will be replaced by wonder, respect and appreciation of these magnificent ocean predators as you learn about their biology, ecology and behavior. With respect to the ocean environment and its inhabitants, Hawaii Shark Encounters doesn't troll, chum or anchor.

Title: Holo Holo Charters
Content:
Seize the adventure today on a custom Kauai-built boat! Our four vessels will get you to the fun faster, so you have more time to snorkel, sightsee, relax and enjoy the pristine waters and spectacular cliffs of the Napali Coast & Hawaii’s Forbidden Island of Niihau.

Holo Holo Charters was founded on Kauai in 1997 with a simple idea: build amazing, high speed boats that can take Kauai’s challenging ocean conditions in stride and deliver visitors to remote and dramatic locations around Kauai and Niihau.

Holo Holo Charters is the only boat company to offer the Niihau + Napali Coast Super Tour daily. After you adventure up the majestic Napali Coast we will head across the channel to Niihau’s north shore for some world-class snorkeling at Lehua Crater. This small, crescent-shaped island is home to one of the best snorkeling locations in all of Hawaii with pristine reefs, unique underwater lava formations and abundant sea life. On this all-inclusive tour, you will get to see both the Forbidden Island of Niihau and the Napali Coast in one amazing day.

Holo Holo Charters is committed to promoting environmental stewardship, cultural sensitivity, community well-being, and quality education within the visitor industry. Holo Holo Charters is a member of the Hawaii EcoTourism Association, part of the Kauai-Made program, and the only boat tour company on Kauai that is certified as Dolphin Smart, promoting responsible viewing of all marine life.

Visit us online today to see all our amazing Kauai & Niihau Boat Tours.

Book A Holo Holo Charter Today!

Na Pali Adventure & Snorkel

Get up close and personal to the majestic Napali Coast on our custom-built rafts while we explore sea caves, lava tunnels, waterfalls, and hidden beaches.

4 Hrs.

Na Pali Snorkel & Sail

Enjoy a boat tour of the beautiful Na Pali Coast with time to snorkel and discover the amazing aquatic wildlife off the shores of Kauai.

5 Hrs.

Leila Na Pali Sunset Sail

There’s nothing like a Kauai sunset. And there’s no place better to see it than on the water. Watch the colors of the coastline change as the sun sinks into the ocean; it’s truly gorgeous.

Title: Mauna Loa Helicopter Tours - Big Island
Content:
The Big Island has it all. Featuring eleven of the world’s thirteen recognized climate zones, Hawai’i is truly one of nature’s splendors. From active volcanos and black sand beaches to lush forests and cascading waterfalls, this is a Hawaiian helicopter adventure not to be missed.

About Mauna Loa Helicopter Tours

Mauna Loa Helicopters has been offering private sightseeing tours over Kauai since 2006, and we recently expanded to offer tour operations from our island bases on Oahu and the Big Island. Along with our impeccable safety record, we take pride in making each tour a spectacular, personalized experience. We exclusively use the incredibly reliable and energy-efficient Robinson helicopters.

Our Pilots

Mauna Loa Helicopters started out as a flight training school and has been training professional helicopter pilots for 22 years. As a result, all of our pilots are highly trained and have years of experience flying over Hawaii’s varied terrain and navigating its uniquely diverse weather conditions. They are also Certified Flight Instructors, especially skilled and current in safety operations. Because of this blend of skills, they are a great source of information about not only local landmarks, but also the operation of helicopters and the unique aspects of life in Hawai’i. During your flight, each pilot provides a personal narration accompanied by an individually selected soundtrack.

Book A Mauna Loa Helicopter Tour Today!

Big Island Helicopter Experience

For those of you who want it all, the full island VIP adventure tour is for you! It’s all of our helicopter tours of the Big Island rolled into one, plus an active volcano!

2 Hrs.

7 Yrs. & Older

DETAILS

Kona Coast Helicopter Tours

If you are short on time (or during whale season wish to see some whales) this is the tour for you! Book your 30-minute flight today!

0.5 Hrs.

7 Yrs. & Older

DETAILS

Kona Sunset Helicopter Experience

Join us on a truly remarkable flight that will take you from Kona Airport along the magnificent coastline during the “Golden Hour”.

0.5 Hrs.

7 Yrs. & Older

DETAILS

Magical Waterfalls Helicopter Tour

The Big Island is home to some of the most stunning waterfalls in all of Hawaii. Upon departing from Kona International Airport, we whisk you away to explore the seven windward valleys of Kohala!

1.25 Hrs.

7 Yrs. & Older

DETAILS

Title: Easybreath Snorkel Rental
Content: Designed in France and made in Italy, the Easybreath snorkel mask is an award-winning, innovative product that allows you to breathe normally through the mouth and nose while allowing a 180-degree panoramic view of the marine world you can even go completely underwater. Great for all ages, beginners and expert snorkelers. No fogging, no clearing, no hassle! A U.S. veteran, locally owned and operated business. Online reservations are required.

Title: Fly Hi Ziplines
Content: You'll have a memorable experience with Fly HI Ziplines-Kona. Try the Zipline Ninja game where points are scored for hitting designated targets with a special version of a ninjato swordtargets appear in flight on each zipline. Best to reserve a day in advance, walk-ins based on availability. Kamaaina discounts with local ID required.

Title: Maverick Helicopters - Kauai
Content: Take flight with Maverick Helicopters and soak in the beauty of Kauaʻi from a different perspective. With over 21 years of experience and a commitment to VIP-level service, Maverick Helicopters ensures each guest enjoys an unparalleled flight experience. Choose between the Kauai Discovery and Kauai Explorer packages, both of which feature sweeping views of the island’s natural wonders that are inaccessible on the ground. Enjoy your aerial tour in the comfort of an exclusive ECO-Star helicopter featuring state-of-the-art “quiet technology.”

Title: Jeep Tours Hawaii
Content: Explore the island like a local with Hawaii Jeep Tours, the only official, legally modified Safari Jeep tours on the island. Intimate semi-private and private tours of two to four people embark on an island exploration with local, knowledgeable master guides who love sharing their home with visitors while offering great personal service. Three tours are available: get an overall picture of Oahu on the Circle Island Tour; if you love the series, Hawaii Five-O, the Hawaii Five-O Tour will take you to iconic film locations; or you love local food, then the Aloha Plate Food Tour with Lanai Tabura is the one for you.

Title: Oahu Photography Tours
Content: Capture your best and most memorable vacation images with Oahu Photography Tours. Tours are designed for photographers of all levels, so guides will not only help you take that great shot, but will help you to understand how you got that shot. Explore the island with like-minded photo bugs on a variety of tours that take you from sunrise to sunset. There's even a tour that stops at one location where you'll photograph the moon and learn various techniques on how you can capture its' many moods.

Title: Silver Falls Ranch
Content:
If your vacation has become a whirlwind of activities, shopping, and driving from one spot to another, it’s time to put the gear in park. Of course you want to make the most of every minute to discover the Garden Isle, but slow down. Here’s a tip: Kaua‘i is the slowest-paced of all the Hawaiian Islands, making it the perfect environment in which to relax. Take it easy. Breathe.

If you need help to get into your zen, let the expert handlers and horses of Silver Falls Ranch guide you there.

With a variety of trails situated within 300 acres of pristine Hawaiian wilderness, Silver Falls Ranch offers horseback riding experiences to suit every skill level from zero to expert. Three different outings take you through an 80-acre botanical garden home to calming streams, native plants including exotic orchids, wildlife, as well as offers breathtaking views of the northern Makaleha mountain range. In Hawaiian, makaleha translates to “eyes looking about in wonder or admiration,” which is something you’ll be doing throughout your horseback ride.

Silver Falls Ranch offers three guided tours offered daily:

Tropical Trail Adventure – Explore Kauai’s interior on this three-hour ride, taking hidden trails leading to an ancient volcanic caldera to the base of Mount Namahana. See exotic natural growth, indigenous ferns and wild orchids along the way and stop for a lovely picnic and swim at Silver Falls. Rides daily.

Silver Falls Ride – Relish a leisurely horseback ride through a tropical botanical reserve with magnificent views of the 2,800-foot Makaleha mountain range. Your destination is lovely Silver Falls where you’ll enjoy snacks and refreshments before cooling off in the natural pool. Rides daily.

Hawaiian Discover Ride – Riders of all ability levels are welcome to take the trail less traveled into the remote interior of Kalihiwai and Kamo‘okoa Ridge. Along the way, you’ll ride through a lush valley along the winding streams surrounded by tropicals and, at the end, close up views of Mount Namahana are guaranteed to amaze. Rides daily.

Rides for groups and gatherings, as well as private outings are available. A horseback ride is perfect for family or class reunions, anniversaries, weddings, corporate events and more. Events are easily customizable.

If you’re looking for a more private experience, your wish can be accommodated as well. You pick the pace, leisurely or brisk, based on your riding ability. Expert guides can also provide more one-on-one instruction for those who need a little more attention. As they say, it’s your day—they’re just along for the ride!

All rides begin with an orientation and safety briefing, and rides go at a comfortable walking pace.

Happy horses make for a great riding experience, and at Silver Falls Ranch, every horse is happy! The horses who get to call this place home are loved and well cared for, and the experts here are great at pairing up riders to their mounts so you’ll enjoy the best possible ride on the Garden Island.

Sixteen-year-old Ikaika is a sweet Belgian/Quarter Horse cross. Popoki, a 14-year-old American Paint Horse, is a favorite with children because of her gentle demeanor. Akua, meaning “god” in Hawaiian, is a capable, handsome steed with “dinner-plate”-sized hooves; his description shows just how much this Spotted Draft is loved by all. Modella hails from Modella, Australia, and is an Australian Thoroughbred, who was a professional polo athlete. Check out the website for a preview of these trail experts and others, who are more than the typical workhorse!

So, really, there’s no reason you’ll need a vacation after your vacation when you explore the Garden Isle at just the right pace.

Title: Aloha Motorsports
Content: Rent and ride the adventure of a lifetime on Maui! Aloha Motorsports offers the latest sports bikes, dual sports and cruisers from Harley-Davidson, Honda, Suzuki and BMW; mopeds and scooters by Genuine, Lance and Wolf; as well as the ultimate classic cars like a 1966 Shelby Cobra. Its time to get up close to the islands natural beauty and explore it on the open road. The friendly and knowledgeable Aloha agents will recommend rides to scenic spots aroundMaui, including places to eat and stop for photos. There are two rental locations, Kihei and Lahaina, and a full-service shop in Lahaina. If youre staying in WestMaui, you can take advantage of free pick-up and drop-off service for your vehicle.

Title: Rocking H Island Adventures
Content: Rocking H Island Adventures offers a variety of ocean sports. Choose from a dramatic manta ray night adventure, boat charters for certified scuba divers and stand up paddle and kayak rentals. Zip around on your personal jet ski in the 100-acre ocean area. Go solo, tandem or just watch and snorkel from the offshore island. Ask about the activity package deals.

Title: Pedego Big Island Electric Bikes
Content: Think beach cruiser with a little pep! Pedego Big Island Electric Bikes operate like a regular bike, with seven gears; but with a simple turn of the throttle the bikes spring to life so you can fly up a hill or tackle a strong headwind. The quiet, eco-friendly bikes are powered by a battery pack; it lasts 40 miles and goes up to 20 mph. Reservations encouraged, walk-ins welcome. Kamaaina and military discounts.

Title: Flumin Kohala
Content: The Kohala Ditch has been called a masterpiece by some of those who, over its 110 years of existence, have explored the route from its headwaters in the high forests of the Kohala Mountains to its terminus over 20 miles away in the lowland sugar cane fields near Hawi. Hand drilled and blasted over a century ago out of solid rock deep in the canyons of Kohala, “The Ditch” brought water and prosperity to the people of Kohala. Hundreds of brave men risked their lives, and many perished, in its construction. To this day, the Ditch remains witness to a heroic feat of engineering skill, physical prowess, and, above all, human determination. Flumin’ Kohala offers a rare opportunity to explore this remarkable hand-wrought wonder and the pristine Hawaiian landscapes it crosses. Join them on a guided tour through three scenic miles of Hawaiian history. Seated in custom four-man kayaks, guests delve underground and float through 1,000-foot tunnels dripping with spring water. Flumin’ Kohala has garnered many five-star reviews on TripAdvisor in which customers have lauded the company’s knowledgeable guides who provide lots of information on the island’s history and culture as only locals would know. The amazing views are complementary! Soar high over rushing streams and float across the mountainside via elevated flumes. Quietly meander through thick forests by way of winding concrete channels. Go flumin’ to see, touch, hear and feel the hidden beauty of Hawai‘i. Leisurely paced, educational, fascinating and fun, it is the perfect Hawaiian eco-activity for families and groups.

Title: Tachibana Enterprises
Content: Tachibana Enterprises offers tee time reservations at some of Oahus favorite courses such as Ko Olina Golf Club, Kapolei Golf Course, Hawaii Prince Golf Club and Ewa Beach Golf Club. They provide hotel pick up, equipment rentals and reservations-all you need to do is show up!

Title: Aloha Trikke
Content: Ready for a fun and unique experience? Aloha Trikke is the only company of its kind in the Aloha State that provides tours of Diamond Head, Kapiolani Park and Waikiki on an innovative electric vehicle, the Trikke. This light, three-wheeled vehicle is designed for stability, cornering and maneuverability and is portable so you can take it anywhere. Aloha Trikke is all about creating a personalized, one-of-a-kind tour so when you're out on a Trikke, you'll hear historical facts, plus have lots of opportunities for photos in small groups. Communications system, helmets, cargo nets with tote bags, beverages and music are provided. A GoPro rental is available for those who wish to record their experiences. Reservations are highly suggested.

Title: Aloha Blue Charters
Content:
If you're in the mood for snorkeling and a little fishing, or you'd like to look for whales on a private adventure, Aloha Blue Charters can make your dream come true. With its power catamaran, Hokua, an eco-friendly, jet driven vessel, Aloha Blue will take you cruising to snorkel off Molokini, on an ocean adventure to bottom fish, or glide over the waves to whale watch with a marine naturalist on board. Private charters with catering service can be customized for a special occasion. 

Book An Aloha Blue Charter Today!

Aloha Bottom Fishing

Our Captain and crew have over 25 years combined experience fishing in Hawaiian waters. Up to 14 anglers, plus additional riders in comfort.

4 Hrs.

DETAILS

Deluxe Morning Molokini & Turtle Town Snorkel

Enjoy snorkeling at both the world-famous Molokini crater and Turtle Town aboard Maui’s most exciting charter vessel.

5 Hrs.

DETAILS

Private Charter - 4 Hours

Onboard Hokua you will enjoy a unique Private Charter for your party. Your destination is negotiable. You have the option to Sport fish, Bottom fish, Snorkel, and Whale Watch all in one trip.

4 Hrs.

DETAILS

2 Hour Private Charter

Onboard Hokua you will enjoy a unique Private Charter for your party. Your destination is negotiable.

2 Hrs.

DETAILS

Title: Maui Mobility Systems
Content:
Service that helps visitors with limited mobility enjoy Maui the same way other visitors do is what Maui Mobility is all about. If you've been injured or can't walk for an extended period or have trouble standing in one place, Maui Mobility offers state-of-the-art scooters with four wheels, adjustable swivel seats, baskets and even headlights for you or a family members convenience.

These scooters go up to nine miles on a charge and recharge in three to four hours. They are delivered right to your resortor condo. Customized rates for corporate groups and color coordination for wedding parties are also available. If you rent two scooters during the same stay, youll receive 50% off the second scooter rate. Guided scooter tours can be arranged.

Title: Captain Jack's Island Grill
Content:
Haul Yer Booty upstairs to Captain Jack's Island Grill and enjoy a breezy birds eye view of historic Lahaina Town. Opened in 2010 by the same family that owns Cool Cat Café, Captain Jack's offers a casual pirate themed place to belly up or bring the family.
Their menu offers a wide range of choices from award winning Lilikoi beer battered fish and chips to authentic Philly cheesesteaks, fresh fish, calamari, salads, pastas and entrees. Everyone in the family is sure to find something they'll enjoy. Watch the world go by with an Old Lahaina Lava Flow, Treasure Chest Margarita or any of their local beers on draft. Happy hour on drinks offered from 2pm-5pm. Open daily from 10:30am-9pm.

Title: Big City Diner
Content:
While washing dishes at Flamingo Chuckwagon, attending high school and playing sports, Lane Muraoka got bit. At 16 years old, after talking to college counselors, Muraoka, founder and owner of Big City Diner (BCD), knew what he wanted. “I knew one day I wanted to open my own restaurant,” he says. “So I went to college to learn about hotel and restaurant management and got a degree in hotel and restaurant management at the University of Denver.” 

For a time he worked for Stouffer Restaurants in Ohio and Chicago, then returned home where he worked with Wally Wok in 1987, owning a small share in their Chinese home delivery restaurant service. Moving on to Pizza Bob’s, he owned a small share as well. “Like in the whole pizza, I owned the pepperoni,” says Lane, with a laugh. 

He started looking at places for his own venture—a family diner with a bar—in 1998, and found a spot in Kaimuki. It’s been 21 years since then. 

What does Muraoka attribute BCD’s success to? “It’s a place of comfort, basically,” he says. “You can bring your friends, family, just come as you are. We had Governor Waiheʻe come in with his people a few months back, and they sat down next to Japanese visitors, who were next to four ladies having a girl’s luncheon, who were next to a family from California with their toddler.” More than anything, Muraoka wants customers to feel “just like they had dinner at grandma’s house.”

The menu at BCD is filled with American classics with a local twist, plus local favorites morning, noon and night. “We offer a wide variety because we know that will appeal to local families,” explains Muraoka. “It’s very common to see three generations sitting at one table. When your grandma and grandpa are 70, 80, even 90 years old, they have different needs. You also have the parents, the little ones…so even the for the children’s menu, I wanted it to have healthy options.” So, real chicken breast, yes, chicken nuggets, no. Even the hotdog is 100% all beef, no fillers.

Muraoka likes to eat healthy himself and wouldn’t put anything on the menu that he wouldn’t feed his own family. “For breakfast I eat the egg white tofu omelet all the time with a side of chili sambal sauce, because I like it spicy,” he laughs. “For lunch time, I eat all the different salads. We created a lot of healthy things because I watch what I eat. Yesterday, I had a salmon salad with mesclun and roma tomatoes, and a side of brown rice.” He pauses. “But then I’ll eat the Kim Chee fried rice with two eggs and a side of corn beef hash, so it varies.”

Muraoka is also known to ‘frequent’ his restaurants. “There’s a severe labor shortage!” he exclaims, laughing. “No, I like to stay in touch with our guests and our employees. You know, they see the boss get in there and working, then everyone helps out, right? Everyone jumps in and does whatever needs to be done to take care of the guests. That’s number one.” 

BCD also happens to be the perfect spot to come in from the rain and catch a game or two on the TV monitors at any location. “In the mornings, people like to have the news on, so we’ll have CNN, Fox and then local news,” he says. 

But when it comes to local high school playoffs such as volleyball, football or when University of Hawaii is playing, Muraoka advises his managers to play what the surrounding community would want to watch. “So let’s say Mililani or Waipahu is playing and we’re at the Waipi‘o store, we want to put those games on for the local community. They can’t make it down to the stadium or arena; we want to make sure that’s on for the local people.”

For someone who knew at age 16 what his goal was, Muraoka is a down-to-earth local boy who’s had great success. “We’re very thankful for the support of the community, as well as the visitor community. And big credit to our employees all these years for taking care of our guests to make sure everyone’s treated like family.”

Open for breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night. Locations in Kaimuki, Kailua Foodland Center, Waipio, Pearlridge Center and Windward Mall.

Title: Chili's Grill & Bar
Content: Smoky and delicious baby back ribs, Big Mouth Burgers, sizzling skillet entrees, fresh salads, fajitas and quesadillas. Chili's is always looking for ways to serve its customers the best flavors of the Southwest while finding ways to make its menu items affordable and fun. Look for bold flavors, delicious combos and a good time!

Title: Ilima Restaurant
Content: Ease into your vacation with French Toast Island Style made with Hawaiian sweet bread, the Waikiki Sunrise served with two eggs, hash browns, toast and choice of meat, or fill up on the Ilima Breakfast Buffet. For lunch, try the Pulled Pork Guava BBQ Sandwich or choose from local favorites and noodle dishes. Catering to an American-friendly palate.

Title: Legends Sports Pub
Content: Huge on all kinds of sports, the pub features games on 11 monitors, plus a full range of beers and Hawaiian drinks that'll keep you happy during time outs. Pull up a chair and make new friends over a cold one at this friendly neighborhood pub. Wifi is available.

Title: Mahaloha Burger
Content:
Experience the Aloha at Mahaloha Burger! The burgers here are made with fresh beef daily from 100 percent free-range premium beef from the Big Island. You won’t find any fillers, preservatives, antibiotics or growth hormones here. Mahaloha is the home of the original Loco Moco Burger. This popular burger will satisfy your flavor craving featuring a local twist: the Loco Moco Burger includes crispy friend onions, french mayo and savory gravy topped with an egg. Other popular burgers are the signature Mahaloha Burger along with the Avocado Swiss and Blue Cheese Bacon Burger. Try their other menu items and local beers too!

Mahaloha Burger's Ala Moana location is now serving up delicious, local-style breakfast items. Choose from Loco Moco, Portuguese Sausage & Spam Egg Combo, Strawberry Pancakes, Banana Pancakes, Bacon & Egg and more.

Three locations:

• Ala Moana-Lanai at Ala Moana Center, 1450 Ala Moana Blvd, 808-377-4484
• Kailua- 143 Hekili St, 808-263-2777
• Waikiki- 2233 Kalakaua Ave (Royal Hawaiian Food Court), 808-926-6500

Title: Moose Mcgillycuddy's

Title: Oceanarium Restaurant
Content: The ever-popular Oceanarium Restaurant is a huge draw for locals and visitors alike any day of the week. First, there's the three-story, 280,000-gallon aquarium that showcases marine life. Then there's the ample buffet for breakfast and dinner offering live action stations and fresh local fare. Ask about the Sunday Champagne Brunch too. Serving breakfast, lunch and dinner daily.

Title: Betty's Beach Cafe
Content: Settle in for a beautiful view, friendly service and food specials like the Wednesday whole Maine lobster dinner and Saturday slow-roasted prime rib. Greet the morning with Eggs Benedict, a dining favorite. Bar open till midnight.

Title: Cool Cat Cafe
Content:
Located in the heart of Lahaina Town, with views of historic Front Street, the Banyan Tree and Lahaina Harbor, Cool Cat Café is a favorite stop among locals and travelers. Started over 30 years ago in California by father and son, and now grandson, they are a family owned and operated labor of love. They pride themselves on continuing to make the same great burger year after year.
 
Voted “Best Burger on Maui” since 2004, everyone in your family is sure to find something they like. Choose from their 16 specialty burgers, the freshest locally caught fish, fall off the bone ribs, salads, sandwiches and entrees. Enjoy a variety of vegetarian options, as well as an allergy marked menu, and designated gluten free fryer. Wash it all down with an old fashioned, hand dipped milkshake or a specialty cocktail from their full bar featuring 18 beers on draft. The casual, family friendly atmosphere is sure to not disappoint.
No reservations, walk-ins only. Cool Cat Café offers a separate happy hour food and drink menu from 3pm-6pm and live music nightly. Outdoor open air and inside air-conditioned seating available with validated parking. Open daily from10:30am-9pm.

Title: Pacific Whale Foundation Dinner Cruise
Content: Watch the setting sun paint the sky on a premier at-sea dining experience. Enjoy tropical cocktails, wine and local microbrews while listening to live musical entertainment. Four tantalizing chef-prepared entrees offer options for a variety of palates. Cruise the Maui coastline served table-side by attentive waiters.

Title: Huggo's
Content: A menu highlighting fresh seafood, a spot right above the water and expert service wins raves from Huggo's patrons time and again. It's a favorite island gathering spot! Huggo's serves dinner daily.

Title: Ken's House Of Pancakes
Content: Voted best breakfast for an amazing 17 years in a row is no fluke. The friendly folks here are obviously doing something right! Stop by any time of day for the standard American fare with a local twist: French toast made with Portuguese sweet bread; a bowl of hot saimin perfect for rainy Hilo days; oxtail stew; and more.
Image Alt Text: Ken's House Of Pancakes - Big Island, Hawaii||

Title: Brennecke's Beach Broiler
Content: Take in beautiful ocean vistas, sip a Koloa rum Mai Tai or Tai Chi, and relax in a casual, open-air dining venue that's right on the beach. Menu feature delicious daily fresh island fish specials, along with prime rib, pupus and more. Enjoy good food, friends, fun!

Title: Joes On The Green
Content: Start your morning overlooking the golf course and ocean with a hearty breakfast like Eggs Benedict and banana macadamia nut pancakes. A variety of lunch offerings include coconut shrimp, Michael's BBQ ribs and many salad varieties.

Title: Keoki's Paradise
Content: Enjoy live contemporary Hawaiian music nightly. Every Wed.-Sun. enjoy hula in the evenings. Open 11 a.m.-11:30 p.m. with Aloha Hour at the Bamboo Bar 3-5 p.m. daily with a late-night happy hour running 9:30-10:30 p.m. Enjoy delicious appetizers and tropical drinks in a beautiful location. Poipu Shopping Village, 2360 Kiahuna Plantation Dr., Poipu, (808) 742-7534, keokisparadise.com.

Title: Kountry Style Kitchen
Content: Enjoy a breakfast omelette and select from 30 different fillings, plus more breakfast choices like mouth-watering banana or macadamia nut pancakes with tropical syrups and fruit, or French toast. The kalua pig plate and mahimahi plate are popular lunch selections. You'll find simple, homestyle cooking thats great for the family at an affordable price.

Title: Seaview Terrace
Content:
Seaview Terrace at the Grand Hyatt Kaua‘i Resort & Spa offers an elegant way to relax and enjoy drinks and delicious fare. Cap the day with a creative cocktail, wine or beer. A suggestion is Kauai’s Red Dirt Margarita made with Asian spices and tequila.

Two of the favorite menu items are the Ahi Poke Bowl made with fresh isle fish, avocado, cucumber, spicy aioli and fried onion, as well as the Makaweli Local Grass-Fed Burger. A special menu is available for kids.

Island music and hula are 5-8 p.m. nightly with torch-lighting on Tuesday, Friday and Saturday.

Title: Kalapaki Joe's
Content: Drop by the Western most Sports Bar in the U.S. featuring televised sports and Kauai's Best Happy Hou r3-6 p.m.daily. Everything on the menu sounds really good and they've got it all: lots of appetizers, salads, burgers and sandwiches, tacos, hefty entrees and a kids menu. Signature dishes include Joes Famous Wings, the Famous Surfers Nachos made with kalua pig, and Fresh Fish Tacos. Two locations: Kukui Grove and Poipu.

Title: MCS Grill
Content: Open for lunch and dinner serving salads, burgers, plate lunches, saimin and loco moco for lunch while dinner offers pastas like shrimp scampi, Asian BBQ Porb Ribs, vegetarian meatloaf and the MCS Combo: Hawaiian chili pepper or teri-fried chicken and fried saimin. Soft drinks.

Title: Tropics Tap House
Content: Located in Pucks Alley near the University of Hawaii at Manoa, Tropics Tap House offers more than 50 taps, including a variety of mainstream and craft brews. The kitchen in this tropical gastropub serves up delicious homemade American pub fare such as wings, appetizers, sliders and pizza at reasonable prices. Taco Tuesdays are from 5-8 p.m. Live music and drink specials available too.

Title: ABC Stores - Maui
Content:
ABC STORES, The Store With Aloha!  Our friendly atmosphere, large item selection and multiple locations makes it easy and convenient to fulfill all of your shopping needs!  Among our ABC Exclusive lines of apparel and souvenirs, to our selection of Hawaiian chocolates, macadamia nuts, and Hawaiian coffees, you will find the perfect gift for your loved ones! 

Visit Island Gourmet Markets located in the Shops of Wailea, and Honolua Store in Kapalua.  Enjoy our exquisite deli, vast selection of fine wines and spirits, or relax with a cup of Kona’s best coffee from our Island Gourmet Coffee Bar.  Also, experience a true blend of flavors and cuisine at Lineage Restaurant located next door to Island Gourmet Markets.  You’ll be glad you did!

We also offer worldwide shipping through our website for those must-haves you couldn’t quite fit in your suitcases during your stay.  Bringing Aloha to Your Doorstep - Shop at ABCStores.com.

Title: Crazy Shirts - Big Island
Content:
Famous for original quality t-shirt designs for over 50 years, Crazy Shirts casual wear for the entire family features contemporary styling for everyone. An innovative approach to dyeing incorporates natural island and unusual elements like Kona coffee beans, hibiscus, lavender, cranberry, coconut, and now, tangerine! Inspired by California orange groves, it’s the perfect summertime color—bold and tangy like a burst of sunshine. Tees are dyed in real tangerine juice and other citrus ingredients.

Also check out their polo, pima cotton and long-sleeve shirts, shorts, swimwear, jackets, dresses and accessories. Styles and sizes for men, women and children.

Stores statewide are open daily. Big Island locations: Kona Marketplace and Waterfront Row in Kailua-Kona; Kings' Shops at Waikoloa Beach Resort.

Title: McCully Shopping Center
Content: Sample the cuisine of the world all in one place! Restaurants at this popular community shopping center offer Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, Japanese, Korean and Italian, as well as local plate lunches and fast food choices for those on the go. Take a breather and enjoy a yummy dessert, smoothie, bubble tea drink or the newest snow ice dessert.

Title: Maui Resortwear
Content: Get wearable Maui souvenir tees featuring tropical animals, Maui landscapes and cute, comical graphics. Home of the mountain dude t-shirt. They have matching aloha apparel to outfit the entire family, from infant to adult sizes. Liven up your look with bright logo sweatshirts hats, dresses. Swim wear for babies and ladies bikinis. Great prices.

Title: Keauhou Shopping Center
Content: Cultural events and activities; a hula show every Friday; farmers market, 8 a.m.-noon on Saturday; and the Keauhou Kahaluu Heritage Center where you can learn about the areas rich Hawaiian history lies at the heart of this shopping center. You will also enjoy the dozens of shops, restaurants, services and a theater.
Image Alt Text: Keauhou Shopping Center - Big Island, Hawaii|||

Title: Lehua Jewelers
Content:
When Lehua Jewelers opened in 1985, owner Sharon Gilbert was prepared to take her long-time inspiration—classic Hawaiian enameled jewelry—to the next level. She has created many Big Island designs, working in 14K, 18K and sterling silver, sometimes embellishing with colorful glass enamel, diamonds or precious gemstones.

This fine arts major has designed hand-engraved pieces throughout her career inspired by Hawai‘i Island. She also collaborates with clients to achieve their desired styles.

“Although we’re known for our Hawaiian Heirloom jewelry, we have a wide range of treasures to meet many different tastes and budgets,” says Gilbert. “We have a large assortment of gemstone and pearl jewelry at our store, and many of our pieces are one-of-a-kind creations that we make right here.”

One of the state’s most prestigious hula events is the Merrie Monarch Festival, now in its 57th year. One of the most anticipated events at this weeklong celebration is the Miss Aloha Hula in which female hula dancers compete for the honor of being named the top solo dancer. Lehua Jewelers was commissioned to create the Miss Aloha Hula award bracelet in 2013.

“I believe there is great meaning behind this commission,” says Gilbert. “When we were approached by Aunty Luana Kawelu, it was important to me that our bracelets were indeed all handcrafted here in Hawai‘i by local engravers, using the classic technique of hand cut lettering for the traditional glass enameling. Additionally, I feel that we go an extra step by allowing each winner to design her own bracelet, including elements that are precious to her. So far, no two bracelets are alike.”

Stop by Lehua Jewelers and let Sharon Gilbert and her staff help you find the perfect symbol that expresses your feelings for the ones you love.

Title: Queens' MarketPlace
Content: Queens’ MarketPlace is a family resort shopping center with a wide variety of tropical foliage and water features including koi ponds. With an eclectic mix of shops and boutiques, galleries and services, notable restaurants, popular food court eateries and an anchor grocery that includes a deli and wine bar, Queens' MarketPlace is a venue for weekly hula performances, monthly mini-concerts and popular outdoor "movies under the stars" and lots more at the Coronation Pavilion.

Title: Hawaiian Trading Post
Content: View many fine jewelry designs with Tahitian black pearls hand-picked from the source. See one of the largest collections of Niihau shell jewelry on Kauai and marvel at the beautiful and exotic sunrise shells. Also, browse a variety of settings with Hawaiian black and red coral and precious gems. They also carry apparel. Family owned and operated.

Title: Koloa Town
Content:
Koloa Town is the site of the state’s oldest plantation settlement, and where sugar was king in 1835. Glimpse the town’s former plantation history at the Koloa History Center. Open from 9 a.m.-9 p.m. daily, it features exhibits with photos and artifacts from the plantation era. The outside directory illustrates the layout of historical buildings and landmarks. Plaques on each building tell the story of the businesses and families who once lived there.

You’ll also find more than 20 shops and boutiques, eateries and services in Old Koloa Town, an open-air shopping complex that calls these buildings home.

History buffs might want to read up and follow the 10-mile Koloa Heritage Trail. Along the trail are 14 stops with descriptions of the significance of each location. Rich in culture, history and geology, the trail can be walked, biked or driven. Learn about the legend of the huge moo, or lizard, that was caught in the blowhole of Spouting Horn Park. Visit Koloa Landing, once the only port of entry for foreign goods. Walk the same strip of sand that visitors arriving from the Marquesas Islands between 200 and 600 A.D. walked. For detailed information, call 888-744-0888 or visit poipubeach.org and pick up a Koloa Heritage Trail guide.

 A lovely canopy of trees, locally known as the Tree Tunnel on Highway 520 or Maluhia Road, offers up a fragrant drive. History names a Scottish cattle rancher, Walter Duncan McBryde, as the one who planted 500 fragrant trees along the road more than 150 years ago. Open the window to breathe in the delicious fresh scent and get your camera ready!

Title: Poipu Shopping Village
Content: Everything you're looking for and more! Poipu Shopping Village is located in the heart of Po‘ipu amid a lovely garden setting, with award-winning restaurants, unique and eclectic shops, gift stores, art gallery, jewelry stores, grocery store and boutiques. This colorful array of shops, services and eateries is right on Po‘ipu Road in one convenient location. It’s the home of Keoki’s Paradise Restaurant, Puka Dogs, Bangkok Happy Bowl Thai Bistro & Bar, Poipu Rock n’ Roll Sushi, Anuenue Café, Olympic Café, Kauai Juice Co., Starbucks, Island Taco, Papalani Gelato, Honolua Surf Co., Sand People, Whalers General Store and much, much more.  For a rare treat, enjoy hula every Monday and Thursday at 5pm in an outdoor setting under the banyan trees. Join them on an exciting journey through over a thousand years of rich tradition. A well-renowned Hawai‘i musician Keola Worthington, shall sing and share Hawai‘i stories from humorous to old and new, accompanied with the award-winning gracious hula maidens of a school of hula, Halau Ka Lei Mokihana O Leina‘ala. From 2:30-5pm on the first and third Tuesdays of the month, Poipu Shopping Village hosts The Village Market, a bi-monthly farmer’s market that includes Kauai-made products, bakery goods, tropical flowers, live music and demonstrations of lei making, coconut weaving and wood carving.

Title: Ala Moana Center
Content: Hawaii's largest open-air shopping center boasts over 290 stores and popular restaurants, a food court, plus entertainment on Center Stage. Boutiques, big name department stores, world-renown fashion houses are all in the mall. Makai Market Food Court open 9 a.m. daily. Trolley is available between the center and 12 Waikiki locations.

Title: Pualeilani Atrium Shops
Content:
Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa

Browse through more than 60 shops and restaurants at this three-story, open-air atrium. Farmers market every Tuesday and Thursday, Hawaiian music every Wednesday.

Title: Royal Hawaiian Center
Content: Waikiki's largest shopping center has its roots in Hawaiian history while offering a delightful array of more than 100 shops and restaurants popular with isle visitors and residents. Satisfy your palate with flavors from around the world, shop to your hearts content and enjoy weekly hands-on cultural activities and entertainment.

Title: Waikiki Shopping Plaza
Content: Learn to play the ukulele, take a hula or Hawaiian quilting lesson, rejuvenate in a yoga class and enjoy a Polynesian show in Waikiki Shopping Plaza. Also explore five floors with more than 100 unique and brand name shops, services, restaurants, a food court and catch live entertainment too.

Title: Duke's Marketplace
Content: Browse through a vast collection of souvenirs from up to 130 vendors in this outdoor marketplace. Find items from small trinkets and knick-knacks to apparel and accessories for everyone on your gift list. The best part? It's in the heart of Waikiki within walking distance of most hotels. You can also grab a quick bite at the food court. Located next to Waikiki Beachcomber.

Title: Hilo Hattie
Content: When you think contemporary Hawaiian apparel and resort wear, Hilo Hattie automatically comes to mind. “The Store of Hawai‘i” continues to create contemporary and stylish aloha apparel for the entire family. Stop by their store and you’ll also find gift items such as island edibles, bath and body products, home decor and jewelry.

Title: Lanis
Content: Wear the aloha spirit with matching Hawaiian-style print outfits in many colorful aloha shirt and dress sets. Made of 100 percent cotton or rayon. Browse racks of high quality long and short sleeved button down mens aloha shirts in silk. Women will delight in trying on handpainted silk sarongs. Find many traditional muumuu styles.

Title: Logowear Maui
Content: Show off your quality Maui imprinted logowear back home with many apparel and accessory items to choose from. Printed and embroidered designs. Sizes range from toddler rompers to juniors and womens. Find t-shirts, sweats, shorts, caps and casual tropical dresses featuring trendy cuts. Find an attractive range of price points.

Title: Maui Clothing Company
Content: Dive into an island-based and extensive designer swimwear collection plus a new private label line, Maui WaterWear, with hot prints at value prices. Mix and match tops and bottoms in all sizes and styles including bandeau, halter, push-up underwire, string side bottom, and boy short. Two stores in Kihei.

Title: Queen Kaahumanu Center
Content: Maui's largest shopping mall with over 100 stores, restaurants, services and theaters. Anchor stores are Macy's and Sears. Free shows, cultural events and a Farmers Market take place at the center stage. Pause at the childrens play area near Macys. Ample free parking.

Title: Bodacious
Content: Find beautiful, casual and breezy tropical wear in all sizes from xs-6x. Choose from an array of styles including resortwear, swimwear and accessories. See clothing in distinctive materials, like batik prints, rayon and flax linen. Mix-and-match Bodacious signature apparel. Bodacious Petite through Plus and Bodacious Plus Size Apparel.

Title: Making Waves
Content:
Making Waves, part of the Maui Clothing Company family of stores, features “Hawai‘i’s largest collection of swimwear” offering eye-catching styles and designs for every shape and size. Stop by their store at Poipu Shopping Village to browse through hundreds of suits from designers such as La Blanca, Beach House, Maaji, Rip Curl, O’neill, Carve Designs and many more, including their own exclusive Maui WaterWear line featuring rashguards and swimwear for the entire family.

“We cater to women of all body types, from bikinis to one pieces, from sexy to modest, in a range of cup sizes and support,” says Valerie Campos, swimwear buyer for Maui Clothing Company. “Whatever she’s looking for in a swimsuit, we have that special piece that will make her feel confident and comfortable.

“My go-to brand for swimwear is Maaji,” she adds. “They have such a unique and wide selection of prints and silhouettes, and offer a multitude of ways to be worn, which adds so much value to the suit. Their pieces are reversible and many of their tops can be worn front or back, which can give you four different ways to style your look.” And nowadays with sustainability top of mind, Campos says the environmentally conscious company has planted over 90,000 trees in Columbia to offset the environmental impact of manufacturing and continues to look for ways to be a sustainable brand.

Making Waves also offers a selection of beach or poolside accessories such as beach bags, sunglasses, hats, cover ups, sun care products and slippers with the latest styles from Crocs, Reef, Sanuk, Ipanema and more.

Title: Moonbow Magic Gift Gallery
Content: Find an enchanting world inside this eclectic boutique with an assortment of pieces from around the globe. Browse handcrafted silver and semi-precious stone jewelry, home decor pieces and housewares. Hawaiian cultural items include a variety of ipu (gourds).

Title: Robert's Jewelry
Content: Take home a piece of island culture with Hawaiian heirloom jewelry. You'll have hundreds of different designs to view, from traditional to contemporary in 14kt gold and sterling silver. Some of the engraved pieces include rings, bracelets, earrings and pendants. They've been in business for over 70 years specializing in affordable custom-made jewelry.

Title: Rix Island Wear
Content: Rick Ralston, the founder of Crazy Shirts, Inc., is the creative talent behind Rix Island Wear. After being disappointed with the selection of aloha shirts available when shopping for himself in 2009, he created his own line of shirts. The designs are fresh with bold patterns and have a masculine look. They've become popular with residents and visitors, especially the younger generation. These all cotton shirts are made locally, and the unique, exclusive prints often sell out quickly. Most importantly, prices are reasonable and shirts are comfortable.  Five locations on Oahu.

Title: Crush Boutique
Content: Find a treasure trove of exclusive, locally made apparel and accessories herecasual clothing for women and children, swimwear, jewelry, shoes, light scarves, belts, bags, sunglasses, hats and specialty items. Lots of goodies for head-to-toe fun! Shipping available nationwide.

Title: Blue Sky Hawaii
Content: Greatest Selection of Dickies Workwear & Casual Clothing.Wrangler Riggs Workwear clothing-Ripstop & Denim pants, Medical Scrubs - 3,000+ pcs instock,Workwear for Construction Contractors/Laborers, Chefs/Restaurant, Auto/Heavy Equipment Mechanics, Painters, Exterminators, Landscapers,FR flame resistant for Electricians & Welders,Etc, Camouflage - pants shorts shirts & backpacks, Tarps & Canopy Tent Fittings, Discount Handtools.

Title: Emperor's Emporium
Content: You're guaranteed to find the perfect gift or souvenir at Emperors Emporium. Friendly customer service and reasonable prices draw return visitors year after year. Select from a wide array of gold and silver jewelry, t-shirts, casual alohawear, clothing for entire family, pareo, Original Red Dirt Shirts, hats and caps, footwear, Hawaiian music CDs, as well as beach accessories such as suntan and skin lotions, beach bags and more. You'll find something for all ages.

Title: Kmart
Content: Pick up a free tote/beach bag to carry your Hawaiian souvenirs, like macadamia nuts, candies, Hawaii grown coffees and carved wood home decor items. You'll also find value priced vacation sundries like sunscreen and after-sun care products, pantry items and island apparel for the family. Convenient pharmacy services are available.

Title: Rays On The Bay
Content: Sleek and sexy, this restaurant, bar and lounge at Sheraton Kona Resort & Spa at Keauhou Bay offers perfect sunset views and is the only restaurant with a view of manta rays in their natural environment. On the menu, find items utilizing fresh local seafood and produce. Enjoy appetizers and one of many signature cocktails or opt for an enchanting dinner. Live entertainment too.

Title: VASH - Big Island
Content:
Visitor Aloha Society of Hawaii's mission is to share the aloha spirit with visitors affected by adversity. VASH assistance is designed to help visitors cope with and recover from a variety of unfortunate situations such as crime victimization, the loss of a purse or wallet, medical situations, or the death of a loved one.

For Visitor Services in East Hawai`i
Phone: 808.756.1472
Fax: 808.934.7785
Email: East@VASHBigIsland.org

For Visitor Services in West Hawai`i
Phone: 808.756.0785
Fax: 808.324.0346
Email:West@VASHBigIsland.org

Title: Hawaii Volcanoes National Park
Content:
One hundred years is just a blink of an eye in the science of volcanism. The Hawaiian Islands, which sprawl 1,500 miles northwest to Midway and Kure, formed like an assembly line over the Pacific Plate's hot spot, starting at least 70 million years ago. At press time, volcanic activity has been “live” at Kilauea Volcano since 1983. See how Hawaii Volcanoes National Park (HVNP) has expanded and changed in the last century during the multimedia video, “100 Years in 100 Seconds” on the National Park Service website.

Today, the park’s 333,000 acres provide countless ways to connect with volcanism, geology, biology and native Hawaiian culture. Honored as both an International Biosphere Reserve (1980) and a World Heritage Site (1987), the park hosted nearly 1.7 million visitors in 2014.

Plan plenty of time to visit Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. A World Heritage site, HVNP has much to see and do. It’s best to spend the night at Volcano House or nearby Volcano Village to best enjoy your road trip to and from the park; it’s located on the southeastern end of the island.

Stay after dark to see red. At press time, a red glow emanates from the ongoing gas eruption of Halemaumau Crater. Peer right into the action at the Jagger Museum Overlook. The billowing plume is the result of molten activity in the crater’s lava lake. The park is open 24-7 so check it out after dinner or before dawn, when it’s less crowded.

Eruption activity can change so stop at Kilauea Visitor Center; it’s staffed by rangers 9 a.m.-5 p.m. daily, 808-985-6000. Find a daily posting of free interpretive programs and catch a short film, “Born of Fire…Born of the Sea,” followed by a current eruption update, at the top of the hour. For an online eruption update, visit nps.gov/havo/planyourvisit/lava2.htm.

Watch real-time scientific monitors in action inside Jagger Museum. Colorful, large murals by the late art historian Herb Kawainui Kane depict the Hawaiian pantheon, including Pelehonuamea, the deity of volcanoes. Open 10 a.m.-7:30 p.m. daily with “Life on the Edge” ranger talks at 2, 3 and 5 p.m.

Go subterranean with a walk through Thurston Lava Tube. A picturesque trail rich with bird song and towering tree ferns descends to the 500-year-old Nahuku tunnel that’s illuminated by lights. Caves like this form by traveling magma. Other park attractions illustrating the awe of volcanism: Kilauea Iki Crater, Devastation Trail, Keanakakoi Crater, Puu Loa Petroglyphs and Chain of Craters Road. Visit nps.gov/havo/planyourvisit.

Entry fee is $25 per vehicle, valid for seven days. The Tri-Park Pass is $25, and is good for unlimited entry for one year to Hawai‘i’s three national parks: Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park, Pu‘uhonua o Honaunau Historical Park and Haleakala National Park on Maui.

Title: Mauna Kea Visitor Center
Content: Acclimate yourself with a stop at the Onizuka Center for International Astronomy Visitor Information Station at 9,200 feet and check on current weather stats, safety information and take the time to adjust to the change in altitude.

Title: Panaewa Rainforest Zoo & Gardens
Content: Where can you find a Hawaiian Goose (nene), a Nigerian Dwarf Goat or the saucer-eyed Two-Toed Sloth? At the 12-acre Panaewa Rainforest Zoo and Gardens! Home to more than 80 animal species, the zoo also offers the kid-friendly The Barn Petting Zoo, 1:30-2:30 p.m. Saturdays, tiger feedings at 3:30 p.m. daily, and a butterfly house. A gift shop is also on the premises. The zoo is the only natural tropical rainforest zoo in the United States, which makes for a relaxing outing with its winding paths that take you past native and non-native flora. Admission is free, but donations are accepted.

Title: Puuhonua O Honaunau National Historical Park
Content: A serene spot, this Place of Refuge offers opportunities to learn about and appreciate the depth of Hawaiian history and culture. Leisurely walk the grounds for a self-guided tour that take you past Hawaiian temples and other structures. You might encounter an endangered honu (green sea turtle) in the shallow waters of Keoneele (royal cove) or resting onshore. Make it a learning experience with your keiki (children) by identifying the native flora and its benefits. Or simply enjoy the experience by exploring the tidepools and taking in a vivid sunset. Admission: $5 per vehicle (good for seven days).

Title: Puukohola Heiau National Historic
Content: Drop by the Visitor Center to see exhibits and displays, a museum and non-profit bookstore, plus pick up a map guide. Ranger-led, 20-30 minute-long tours begin at the center and take you to the parks historic sites. Admission is free. Non-educational guided tours are available for 10 or more at $2 per person. A quick tip: Just after sunrise, you might be able to see black tipped reef sharks just off shore of the historical site with as many as 20 sharks on a good day.

Title: Waimea
Content: Waimea sits at lofty 2,500 feet in elevation on the slopes of the Kohala Mountains. It's where clouds roll in from the back of Waipio Valley and settle on green volcanic cindercones called puu (hills). Its name means reddish water, which refers to the tint given to the streams after filtering through the hapuu (fern) forests of the Kohala Mountains. This is where picket fences, flower gardens and sprawling yards abound. There are no tiny property margins here; you've got space in which to stretch and cool, fresh air to breathe. This is the home of the Hawaii paniolo (cowboy). All you need to do is turn a 360, and you'll know it.

Title: Waipio Valley
Content: The pockmarked road stretching from lookout down into the valley is steep and narrow at times, but if you're willing to take the journey, it's a place that will reveal the beauty of life's simplicity. Several spectacular waterfalls are located in the valley: Kaluahine Falls, Waiulili Falls and Hiilawe Falls thats more than 1,400 feet tall, the tallest on the Big Island of Hawaii. If you're in top physical shape, you might also consider hiking the 18-mile Muliwai Trai that will take you into the next valley, Waimanu Valley. You'll need a permit to camp in Waimanu; call the Hawaii District State Division of Forestry & Wildlife not earlier than one month in advance.

Title: Oils Of Aloha
Content:
Oils of Aloha® blends traditional Hawaiian knowledge of kukui and macadamia nut oils with the latest technology in “the best of science and the best of nature.” Macadamia oil was first used for cosmetic and pharmaceutical manufacturers, then for food oils as its health benefits and superior taste came to light.

The kukui oil products—in the form of KUKUIæ creams, oils and lotions—followed. The third product developed exclusively by Oils of Aloha®, is SOLaleur®, a unique formula that treats sunburns and other UV-related damage. The newest product is the premium, non-greasy OptiMSM Lotion with KUKUIæ oil that moisturizes dry skin and soothes muscle pain. It’s rich in natural oils, non-comedogenic and hypo-allergenic.

Available at ABC Stores, Hilo Hattie and Longs Drugs statewide and other isle stores.

Title: Buns In The Sun Bakery Deli
Content: This go-to Kona landmark offers up fresh-baked breads, rolls, croissants, pastries, cakes, pies, and coffee and espresso everyday. Busy day ahead? Then opt for a heartier menu item like an omelette. Made-to-order salads, sandwiches, soup of the day are available for lunch.

Title: Lilikoi Cafe
Content: The key words here are healthy, fresh and delicious! Menu items range from deli salads, sandwiches, quiche, soups, vegetarian items, vegetable and fruit juices, plus yummy desserts. Reviews on Tripadvisor.com give kudos to the deli salads, as well as desserts such as the chocolate ganache, cheesecake and fruit cobbler dessert of the day.

Title: Mauna Kea Beach Luau
Content: Enjoy the tradition of an authentic Hawaiian luau against the backdrop of a brilliant setting sun. See the kalua pig emerge from the underground imu and partake in a lavish buffet of fresh-grilled fish, kalua pig, lau lau, teriyaki short ribs and more. A traditional live show features some of the best dancers and musicians.

Title: Kona Kozy's Comedy & Magic Show
Content: Located inside King's Grille at Waikoloa Beach Resort, this one-of-a-kind comedy magic show is the number one rated Big Island attraction on TripAdvisor. Multiple award-winning comedy magician Kona Kozy aka Paul Kozak performs six nights a week except Thursday.

Title: Na Makana Gift Fair At Hulihee
Content: This once-a-month gift fair showcases the talents of the volunteer caretakers of Hulihe'e Palace, the members of the Daughters of Hawaii and Calabash Cousins. Find made-in-Hawaii gifts such as decorative gourds, lauhala accessories, fresh lei, local jams and jellies, home-baked pet treats and skin care products using island ingredients. Admission is $6/adult, $4/senior, $1/children under 18.

Title: New Kona Trail Open In HVNP
Content: A new 4.5-mile hiking trail is open for visitors to Kahuku in Hawaii Volcano's National Park. Located between 3,880 and 4,440 feet above sea level, the Kona Trail offers sweeping views of Ka Lae, the Kau Coast and features a rugged lava landscape from the 1887 Mauna Loa flow. The moderate loop trail meanders through old pastures and native forests alongside native plant restoration areas. Kahuku is located on Hwy. 11 near mile marker 70.5 on the mountainside of the road. The trail is about 5.5 miles from the Kahuku entrance up a steep, rough and rocky road. Four-wheel drive is strongly recommended. Parking for the Kona Trail is at the Lower and Upper Glover Trailheads.

Title: Niaulani Nature Walk
Content: Take a one-hour guided nature walk through an old-growth Hawaiian rainforest on an easy, half-mile loop trail, and learn about native plants and birds of Volcano. Open to the public.

Title: Sunday Walk In The Park
Content: Join the Friends of Hawaii Volcanoes National Park (FHVNP) for a Sunday Walk in the Park

Title: Waikoloa Community Church
Content:
People of all ages, religious and ethnic backgrounds gather at this interdenominational Christian church, the first in Waikoloa Village started in 1983.

WikiWiki Ukulele Classic Praise Service 8:30 a.m. and Traditional Service & Keiki Church 10 a.m. Sundays. Shaka Shachah Modern Acoustic Praise Service 6 p.m. Wed. Also, small group ministries at various times.

Title: Cindy Coats Gallery
Content:
“Colorful, whimsical and sometimes a little off kilter” is how artist Cindy Coats describes her artwork. “Color is as important to me and to each painting as the subject itself. I spend hours, sometimes days, on the color composition of each painting.” You’ll know you’ve found the Cindy Coats Gallery located on the corner of Ali‘i Drive and Palani Road because of her dedication to color.

Imagine a cat with a fish tail (catfish) or cows dressed in vibrant mu‘umuʻu. “All my ideas come from my imagination,” says Coats. “I keep a list of ideas. Whenever something hits me or I have an idea, I jot it down—the list keeps growing. I doubt I’ll ever be able to do all the paintings I want in this lifetime!”

Although Coats has done commissioned artwork for the likes of Sting; Santana; Crosby, Stills and Nash; and a commemorative work for the Ironman World Championships, one of her most memorable pieces is “Dogs Love Trucks” that she painted for her husband as a Christmas gift.

“I had no intention of making prints at the time,” she says. “It was just a gift with our two dogs Cosmo and Stevie Rae. I had no idea it would become so popular—it’s even a wine label now. Another is ‘Expect the Unexpected’; I had a vision of that for the longest time...our dog Pi in a boat with all this chaos going on and her looking straight ahead, heading ‘true north.’”

Coats still enjoys a working relationship with the Ironman World Championships, “but that doesn’t mean any more to me than the person who buys a couple of prints and thinks about their Kona visit everyday!” she assures us. “After 23 years in Kona and 13 in my own gallery, I still LOVE what I do. I love painting, I love meeting and talking with people about my work, and I love the fact that I get to do what I love in the most beautiful place in the world!”

Title: Kona Inn Shopping Village
Content: Located along the oceanfront, Kona Inn Shopping Village provides a leisurely opportunity for visitors to explore shops, galleries, boutiques, Hawaiian gift shops and restaurants. Free parking is available on nearby Hualalai Road.
Image Alt Text: Kona Inn Shopping Village - Big Island - Hawaii||

Title: The Shops At Mauna Lani
Content: This first-class resort shopping destination invites shoppers to enjoy free entertainment that includes a Polynesian show featuring a fire dance and Tahitian drums in a truly Hawaiian setting, Mon. and Thurs. Satisfy your palate with fine and casual dining options too. And hear legends from kupuna (elders) on a self-guided Hawaiian plant tour.

Title: Waimea Center
Content: The weathered Waimea Cowboy sporting a bright blue shirt has welcomed visitors to this community shopping complex since 1989. Stop by for a glimpse into the areas paniolo (cowboy) heritage and satisfy your hunger pangs, shop for unique and islandmade merchandise, or take care of business with the range of business services available.

Title: Mauna Loa Macadamia Nut Visitor Center
Content: If you're ever in the mood for some delicious macadamia nuts, be sure to check out the Mauna Loa Macadamia Nut Visitor Center! This is the place to go if you want to learn all about these tasty nuts. You'll get to see how they're harvested and processed, and you can even sample some of the products. The visitor center is open every day from 9am to 5pm. Mauna Loa Macadamia Nut has produced macadamia nuts roasted to golden perfection for over 30 years. Tour the Visitor Center and see how the macadamia nut is transformed from nut to chocolate-dipped goodness. Enjoy free samples of nuts and macadamia cookies, plus shop for island treats and gifts, including an exclusive selection of Mauna Loa products available only at the factory. The Mauna Loa Macadamia Nut Visitor Center is temporarily closed. Please check back for updates on when they become available for visits again.
Image Alt Text: Mauna Loa Macadamia Nut - Big Island|||||

Title: Kona Henna Studio
Content: Your skin becomes the canvas for beautiful works of art by way of a henna tattoo. Master Artist/Owner Maria Diessner combines traditional Mehndi design, contemporary tattoo design and Hawaiian styles to create a unique style of henna art. From single designs to full body art, henna tattoos last up to four weeks and are fun for all ages. Walk-ins are welcome or schedule an appointment.

Title: Quilt Passions
Content: Nothing says Hawai‘i like an authentic Hawaiian quilt, and Quilt Passions is where you’ll find Hawaiian-themed quilts and patterns created by local designers, who capture the culture and history of the islands. Those who sew will find patterns to choose from, but if you don’t, no need to worry. Browse through the collection of ready-made Hawaiian and island-style quilts available for purchase. Also find knitting, crochet and embroidery notions including patterns, kits, yarn and DMC floss. Ask about classes open to the public; they even provide loaner sewing machines and notions kits for free!

Title: Waimea Hill Country & Tack
Content: Waimea Hill Country & Tack in Holomua Center is the Big Isle's source for western tack and clothing, plus belts, boots, hats, jewelry and home decor. Find paniolo-style apparel plus name brands: Cactus saddlery and ropes, Ariat, Cinch, Cruel Girl, Rockies, Miss Me and Gypsy Soule. Located at Mamalahoa Hwy. and Kamamalu St. in Waimea.

Title: Whalers General Store
Content: With four locations in Waikiki and one in Haleiwa, Whalers General Store offers customers convenience and reasonable prices. It's a one-stop shop for small necessities, fun accessories, souvenirs and gift items, plus small, ready-made meals, snacks, beverages and a selection of grocery items.

Title: Paradise Studio Tour
Content: Paradise Studio Tour in the district of Puna's Hawaiian Paradise Park features 14 home art studios open to the public with over 40 fine artists and crafters selling works in clay, fiber, glass, pastel, silk, acrylic, watercolor, oil paintings, wood, jewelry, gourds, photography, soap and cement. Also enjoy free featured demos.

Title: Cochon Island U.S. Tour At Mauna Kea Hotel
Content: Cochon Island brings together five chefs and five pigs plus distillers, notable media and food champions to celebrate responsible farming and the spirit of Aloha at this inaugural pork-centric event at the Mauna Kea Beach Hotel. Each chef team will be challenged to prepare a menu created from the entirety of heritage breed pigs for an audience of pork-loving epicureans. Guests can also indulge in the TarTare Bar, sustainable seafood samples, the famous Cheese Bar, Perfect Manhattan and Chupito bars, and brews by Anchor Brewing. The event kicks off at 2 p.m. for VIP's; 3 p.m. for general admission ticket holders. Tickets are $150 (general admission) and $200 (VIP).

Title: Hike, Explore & Protect Kahuku
Content: Hawaii Volcano's National Park celebrates the tenth anniversary of the Kahuku Unit by offering free programs to introduce visitors and residents to the park's southernmost section. Activities include educational seminars and a variety of guided hikes showcasing the southwest rift zone, panoramic views of Kahuku, pastures, lava fields, and native forests. Call for program schedule; no advance registration is required.

Title: Hulihee Palace Oceanside Tea
Content: Get the royal treatment at Hulihes Palace, where you can enjoy Wilhelmina's tea on the the palace's picturesque oceanside lanai. Served on fine china, the tea service includes a robust array of ribbon sandwiches, scones, plus a 45-minute guided tour of Hulihee Palace. Presented by the Daughters of Hawaii and the Calabash Cousins, the monthly oceanside tea raises funds for visiting students. Tickets are $35. Non-refundable reservations are required; call for reservations.

Title: Kokua Kailua
Content: One Sunday each month from 1-6 p.m., Alii Drive along scenic Kailua Bay in historic Kailua Village becomes a festive pedestrian-only walkway and marketplace. Enjoy free music, artists, vendors and friendly merchants for great shopping and delicious dining. At 4 p.m., head to Hulihee Palace for a free musical performance that honors Hawaii's royal figures.

Title: L & L Hawaiian Bbq
Content: A favorite with locals for broke da mouth food and plate lunches, the menu is a fusion of Asian and American dishes prepared with island flair. L & L is known for its generous portions, freshness and unique blend of tastes. Enjoy chicken katsu, island fish, teri beef and the loco mocohamburger patties, two eggs and brown gravy. Open daily with locations in Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook and Waimea.
Image Alt Text: L & L Hawaiian Bbq - Big Island - Hawaii

Title: Fabric And Quilting Delights
Content: If you’re a “fabriholic,” then Fabric and Quilting Delights is your paradise. Owner Honya Sawinski came from North Virginia, and didn’t know how to sew at the time. But after moving to Hawai‘i in 2000, her friendships made over the years led to her opening Fabric and Quilting Delights. Browse through rows of colorful fabrics from Robert Kauffman, Trentix, Trans-Pacific, Island Batiks, Hoffman, Henry Glass, Westminster, Marcus Brothers and more. Putting fabric combinations together and seeing peoples’ eyes light up as a result makes Sawinski happy. So if you’re a sewing enthusiast, quilter or fabriholic, stop by the shop to meet Sawinski. Ask about classes and machine service and repairs too. We just moved to a new location at 78-6831 Ali'i Drive, Suite 140, Kailua Kona 96740!
Image Alt Text: Fabric And Quilting Delights - Big Island, Hawaii

Title: Kailua Candy Company
Content: Handcrafting fine chocolates for over 30 years in Kona! Selected as one of the top 10 chocolate shops in the USA by Bon Appetit, Kailua Candy is the premiere place to taste and see chocolates being made. Scrumptious, island-inspired chocolates, sugar-free, cookies.
Image Alt Text: Kailua Candy Company - Big Island, Hawaii

Title: Original Donkey Balls Store
Content:
The Original Donkey Ball Store and Factory creates 80 different products, including its popular line of zany, animal-themed confections featuring milk, dark and white chocolate; macadamia nuts and a wide variety of flavors and ingredients. The fun began with creation of The Original Donkey Balls®, named to honor the pack animal that hauled agricultural products from Kona fields. 

Take a tour of the confection-making operation 10 a.m and 2 p.m. weekdays or watch production through windows in the retail “ball room.” The store also stocks Hawai‘i-made sauces, salts, sugars, honey, rubs, coffee and Original Donkey Ball logo gift items. Free sampling!

Title: Dan-Os Doner
Content: Enjoy an exotic taste sensation using local products! A tasty, traditional Turkish meat, Dan-os Doner is made with local, grass-fed beef thats stacked by hand on a spit daily.

Title: Under The Bodhi Tree
Content: Offering vegetarian, vegan and raw cuisine, Under the Bodhi Tree is the states only restaurant awarded a Hawaii Seal of Quality, which designates it uses genuine Hawaii-grown or Hawaii-made premium products. Find breakfast, lunch, dinner plus Happy Hour Specials 2-5 p.m. daily. Chefs will cater to those with special dietary restrictions, including allergies and gluten-free. Enjoy fresh, healthy food where sustainable agriculture and responsible business practices come together.

Title: The UPS Store
Content: Souvenirs? Gifts? Extra bags? Sports equipment? We'll pack them with the utmost care and ship them directly home for you. Ask us for details today.

Title: The Fine Hawaiian Gift Gallery
Content: Find a broad range of affordable, locally made-and-designed clothing and gifts at The Fine Hawaiian Gift Gallery. The gallerys unique collection includes handmade koa wood items for entertaining and office, Hawaiian-made aloha clothing for the entire family, glass, pottery, decorative accessories, handmade Christmas ornaments including little Hawaiian shirts on hangers, ukuleles and more.

Title: Hawaii Titanium Rings
Content:
Founder Jerry Guire pioneered the titanium ring industry in 1996 and his Hawaii Titanium Rings offers the original titanium koa wood ring. Crafted 100 percent in Kona of durable, aerospace-grade titanium—no inferior tungsten carbide is used. The hypoallergenic rings are sold from the case or as one-of-a-kind custom pieces—at no extra charge! Offering 800 ring styles and over 40 exotic woods. Mix and match any stone or wood inlay. Create your unique wedding bands. Located next to Jguires.

Gallery: Kona Inn Shopping Village, (808) 756-1173, 9AM-9PM daily
Manufacturing Showroom: 73-5617 Maiau St., Kailua-Kona, (808) 756-1173 • 9AM-5PM Mon-Fri

Title: Jguires
Content: Find a collection of over 40 top artists from around the world at Jguires—a unique Big Island gallery showcasing jewelry, wall and table art. Among the dozen Big Isle artists displayed are goldsmiths Marc Gregg, formerly of Kamuela Goldsmith, and Les Garbis. The gallery offers exceptional opal jewelry and Bovano wall art, plus is the exclusive distributor for Barcelona’s Enric Torres plaque ajoure enamel jewelry. Located next to Hawaii Titanium Rings.

Title: Kailua Village Artists Gallery
Content: Marking its 30th year in 2017, Kailua Village Gallery is managed by working Big Isle members and is the oldest co-op gallery in the state. KVA features an eclectic display of original art. Find paintings in acrylic, gyotaku, mixed media, oil, photography and watercolor, plus fine-art prints. See 3D art in ceramics, glassware, jewelry, mosaics, porcelain, stained glass, welded copper and woodwork.

Title: Ho‘oulu Community Farmers Market & Artisan Fair
Content: Find fresh food and art, 100 percent grown-and-created on Hawai‘i Island at Ho‘oulu Community Farmers Market & Artisans Fair, 9 a.m.-2 p.m. Wednesdays and Fridays until March 31. This outdoor “Gallery on the Green” offers exclusive products, play a Hawaiian cultural booth staging hands-on educational opportunities to make arts and crafts. Enjoy live music and freshly prepared, on-site breakfast and lunch.

Title: One Aloha Shave Ice
Content: Located in King Kamehameha Mall, the shop serves refreshing shave ice, ice cream and gelatos. Enjoy 100% all natural flavorings and try the Original Kona Mudslide, the perfect treat for the coffee lover.

Title: Smith Family Garden Luau
Content: Enjoy an authentic island feast and international dance revue presented with multi-generational Smith family aloha. Experience an imu ceremony and entertainment incorporating the many cultures of Hawaii. Get there early to explore the lush gardens covering 30 acres in the Wailua River valley or opt for a narrated tram tour. Activities start at 5 p.m., September-October; at 4:45 p.m. from November-December.

Title: South Pacific
Content: Broadway musical on Kauai Step back in time to be enchanted as Broadway comes alive. The 1950's movie version of this Rodgers & Hammerstein musical classic was filmed on Kauai. Experience a live professional show and all-you-can-eat buffet dinner with salads, island fish, chicken and desserts.

Title: Allerton Garden
Content:
Allerton Garden is one of five gardens managed by National Tropical Botanical Garden (NTBG), a non-profit organization working to study and save tropical plants everywhere. Named as one of National Geographic Traveler's "50 Places of a Lifetime," Allerton Garden played a vital role in the rich history of the Lawaʻi Valley.

Boasting a landscape design with a series of breathtaking garden rooms that feature exotic plants, art sculptures and aesthetic water features, Allerton Garden is a paradise stilled in time. The late Queen Emma of Hawaii transformed the gardens in the 19th century before leasing the Lawaʻi Valley land to the McBryde family. It now operates as a landscaped haven, intriguing visitors and locals alike with its guided tours, beautiful garden rooms and fascinating Hollywood history.

Self-guided and guided tours are available; reservations are required. Book online or by phone. Garden admission is per person and age category. Trams to the garden leave regularly form the Southshore Visitor Center.
