Title: Rock-A-Hula
Content:
The Luau Buffet & Show package features a carving station with whole roasted luau pig dinner and a refreshing E Komo Mai Tai for $109 per adult and $66 per child. The Stageside VIP Dinner & Show package includes an exclusive welcome reception, a delicious 4-Course Maine lobster, tenderloin steak and wild salmon dinner at a private table and super premium beverages for $149 per adult and $89 per child. For the ultimate show experience, guests can opt for the Green Room Dinner & Show package, with an exclusive Green Room reception and backstage tour, gourmet 4-Course dinner at a private table in the front row of the VIP area and super premium beverages for $185 per adult and $111 per child.

Please inquire for kama‘aina and military pricing. Dinner packages start at 6:00 p.m. and the show kicks off at 8:00 p.m.

Title: Magic Of Polynesia
Content:
An award-winning showcase of stunning illusions, dramatic special effects, amazing sleight-of-hand and professionally choreographed Polynesian entertaining. A spell-binding night to remember! 

Please enquire for Kamaʻaina and Military pricing. Box office is open 8 a.m.-9 p.m. daily.

Title: 434 Tattoo
Content: President and owner Adam Siehr and his professional staff create beautiful custom tattoos in Waikiki. After having attained a high level of mastery, Adam was given the name, Horiyume, by Japanese tattoo icon Horiyoshi III. Come in with a specific design or bring in an idea and let them bring it to life you won't be disappointed. They focus on detail and quality custom work so you leave satisfied. 434 Tattoo has received the Custom Tattooing Studio of the Year award by Consumer Business Review for five years running.

Title: Hope Chapel Waikiki
Content: A friendly community of worshipers invite you to join in Sunday services at 8:30, 10:30 a.m. and 6 p.m. Enjoy contemporary Four-Square gospel that incorporates energetic and lively services accompanied by contemporary Christian music. A Wednesday Bible Study is also open to the public at 6:30 p.m. We have free parking!

Title: Waikiki Baptist Church
Content:
All are welcome to attend services at Waikiki Baptist Church.

   “Our 9 a.m. service is contemporary,” shares Pastor Andrew Large. “Our 10:45 a.m. service is traditional. I preach the same expository sermon straight out of the Bible for both of them.

   “People come dressed casually, and in between the two services we have an Aloha Fellowship where we sit down and talk story with our visitors and get to know each other over a meal. In addition to the two English-speaking services, we have two services in Korean and one in Japanese.”

   All visitors are greeted with a warm welcome. “We also have a map of the world where people can put a pen to where they are from,” says Large.

   “Oftentimes in my sermon I’ll say, ‘If you don’t hear anything else I say this morning, please hear these three words: Jesus Loves YOU!’”

   Is it important for people to attend church even while on vacation? “Yes,” says Large. “You cannot vacation from God.”

Title: Waikiki Beach Chaplaincy
Content:
Founded in 1970, Waikiki Beach Chaplaincy has been under the guidance of Pastor Alex McAngus since 1988. Where the congregation once sat on beach mats under the palm trees at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, today, the location has moved to the Diamond border of the complex where chairs and tents are set up for convenience.

When asked about its mission, McAngus replies, “The Chaplaincy’s mission remains unchanged; to proclaim the Gospel of Jesus Christ in the temporal and secular setting where Jesus’ commission is to go and make disciples and teach them the Good News.” Although generations of people have come and gone, he says the services have remained true to the Gospel, which “is the same yesterday, today and tomorrow.”

If you'd like to attend a service, Waikiki Beach Chaplaincy offers Church on the Beach at 10:00 a.m. every Sunday.

How is the Chaplaincy unique? “The Chaplaincy is a church without walls, and a church that is inside out—openly vulnerable and transparent,” answers McAngus. “It’s real, unique and inspiring!” Services are open to everyone—“Simply come as you are—warts and all!”

Title: Fine Ass Chocolate & Coffee
Content: While driving around the island, make a stop at Fine Ass Chocolates, a gourmet shop for chocolates handmade in Hawaii, and coffee that comes from three areas: Waialua on Oahus North Shore and the Kau and Kona districts on Hawaii Island. The chocolates incorporate all-natural ingredients minus high fructose corn syrup, preservatives and waxy fillers. Also find a selection of bath and body products such as oils, lotions and more.

Title: Handcrafters & Artisans' Alliance
Content:
Handcrafters from around the island sell their wares one weekend each month in Waikiki. Authentic pieces of art, multi-ethnic crafts, apparel, ceramics, jewelry and many more items are all made in Hawaii so you know you're bringing home a unique gift from the islands. Enjoy food and music too!  Open on weekends every month at Kapiolani Park.
Artfest 2023 from 9am - 4pm
January 7 & 8
February 11 &12
March 18 & 19
April 22 & 23
May 20 & 21
June 24 & 25
August 5 & 6
September 9 & 10
October 14 & 15
November 18 & 19

Title: Hawaiian Host
Content: Founded by Mamoru and Aiko Takitani more than 80 years ago, Hawaiian Host has its roots in Hawai‘i. Although new products have been created to satisfy an ever-evolving sweet tooth, one thing remains the same—the original secret recipe of its chocolate handed down through the generations. Hawaiian Host products are available in many stores, but you can also order online.

Title: Aloha General Store
Content:
Aloha General Store opened in 2003 becoming only the third location to sell shave ice in the town of Hale‘iwa. In addition to becoming known as “Hawai‘i’s Best Shave Ice” with many customers and reviewers once Dave’s Homemade Hawaiian Ice Cream came onboard, owner Andre Cooper says they also offer a unique assortment of souvenirs for visitors.

   “We have souvenirs and trinkets for everyone,” he says. “We’re essentially a one-stop-shop to get all your souvenirs so that you can spend the rest of your vacation doing other things versus searching for the perfect gift—because we
already have it!”

   According to Cooper, the top three selling items are “Shave ice and Dave’s Ice Cream, souvenirs such as dashboard hula dolls and vintage signs, and alohawear and kid’s clothing.” Some of the most surprising store items include aloha print
dog collars, stained glass art and coconut peanut butter.

   Cooper has a few suggestions when it comes to fun and unusual gifts to take home—Hawaiian Christmas ornaments, Hawaiian vintage metal signs or Hawaiian jewelry.

   “We’re Hawai‘i’s Best Shave Ice always served with aloha!” says Cooper. And what is his favorite go-to refreshing treat when it gets hot? “Da Works or our famous Pineapple Bowl.” Stop by Aloha General Store to fill up on fun and quirky souvenirs, and cool off with a sweet treat while there!

Title: Soccer Locker
Content:
Soccer Locker, conveniently located minutes from Waikiki at 813 Kapahulu Avenue, has been thrilling soccer crazy visitors since 1976. “We carry a wide variety of apparel and accessories that is ‘Hawai‘i’ branded,” says owner Bob Picerno. “We have a lot of visitors who find the perfect souvenir for themselves or for soccer lovers on their gift list.”

Get into the game of soccer with easy-to-find apparel, equipment and accessories all in one place. Stock up on uniforms, quality shoes and equipment. If you're a coach or referee, youll find uniforms and supplies too. 

Located right behind The Running Room and Bus Route #13 stops right in front.

Title: Yogaloha
Content: Participants of all levels are invited to Yogaloha Hawaii, the only yoga studio in Waikiki located near DFS Galleria. Yogaloha offers yoga mat rentals, classes and a store selling yoga apparel, props and organic products. Also join the 7 a.m. class at Honolulu Zoo every Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday for morning beach yoga.

Title: North Shore Goodies
Content: Savor made-in-Hawaii deliciousness at North Shore Goodies located in Waialua. Their signature Coconut Peanut Butter is a big seller, but also check out butters, jams, spreads, honey, dressings, sauces and moreall make for easy, take-home gifts. Stop by the shop to sample the goodies at their tasting bar too! Products are also available at Kings Village and Hyatt Regency Waikiki farmers markets.

Title: Camaron Shrimp Truck
Content: Camaron Shrimp Truck boasts rave reviews on yelp.com. The shrimp portion is generous, the flavor is grubbin and all for a reasonable price. Garlic shrimp, spicy garlic, shrimp scampi, coconut, see which is your favorite!

Title: Te Moana Nui
Content: Cross the vast ocean to hear the stories of people across Hawaii and the South Pacific at Waikiki's newest Indoor stage production, Te Moana Nui. Through artistic song and dance, vibrant and colorful costumes and enchanting storytelling, exciting tales of adventure come alive.

Title: Auntie Pasto's Italian Restaurant & Pizza
Content: This award-winning restaurant offers all patrons authentic Italian dishes in generous portions. It may take you a while to get through the menu of antipasti, pizza, salads, soups and pasta, but know that whatever you order will become your favorite! They offer a childrens menu and take out as well.

Title: Siam Thai Massage & Spa
Content:
At Siam Thai Massage & Spa rooms are harmoniously combined modern architecture and cultural Thai theme. All your moments will be filled with its affinity, safety, relaxation and the Thai-cultural hospitalities. You will experience a new world as soon as you enter, and find complete serenity as you get massaged in our facilities. Our Specialties include Thai Massage, Body Scrub & Massage, Deep Tissue, Lomi Lomi, Shiatsu, Stone Massage, and Swedish. By appointment or walk-in. Validated Parking. Call us and mention 'This Week Oahu' to receive these special offers:
  • 70-minute massage - $60 (includes Hot Stone or Aromatherapy)
  • 70-minute couples massage - $110 (20-minute foot, 50-minute body)

Title: Waikiki Massage & Foot Spa
Content: Waikiki Massage and Foot Spa offers various massage techniques from our professional massage therapists who are trained in Hawaii and Thailand. If you're looking for a healing and relaxing therapeutic massage in a pleasant, comfortable atmosphere, please visit us at Waikiki Massage and Foot Spa located just steps away from Hilton Hawaiian Village.

Title: Tiffany's Thai Massage
Content: Awarded Peoples Choice in the Star Advertisers Hawaiis Best 2015, Tiffanys Thai Massage has lots of great feedback from the Yelp community. Schedule a massage with the professional staff in a convenient location at the start of Waikiki that will help you reduce stress, improve flexibility, recover from injury, loosen muscles, improve circulation and posture, remove toxins and more. Services include Swedish, deep tissue, sports, Thai massage, combination and more to fit your needs.

Title: Macky's Kahuku Sweet Shrimp
Content: Macky's Shrimp Truck offers up butter garlic, lemon pepper, coconut, spicy hot and original shrimp on the menu at competitive prices. Their claim to fame is winning Battle of the North Shore Shrimp Trucks in Turtle Bay Resorts 2005 Seafood Festival. See their ad for a $2 discount.

Title: Maui Divers Jewelry Design Center
Content:
Maui Divers Jewelry, the largest jewelry manufacturer and retailer in the State of Hawaii, recently received four international jewelry design awards in the 2016 Jewelers’ Choice Award.

Stop by their Design Center located at 1520 Liona St. in Honolulu for a free narrated tour. View a short film followed by the tour during which you’ll see local artisans creating works of art by hand inspired by Hawaii’s natural beauty. Afterwards, browse through the showroom for your own beautiful memento to take home. Find Hawaiian Heirloom pieces; island pearls; black, red or pink coral; and specialty designs. Free shopping shuttle available too. 

Maui Divers Jewelry is also located at Ala Moana Center, Hilton Hawaiian Village and DFS T-Galleria Waikīkī. Find stores near your location: https://www.mauidivers.com/apps/store-locator
Image Alt Text: Maui Divers Jewelry Design Center - Oahu

Title: Big Kahuna Luau
Content: This luau takes place at the exclusive Nutridge Estate in the Tantalus area of Honolulu, and is considered one of Oahus best-kept secrets. Enjoy a delicious menu and award-winning entertainment with views of Honolulu's city lights as the sun sets on the horizon. Limited seating ensures a unique experience.

Title: Cinnamon's At The Ilikai
Content: This local favorite in Kailua since 1985 now shares its' popular dishes with Hawaii visitors for breakfast, lunch and dinner at the Ilikai. You'll be more than satisfied with the friendly service and delicious meals that are fresh and free from chemicals, preservatives and additives. Weekly specials and take-out are available too.

Title: Wood & Bucket Tapas Bar & Grill
Content: This eco-friendly gathering spot offers Euro-Asian tapas-style plates alongside its specialty entrees such as its signature Lilikoi Ribs, the popular Sizzling Steak Platter and Sizzling Half Chicken. Tapas recommendations include the fresh Ahi Pokedon (also available as a tapas dish), Foie Gras Burger Slider and Lamb Chop Lollipop. Enjoy delicious flavors at moderate prices! If you've never enjoyed the Japanese tradition of ashiyu, soaking your feet in a public foot bath, bar patrons can experience it here.

Title: Big Wave Shrimp
Content:
Walk up to the window at the colorful Big Wave Shrimp food truck and you’ll see Kawita Stacy ready to cook up a tasty plate of fresh isle shrimp.

Born and raised in Thailand, the mecca of street food, Stacy simply likes cooking. She’s been in the kitchen since her teens with her father at the helm. “My father taught me how to cook outstanding food since I was a teenager,” says Stacy. “I wanted to start a food business so I could cook delicious food for people.”

Big Wave Shrimp opened in 2005. Their Crunchy Shrimp plate was featured on Guy Fieri’s Food Network TV program, “Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives,” and is included in the website’s “Guy’s Top Eats in the Aloha State.” It’s made with large butterflied shrimp dipped in tempura batter and coated in panko before being pan fried. Customers get 10 pieces served with rice, veggies and a sweet-and-spicy dipping sauce. Other favorites are the Garlic Shrimp and Lemon Peppered Shrimp, plus find other items as well.

Each plate comes with a heaping dose of aloha and wishes for a healthy, wealthy and happy long life. “I’m always happy to welcome and greet customers who are kind to visit and trust us, and share conversation,” says Stacy. “People trust us by eating our food, so we do our best everyday.”

She says she eats the Spicy Shrimp because it’s her favorite. “It’s so yummy and broke da mouth!” says Stacy. Then adds, “But every menu item is delicious.”

Title: Bombay Palace
Content: Convenient to the heart of Waikiki, Bombay Palace serves authentic North Indian cuisine characterized by thick, tasty gravies. The menu includes an offering of naan breads, tandoori kebabs, exotic curries and vegetarian dishes.

Title: Burn'n Love
Content: Created especially for Hawaii, Burn'n Love captures the Elvis whom fans in the islands experienced in the 70's. Darren Lee has been performing as Elvis since he was 15 years old and carries on the King's legacy on Maui and now, on Oahu. Enjoy a trip back in time listening to your favorite songs, and seeing lots of memorable hip-shaking dance moves and Elvis iconic outfits. If youre not already a fan, you will be by the end of the show!

Title: Fourever Fab Performs The Best Of The Beatles
Content: Whether you're familiar with the music of The Beatles or not, one night with Fourever Fab will make you a fan. Comprised of seasoned musicians who have performed the timeless hits of The Beatles for years, this group of four tribute artists takes you back to the 60's and 70's with songs that enthralled audiences worldwide. Hard Days Night, Help, Yesterday, Hey Jude and Here Comes the Sun are just a handful of tunes you'll be humming long after the show.

Title: Treasure Chest Coin Company
Content: Peer into the Treasure Chest Coin Company for exclusive jewelry and one-of-a-kind pieces of wearable art that will help you remember your vacation in paradise. Hold coins made 3,000 years ago or a piece of eight like the coins that Captain Cook and other explorers first brought to the Hawaiian Islands 250 years ago. These treasure coins are made into beautiful pieces of jewelry that will be cherished for generations. They can make custom-designed silver and gold Hawaiian Heirloom jewelry in as little as one day. These are the same designs that have been popular for over 100 years. Design your own piece to commemorate your visit, birthday or other special event. Beautiful handmade silver and gold chains, vintage jewelry and many other affordable gifts are also at the Treasure Chest. Find high quality pieces that aren't necessarily high priced.

Title: Top Of Waikiki
Content:
Dinner at Top of Waikiki is a must. Experience Hawaii's only revolving restaurant serving up panoramic views of Diamond Head, Waikiki Beach, the Pacific Ocean and Waikiki in one seating. However, the highlight of your visit will be the award-winning Hawaii regional steak and seafood by Executive Chef Lance Kosaka, who heads a team that includes Pastry Chef Heather Bryan and Director of Mixology Jennifer Ackrill.

The signature dish is the Over the Top Surf & Turf for Two, featuring a 22-ounce bone-in prime porterhouse steak, two Tristan de Cunha lobster tails, Maris Cut crab legs, triple garlic butter, and roasted red bliss potatoes served with parmesan, asparagus and carrots. Coming in close behind as the top three dishes are the Filet Mignon and Kurobota Pork Chop.

Go early, 4:30-6:30 p.m., and enjoy the Sunset Specials offering favorite meal options at great prices. Start off with a menu of delectable appetizers and small plates from $8, and take it over the top with a specially handcrafted cocktail developed by renowned mixologist Jennifer Ackrill. The signature drink is the Top of Waikikilight and dark rums with passion fruit and orgeat, pineapple and fresh-pressed lime juices.

Title: Newt At The Royal
Content: If you’re searching for that signature hat to top off your elegant to casual look, there’s only one place to go for exceptional, handmade hats—Newt at the Royal. Here you’ll find the highest quality Sombrero handwoven from Montecristi, Ecuador featuring lightness in color and a consistently super-fine weave. Stop by for a broad range of classic styles and sizes for men and women and experience personalized fitting by the experts at Newt at the Royal. You’ll also find retro-print aloha shirts in a cool and contemporary color palate.

Title: Bills Waikiki
Content: Inspired by fresh island produce and a fusion of Vietamese, Japanese and indigenous cuisines, the menu features a clean, fresh flavor palate, serving up all the bills classics, and a new addition: pizza. One of the most popular dishes is part of the Bills Classics menu, the Sweet Corn Fritters with roast tomato, spinach, bacon and avocado salad.

Title: Waimea Bay Beach Park
Content: Home to monster waves in the winter, Waimea becomes a beautiful turquoise bay perfect for swimming in summer. The small parking lot fills up fast, so go early! Picnic areas, showers, restrooms.

Title: Ko ʻOlina Lagoons
Content:
Ko ʻOlina lagoons are comprised of four pristine, man-made lagoons on the Leeward coast of Oʻahu: Kohola Lagoon, Honu Lagoon, Naiʻa Lagoon and Ulua Lagoon. This privately owned area features calm waters, lush grassy hills and designated picnic areas.

Surrounded by popular accommodations including the Four Seasons Resort Oʻahu at Ko ʻOlina, Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa, Beach Villas at Ko ʻOlina and Marriott’s Ko ʻOlina Beach Club, the four lagoons are crescent-shaped, and are all within walking distance from each other. Encompassing over 600 acres of soft sand and crystal clear waters, Ko ʻOlina lagoons are easily accessible to the general public, though parking areas are limited and available on a first-come, first-serve basis.

Because Ko ʻOlina property is privately owned, the following is prohibited at the lagoons: alcoholic beverages, cigarettes, pets, loud music, metal-detecting, fires, camping, tents, sun shades, bicycles, skates, skateboards, Frisbees, kites, ball playing, fishing, scuba, surfboards and other watercrafts.

Helpful tip: Head out to Ko ʻOlina early to nab a good parking spot, then spend the day relaxing at one or more of the lagoons. You can frolic in the ocean, enjoy a picnic lunch and watch the breathtaking sunset along the Leeward coast.

Title: Ala Moana Beach Park
Content:
Ala Moana Beach Park is an iconic spot on Oʻahu where beachgoers of all ages can swim, frolic, and relax. Boasting an enticing, white-sand beach and sprawling grounds, Ala Moana Beach Park is one of the most popular beach locations for residents and visitors alike.

Typically secluded in the early morning hours and bustling throughout the day, Ala Moana is known for its milder waters that make it suitable for everything from swimming laps to wading in the shallows. Yet surfing buffs shouldn’t discount this beach’s warm waters—paddle far enough past the reef, and you’ll enjoy a variety of surf breaks to keep your adrenaline rushing. Other recreational activities include body-boarding, wind surfing, stand up paddling, and rowing.

If the water doesn’t speak to you, there are a variety of land activities that are sure to suit your fancy. Up for a brisk jog? Planning a beach BBQ? Looking for a place to exercise? You can do all that and more with the park’s winding paths, picnic tables and grills, tennis courts, and exercise equipment. Beachgoers can also enjoy snacks from two food concession stands to satiate their hunger.

Title: Waikiki Beach
Content:
World-renowned and made up of a two-mile crescent of white sand, Waikīkī Beach is the epitome of a Hawaiʻi destination.

Because of its status as a frequently-trafficked beach, Waikīkī Beach is a great place for people watching. You can observe people from all over the world as visitors and locals alike flock to the beach throughout the year. Whether you’re looking to surf, swim, snorkel, paddle canoe, stand up paddle or simply relax on the sand, Waikīkī Beach truly has it all.

Waikīkī Beach is actually made up of multiple beaches along Oʻahu’s southern coast including Kuhio Beach, Duke Kahanamoku Beach and Fort DeRussy Beach Park, just to name a few. Each sub-section of the beach is known for something different, making it one of the most entertaining and exciting spots on the island. Looking to try your hand at stand up paddle boarding? Do you prefer snorkeling to explore the underwater world? Or are you someone who’d rather spend the day building sandcastles near the shore? Do all that and more at Waikīkī Beach. Then linger through the early evening hours to catch a spectacular sunset and picturesque views of Diamond Head.

Title: Hanauma Bay Beach
Content: This haven for marine life is the perfect introduction for novice snorkelers. Go early in the morning to beat the crowd. Picnic areas, showers, restrooms, phones, snorkel rentals. $7.50 entry fee. Each person should bring a towel, swimsuit, sunscreen, and the park entrance fee of $7.50 • You may bring a small personal cooler with snacks or non alcoholic beverages - NO large coolers • A little extra cash for the snack bar or the gift shop on the upper level for souvenirs. Parking lot fills up between 7am to 7:30am.

Title: Kailua Beach

Title: Kee Beach
Content: This north shore beach is beautiful, with views of the Napali coast. A rocky reef protects a white sand lagoon. Good snorkeling. Restrooms, lifeguard. Use caution; rough water in winter.

Title: Hanalei Beach Park
Content: The view from this stretch of beach was made famous in the movie South Pacific. Spectacular vistas and great swimming conditions. Lifeguard on duty.

Title: Lydgate State Park
Content:
Situated near the Wailua River in East Kauaʻi, Lydgate State Park is a picturesque spot for families looking to enjoy a casual day at the beach. Boasting a rich history and named after a prominent former leader on Kauaʻi, Lydgate offers a man-made, salt-water pool and calm waters ideal for beach-goers of all ages.

Because of its tranquil waters, Lydgate is a great place for beginning snorkelers and those frolicking along the sand. Its enclosed ponds create a barrier from the rougher waves, while small, tropical fish make their way toward the reef. This is a great place to rent or grab your snorkeling gear and enjoy the amazing sights of underwater creatures in a protected area.

In addition to its child-friendly waters, Lydgate State Park also offers on duty lifeguards, picnic areas and other facilities for you to enjoy your time in East Kauaʻi’s warm waters. There’s also Kamalani Playground, a popular community gathering space, complete with swings, walkways, bridges, hanging bars, secret pathways and much more—the playground is a huge hit with keiki and adults alike!

Title: Hanakao'o Beach Park
Content: Located off Honoapi'ilani Hwy. north of Lahaina at the south end of Ka'anapali Beach, this popular beach park is home to West Maui canoe clubs and periodically hosts state championship outrigger canoe races (it's commonly referred to as Canoe Beach). Swimming and kayaking; parasailing and jet skiing are available May-December. Restrooms, showers, picnic tables and two parking lots. It connects to Wahikuli Beach Park.

Title: Baldwin Beach Park
Content: West of historic Paia, Baldwin Beach is popular with local families and visitors from around the world. The large sandy shoreline is good for body boarding, kayaking and surfing. Phones, restrooms, showers, BBQ grills and picnic areas are available in the park.

Title: Ho'okipa Beach Park
Content: Ho'okipa Beach is world-famous for windsurfing year-round and surfing during winter months. It's a great place to watch watersports in action, but not so good for swimming due to the currents and strong winds. Phones, restrooms, showers and picnic areas are available at the park.

Title: Kamaole Beach Parks
Content: This trio of Kihei beaches, named Kamaole I, II and III, are very popular with residents and visitors. Great for snorkeling, kayaking and family fun in the morning, and good for windsurfing and kitesurfing when strong tradewinds pick up in the afternoon along the South Maui shores. Phones, restrooms, showers, picnic tables and lawn areas are in the parks.

Title: Spencer Beach Park
Content: Located next to Puukohola Heiau in Kawaihae, this sunny beach is usually calm, family-friendly and offers snorkeling on the south end. Lifeguard, showers, restrooms, picnic tables, pavilion.

Title: Hapuna Beach Park
Content: Considered the best stretch of sand on the isle, Hapuna is ranked as one of the best in the nation. Lifeguard, mini-pavilions, good swimming, plus snorkeling along the reef fronting the Hapuna Beach Prince Hotel. Kohala Coast.

Title: Laaloa Beach Park / "Magic Sands"
Content: Also called Magic Sands because waves wash out the sand in high surf. This idyllic white sand beach on Alii Drive is a favorite bodyboarding site. Lifeguard on duty, showers, restrooms, volleyball net too.

Title: Kahaluu Beach Park
Content: This gray sand beach on Alii Drive is great for snorkeling, and features an abundant population of marine life, plus sea turtles. Lifeguard, showers, restrooms, picnic tables and two pavilions.

Title: Onekahakaha Beach Park
Content: Known as the best family beach on Kalanianaole Avenue in the Hilo area with a sandy-bottomed swimming area. Lifeguard, showers, restroom, picnic facilities, shady trees, grassy areas to spread out on.

Title: Waimea Valley
Content:
Waimea Valley, located along the North Shore, is a place unlike any other. Open to the public daily as a visitor attraction, it is at its core, a very sacred and historical site.

With its lush valleys, abundant resources and free-flowing streams, Waimea Valley was given to the kahuna nui (high priests) as early as 1092 AD. Kahuna nui were experts in their field of study, whether individuals were expert healers, fishermen or prophets. Their roles were important to the ali‘i (chiefly class) and maka‘āinana (common classes). Being the home to many of the kahuna class, Waimea Valley came be known as “The Valley of the Priests.”

Waimea Valley’s Events & Marketing Manager Kimberly Anguiano says, “At Waimea, there are over 70 archaeological sites on 1,875 acres. Six of the sites are visible to the public—Hale O Lono (Hawaiian god of peace, fertility, agriculture, rainfall and music), Kau Hale, Wailele, Ku‘ula Fishing Shrine, Hale Iwi and the agricultural terraces.”

Anguiano says visitors can learn about these sites and the valley’s history through their daily cultural tours or a pre-scheduled private tour. “We try to connect to the local community and our visitors to educate them more about this special ahupuaʻa (land division) that has so much important history and plays a role in today’s community.” 

Waimea Valley has beautiful natural attractions such as the 40-foot natural rain-fed waterfall and a world-class botanical garden, but what’s truly unique about this valley is “being able to walk the land that the Hawaiian people walked for thousands of years,” says Anguiano. “There are agricultural terrace walls over 700 years old that still stand untouched.”

To help visitors and residents understand the cultural significance and history of the valley, events such as Kalo & Awa Day, May Day, Makahiki Festival, and the Summer Concert Series with Hawaiian music and hula are held each year. 

Anguiano moved from Los Angeles to the North Shore four years ago. “I grew up in Los Angeles, a large city with many different cultures, and with over 200 languages spoken,” she shares. “I felt an immediate attraction to Waimea Valley when I came to visit as a tourist.

“To be able to work and be a steward to this ahupua‘a is not an opportunity that comes often. If you come and disconnect from your phones, schedules and your next destination, the valley has a way to calm you so you can enjoy the beauty and mana (divine power) all around you that is Hawai‘i. To be able to work at a place that offers you this every day is priceless.”

Anguiano’s advice to visitors is to “Come ready to explore and learn!” Ideal for all ages, Waimea Valley has unique wildlife, historical sites, cultural and botanical tours, the waterfall, Hawaiian games, a gift shop, plus food at the Na Mea Ono snack bar. Get ready for a full day of fun!

Book Your Park Admission Today!

Full Day General Admission

Take a casual walk on a paved path through the botanical gardens and historical sites up to the waterfall. The walk is 3/4 of a mile one-way or 1 1/2 miles round trip.

Title: Foster Botanical Garden
Content: Located next to the Kwan Yin Temple in Honolulu, this 14-acre garden features rare plants from the worlds tropical regions, some of which are rare or endangered in their native habitat. Guided tours 1 p.m. Mon.-Sat. Admission: $5 general, 13 years+; $3 residents; $1 kids 6-12 years old; free for 5 and under; $25 annual family pass.

Title: Wahiawa Botanical Garden
Content: Enjoy the cool air as you stroll through 27 acres along paved paths to see native plants, Hawaiian palms, an aroid garden and more, then venture down into the ravine for a short exploration of a forested ravine. Mosquito repellent is a must, especially in the lower ravine area. Request a guided tour. Free admission.

Title: Hoomaluhia Botanical Garden
Content: This lush 400-acre beauty on Oahu's windward side sits against the magnificent Koolau mountain range. Its name, Hoomaluhia, means a peaceful refuge. Tucked behind a quiet neighborhood, the garden is tranquil and conducive to nature walks, hiking, camping and more. Drop by the visitor center. Mosquito repellent recommended. Free admission.

Title: Lyon Arboretum And Botanical Garden
Content: Located deep in Manoa Valley, the 194-acre arboretum is a wonderland of world-renowned collection of more than 5,000 tropical plant species with Aihualama Falls at the end. Explore the many areas on your own or opt for a one-hour guided tour 10 am Mon-Fri, $5 per person; Admission: $5 donation. Mosquito repellent recommended.

Title: Koko Crater Botanical Garden
Content: Still in the early stages of development, this 60-acre garden located within the slopes and basin of Koko Crater, is a prime example of a xeriscape with its collection of cacti and succulents, dryland palms, baobabs and native Hawaiian plants. Enjoy a 1.5-hour, two-mile self-guided walk or arrange for a guided group tour. No paved trails or facilities. Free admission.

Title: Coconut Marketplace
Content:
Situated in a coconut grove in Kapaʻa, Kauaʻi, Coconut Marketplace offers open-air shopping in a beautiful setting. Browse through its over 25 shops, boutiques and dining establishments while you breathe in the fresh, open air. Vendors offer everything from gifts and music to art galleries, jewelry and apparel. The fun never stops at Coconut Marketplace!

More than just another retail spot, Coconut Marketplace also offers a variety of free activities and events for the local community. Among the festivities include a free authentic hula show every Wed. at 5 p.m. and Sat. at 1 p.m., and free Hawaiian Storytime for keiki every Tues. and Thur. at 11 a.m.

Looking for live entertainment in Kapaʻa? Enjoy the soothing sounds of live Hawaiian music by talented Larry Rivera every Fri. at 5 p.m. There’s also a Farmer’s Market every Tues. and Thur. from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. for visitors and locals looking for organic and/or locally grown produce. A new tradition at Coconut Marketplace is the free Family Movie Night, taking place on the last Sat. of every month by Center Stage.

Title: Kihei Kalama Village
Content: Stroll through an eclectic mix of over 40 specialty shops plus 14 eateries in a covered open-air setting. Find everything from beach and surf wear, made in Hawaii apparel, island home decor and art, jewelry, crafts, ceramics and more. Dining choices include snack shops, barbecue and exciting night life spots. Ample parking is available.

Title: Lahaina Visitor Center
Content: Lahaina Visitor Center is a one-stop shop for visitor information, Lahaina posters and Maui-made gift items located on the ground floor of Old Lahaina Courthouse, between the Banyan Tree and Lahaina Harbor. Throughout this historic building, view photos and displays of old Lahaina. See Marine Sanctuary videos in the theater room; browse the Lahaina Heritage Museum & NOAA Exhibits upstairs. Visit two Lahaina Arts Society galleries downstairs. Free admission.

Title: Hyatt Shops
Content: Stroll colorful and elegant shops with international flavor to see many of Maui's beautiful treasures. Pick up gifts for yourself and friends at an array of stores including art galleries, resortwear boutiques, fine jewelers, specialty collectibles, souvenirs and daily sundries and personal items. Valet and free self-parking.

Title: Whalers Village
Content:
In the heart of bustling Ka‘anapali Beach Resort is a one-of-a-kind shopping and dining destination, Whalers Village. Perched over the scenic shoreline of Ka‘anapali Beach against a backdrop of the picturesque island of Lana‘i, Whalers Village is home to 58 internationally recognized shops, island style boutiques, fine jewelry stores, art galleries, casual cafes and world-class restaurants.

Whalers Village is in the final stages of a multi-million dollar renovation to revitalize and recreate an exceptional shopping destination for Maui visitors and residents to enjoy. Inspired by the ocean and mountains, its open-air spaces, walkways and gathering places combine cool water features and warm woods with tropical landscaping. 

Cultural arts classes, live music and hula shows are complimentary and offered weekly. If you’re musically inclined, take an ‘ukulele lesson on Mondays from 2-3 p.m. or 3-4 p.m. Try your hand at lei making on Tuesdays and Fridays from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Hula lessons are given on Thursdays 3-4 p.m. On Wednesday and Saturday evenings, enjoy a hula show 7-8 p.m. Live music is performed on Sundays 6-8 p.m.

By car: Take Honoapi‘ilani Highway (Route 30) north from Lahaina to Ka‘anapali (or south from Kapalua Resort and Napili). Turn onto Ka‘anapali Parkway and follow it until you see the sign for Whalers Village; turn left. Over 500 parking spaces are available in a multilevel parking garage. Parking is complimentary for up to six hours with validation.

By shuttle: Within Ka‘anapali Beach Resort, take the free Ka‘anapali Trolley, which runs multiple times a day between 10 a.m. and 10 p.m.

Title: King's Village
Content: King’s Villagein the heart of Waikiki takes you to turn-of-the-century Honolulu with its cobblestone path meandering amid more than 45 shops and restaurants. Farmer’s Market is 4-9 p.m. every Mon., Wed., Fri. and Sat.; live entertainment 6:30 p.m. every Thurs. and Sun.

Title: Koko Marina Center
Content: Savor a cold brew and hot pizza on the water, pick up a unique gift or memento, set up a thrilling, day-long ocean adventure or catch the latest flick at the eight-plex movie theatre. Located just below Hanauma Bay, Koko Marina Center is a great place to recharge after a busy day. Dine, shop and relax in an open-air environment.

Title: Waikele Premium Outlets
Content: The only outlet center on Oahu, Waikele Premium Outlets is located just 30 minutes away from Honolulu and draws residents and visitors in search of money-saving deals daily. Its a true shoppers paradise! You'll find more than 50 designer and brand name outlet stores including Calvin Klein, Coach, Kate Spade New York, Michael Kors, Polo Ralph Lauren, LeSportsac, Saks Fifth Avenue OFF 5TH, Tommy Hilfiger and many more. Dining options include an open-air food pavilion and nearby restaurants. Take the convenient shuttle to reach the stores further away.

Title: A. Feinberg Gallery
Content: Located in the Shops at Wailea, the gallery features the photography of Kauai-based Aaron Feinberg. Find a wide array of images: abstracts, fine art nudes, flora, landscapes, waterfalls, structures, water and sky.

Title: Kauai Activities Discount
Content: Kauai Activities Discount offers "the best prices" on dinner cruises, luaus, land tours, hiking, helicopter tours and snorkeling.

Title: Angela Headley Gallery
Content: Capturing the vistas, foliage and people of Kauai, Angela Headley offers her original oils, watercolors and pastels also as giclees. Giclees are available with a gallery wrap, a reverse image printed on all sides, as an alternative to traditional framing.

Title: Air Ventures Hawaii
Content: Air Ventures offers airpane and bi-plane fun while soaring over the incredible beauty of Kauai. The company operates GA-8 Airvans where there are no middle seats and a snazzy red YMF-5 Super bi-plane with an open-air cockpit. Enjoy two-way communication headset with pilot, who points out the many landmarks along the way.

Title: Urahutia Productions- Aulii Luau Premieru
Content: E komo mai! We welcome you to join us at our oceanfront lu'au at Po'ipu Beach. Enjoy a traditional lei greeting, Polynesian crafts & demonstrations, a Hawaiian imu (underground oven), and a lavish buffet dinner.

Title: Banana Patch Studio
Content: Using solar-powered kilns, artists at Banana Patch create hand-painted ceramic tiles, pottery and other decorative items. Gifts include coasters, clocks, house numbers, cards, books, wooden signs, bronze hardware and organic spices. Sister locations in the Kong Lung Center in Kilauea and at Kilohana Planation in Puhi.

Title: Cane Field Clothing and Gallery
Content: Find stylish clothing, jewelry, accessories and art at Cane Field Clothing located at Kilohana Planation. The store offers one-of-a-kind jewelry handcrafted by local designer, organic beauty and home products by Maile, vintage photo prints of Kauai and floral paintings, giclees and prints by Cher McMacken.

Title: Cariloha
Content:
Cariloha offers an entire line of bamboo products, including apparel, bedding, bath goods, accessories, fitness wear, handbags and more all made of bamboo. Find bed and bath, gifts and clothing for men, women and baby.

Located in Poipu Shopping Village.

Title: Captain Andy's
Content: Capt. Andy's offers sailing adventures, raft expeditions and personalized island yachting aboard 65-foot Star Class Catamarans. Enjoy sunset dinner cruises along the Na Pali and live Hawaiian music on the Poipu Sunset Sail. Capt. Andy's has been delivering quality, adventure and fun since 1980.

Title: Cheap Tours Hawaii
Content: With 38 years experience in the visitor industry, Cheap Tours offers top tours at reduced prices. Choose from air, land and water options plus advice on where to eat, swim and free things to do.

Title: Del Sol
Content:
Del Sol is a leader of color-changing apparel and accessories using Spectrachrome color-changing crystals. The crystals open and unfold upon exposure to sunlight, revealing their hidden colors. Find apparel, accessories and nail polish.

Located in Poipu Shopping Village

Title: The Fresh Shave
Content: Hawaii's icy treat, shave ice, is served using natural, fresh, local and organic produce to create flavors. Choices include unique combinations like chia tea and cream, coconut and lime or pineapple and coconutcomplete with handcrafted toppings. Flavors are named for a different mustache shape as that's what you'll be wearing after noshing this refreshing treat.

Title: Gaylord's at Kilohana
Content: Gaylord's serves tropical-inspired cuisine. The specialty is Hoisin-glazed pork spare ribs atop pineapple fried that's served with Asian slaw. Don't miss the Kilohana Plantation Pie: roasted pineapple and mac nut toffee ice cream and rum caramel topped with vanilla whipped cream and toasted coconut chips. After dining, browse the many shops at Kilohana Plantation. Full bar and large wine list.

Title: Hanapepe Economic Alliance
Content: Located on Kauai's rural west side, Hanapepe Town offers a unique collection of shops, galleries and eating establishments. The town's architecture has a wild west flavor and the Historic Hanapepe Walking tour points out 43 points of interest, including the landmark swinging bridge. Park your car and take a browsing break!

Title: Island Helicopters Kauai
Content:
Island Helicopters Kauai, Inc. has been providing deluxe helicopter tours from the Lihue Airport longer than any other company. In addition, they are the only company on Kauai that is permitted to land at a waterfall during a helicopter tour. All of Island Helicopters’ highly skilled professional pilots have thousands of hours, and numerous years of flying experience.

Island’s fleet of six-passenger, Airbus (formerly Eurocopter) AStar helicopters boast paramount viewing opportunities with their custom ceiling to floor windows. Due to Kauai’s daily variable weather conditions (i.e. temperature, humidity, precipitation, wind), Island elects to fly “doors-on”. With their helicopters’ distinctive windows, Island’s tours provide passengers with the best views, in an AStar’s quiet and safe, climate-controlled environment.

Bonnie and Curt Lofstedt (owners of Island Helicopters) employ a staff of 18 (on average), some of which have been with them for over 30 years! All of Island’s pilots and employees reside on Kauai with their families. Both the company and all of its pilots are FAA Certified Part 135. Curt personally selects and trains every one of their exceptional pilots, all of whom have excellent safety records and thousands of hours of flying experience.

Curt and Bonnie have kept their company small by choice, but their standards are always the highest. The safety, comfort and satisfaction of each customer are their main concerns. Since 1980, Island Helicopters has specialized in providing personalized tours for the independent traveler, families, and groups of all sizes. With the majority of this picturesque island unreachable by car, a helicopter tour is the most ecologically friendly way to see one of the most beautiful places in the world in it’s entirety.

Kauai's Only Jurassic Falls Landing Tour

For the first time ever, visitors can now land at Manawaiopuna Falls and feel the awesome power of the waterfall made famous in Steven Spielberg’s blockbuster movie Jurassic Park. This elite tour is 75-80 minutes (air+landing).  It includes our Grand Deluxe Circle Island tour PLUS a landing deep within the interior of Kauai, inaccessible to the public.

After setting down near the base of the 400-foot falls, your pilot will guide you along a jungle path adjacent to a stream to the bottom of the spectacular falls. Feel the tropical mist, take pictures and learn the fascinating history of this remote area including native plants, geologic formations and agricultural history.

Book An Island Helicopters Kauai Tour Today!

Jurassic Falls Helicopter Landing Adventure

After setting down near the base of the 400-foot falls, your pilot will guide you along a jungle path adjacent to a stream to the bottom of the spectacular falls.

1.25 Hrs.

DETAILS

Title: Island Taco
Content: Hand-crafted tortillas filled with unique ingredients is what makes Island Taco so special: wasabi-seared Hawaiian tuna, slow-cooked kalua pork, blackened mahimahi, cilantro lime tofu and seasoned beef with sweet chili sauce. Burritos, quesadillas, enchiladas, taco salads and Mexican-style sides too. Open for luch and dinner. Also open in Waimea for lunch.

Title: Island Soap & Candle Works
Content: Find 40 different fragrances of handmade soaps and candles, plus lotions and butters, balms and salves, body and bath aids and unique island gifts. Signature items include the Hawaiian coconut oil soaps with tropical fragrances like Creamy Coconut, Mango Coconut Guava and Plumeria Blossom. Two sister locations in the Princeville Shopping Center and The Kong Lung Center.

Title: Jack Harter Helicopters
Content: Dedicated to quality and safety since 1962, Jack Harter offers 60- and 90-minute tours aboard A Star or Hughes 500 aircraft. One-hour tours are a minimum 60 minutes in the air. Soar over natural landmarks best scene by air like the Na Pali Coast and Waimea Canyon.

Title: Just Live
Content: Choose from three different tree-canopy zipline adventures. Fun can include sky bridges, 60-foot rock climbing wall, 60-foot monster swing and 100-foot rappelling tower. Get into all this activity amid and beauty of Kauai's forest and mountain scenery.

Title: Marriott's Kauai Lagoons-Kalanipuu
Content: The upscale vacation hideaway features more than 500 acres of tropical foliage, lagoons and dramatic coastline overlooking Kalapaki Beach. Golf at the Jack Nicklaus-designed Kauai Lagoons Golf Club, swim in the two-level pool or enjoy tennis. Two-bedroom villas are equipped with gourmet kitchens, Hawaiian-inspired furnishings and numerous amenities.

Title: Kilohana Plantation
Content:
Kilohana Plantation is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Kauai. This plantation offers a unique look into Kauai's history and is definitely worth a visit! This article will discuss everything you need to know about the Kilohana Plantation. We will cover its history, what you can expect to see there, and how to get there. So if you're looking for someplace new to explore on your next trip to Kauai, check out the Kilohana Plantation!

History of the Kilohana Plantation

The very first owner of these estates was a man named Albert Spencer Wilcox, an original Mormon missionary. He first developed it as a working cattle ranch to supplement the booming agricultural industry on Kauai at the time. Later on, in 1936 Albert's nephew, Gaylord Parke Wilcox took over the ranch and built Kauai's very first mansion. The house was designed by a famous British architect and was surprisingly modern for the time it was built. Today, the 16,000-square-foot Kauai house has been meticulously restored to its 1930s elegance and charm with specialty stores, art galleries, and Gaylord's restaurant with a great atmosphere. The rooms have been restored to their original state, with half of the original furniture present. The gardens and orchards were replanted to stay with the original plans. Kilohana is located in the middle of 35 acres of pasture, cultivated grounds, gardens, and natural growth.

How To Spend A Day At Kilohana

There are a few fun activities here and it can be a great way to spend a day, whether you would like to learn more about the area or enjoy the scenery - it's a great Kauai day trip.

Plantation Tour: Farm & Orchard

Enjoy a ride on the Kauai Plantation Railway and take a tour through the beautiful farms and orchards of the Kilohana Estate. You can even get Koloa rum and fresh fruits as you learn more about the area. If you'd like to get out and see more of the area, you can take a walk or hike through the rainforest and feed some of the farm animals.

Explore The Estate

This old sugar plantation can now be explored. Walk around all 140 acres and learn about the vast history behind it. Shop at the boutiques, or stop by the Koloa Rum Company for some island made rum.

Gaylord's Restaurant

Gaylord's is one of the most popular restaurants on Kauai and for good reason. The menu features a mix of local specialties and classic American dishes, all prepared with fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. But the real draw of Gaylord's is its setting. The restaurant is located in an old plantation house, and the sprawling grounds are dotted with tropical plants and flowers. Dining on the outdoor patio is a truly magical experience, made all the more special by the spectacular views of the nearby waterfall. You can even enjoy live music here! Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner spot or a place to enjoy a delicious meal with family and friends, Gaylord's is sure to please.

Visit the Shops!

There are a few different boutique stores to spend some time in. Find authentic Hawaiian clothes, treats, and more. Here are just a few of the stores to visit:
  • Hawaiian Collection Room - Hawaiian Collectibles and Souvenirs
  • The Artisans Room - An Art Gallery
  • Kauai Sweet Shoppe - Kauai Made Island Treats & Sweets
  • The Pua Bar - Pop Up Floral Boutique

Visiting Kilohana Plantation: Information

  • Getting into the restored house is free
  • Open 9:30am - 9:30pm

Enjoy Kilohana Estates & Plantation

Kilohana estates and plantation is one of the best places to visit if you want to have a great time. The environment there is perfect for a family outing or even a romantic getaway. You can spend your time walking through the plantation, soaking in the views of the gorgeous greenery, and learning about the history of the area.

Title: Kipu Ranch Adventures
Content:
Kipu Ranch is a 3,000 acre property extending from the Huleia River to the top of Mt. Haupu. It is home to many movie sites and wildlife! The ranch has seen many changes through the years, from a sugar plantation to the working cattle ranch it is today. Kipu Ranch is a private ranch – not accessible to the general public. Ride through the ranch on your very own premium Kawasaki off-road vehicle!  All tours are guided scenic tours with a classic stop-n-go flow full of history, culture, movie locations and aloha. Come and let us share some of Kauai’s hidden beauty with you and your family.

Since 1999, Kipu Ranch Adventures is proud to be one of the top eco-tours in Hawaii. Named “Sustainable Tour Operator of the Year” by the Sustainable Tourism Association of Hawaii (STAH), our knowledgeable, versatile, and safety-conscious Kauai tour guides are excited to welcome you to Kipu Ranch.

Book A Kipu Ranch Adventure Today!

Ultimate Kauai Off-Road Ranch Tour

Join us for a beautiful and breathtaking 3-hour Kauai off-road scenic tour through Kipu Ranch.

3 Hrs.

9 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Waterfall Triple Trail Expedition

Traversing the best open view, mountain, and jungle sections of all three of our trail systems combined into one epic trip.

3 Hrs.

9 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Title: Ancient Rivers Kayak
Content: Paddle the state's largest navigable river and hike to the 120-foot Secret Falls on guided kayak tours. The Wailua River was home to Kauai's monarchy. Learn about the history, movie-making spots, flora and fauna of this lush area and enjoy a deli style-lunch.

Title: Outfitters Kauai
Content: It's all about adventure with Outfitters Kauai: three zipline tours, a waterfall or Na Pali Coast kayak, downhill bicycling, swimming beneath a waterfall in a jungle pool and stand up paddle boarding. Also equipment rentals: bikes and kayaks.
Categories: Activities & Fun>Biking|Rentals>Equipment Rentals|Activities & Fun>Kayaking|Services|Activities & Fun>Zipline Tours
