_yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Visiting Oahu? The friendly and accommodating crew of Ko Olina Ocean Adventures is ready to take you out for a day of snorkeling.
rank_math_title: %title% %page% %sep% Oahu Snorkel Tour | %sitename%
rank_math_description: Visiting Oahu? The friendly and accommodating crew of Ko Olina Ocean Adventures is ready to take you out for a day of snorkeling.

Title: Breakout Waikiki
Content: Challenge your brain and test your analytical skills with friends, family or coworkers with this live action escape game in Waikiki thats generating a lot of buzz. Breakout Waikiki has three different rooms: Room 13, The Hatch, and Mission Manoa in which you have one hour to figure out the clue that will free you and your cohorts. Breakout before the one-hour time limit and your picture goes on the Wall of Fame; fail, and its the Wall of Shame for you! Three clues are provided if needed. Instead of hitting the bar, try this game for a night of guaranteed fun. Lots of good fun! Open daily.

Title: Paradise Pedals Hawaii Tours
Content: Hop on board a 15-passenger bike and start pedaling as you get to know your fellow travelers on various tours. The most popular is the 2.5-hour Kakaako Bar Tour that takes you to three local brewpubs and bars (21 and over only). On the two-hour Morning Pedal Tour, play bingo while pedaling to Ala Moana Beach Park and back with photo ops in between (12 years and older). Custom tours are also available for family reunions, team building and other special events. Dress casual, wear shoes and bring snacks if you like. Tip: There are five seats that don't require pedaling! Tours daily.

Title: Hawaii's Plantation Village
Content: Learn about the days when sugar was king and how people of different ethnicities came together and lived in plantation villages. That's what you'll find at Hawaii's Plantation Village located in Waipahu. Take a guided walk through the early 1900's in more than 25 authentic plantation homes and structures such as the store, infirmary, community bathhouse, managers office and more. It's here that people from Hawaii, China, Portugal, Puerto Rico, Japan, Korea and the Philippines traveled in order to build a new life and send money to support families back home. Also find a gift shop on the premises featuring homemade crafts, cookbooks, toys and more. General admission $13; discounts available.

Title: Yim Siam Thai Therapeutic Massage
Content: The Thai therapists at Yim Siam Thai Therapeutic Massage located at the Waikiki Grand Hotel are trained and certified at the WATPO Temple School of Thai Traditional Medical Massage in Bangkok, Thailand. This means customers will receive a no-frills Thai massage from an experienced masseuse who knows the human body. If you're looking for relief from chronic or acute pain, relaxation or increased flexibility, youll find it through the types of massage offered: traditional Thai, sports, lomi lomi, deep tissue, Swedish, combination, as well as massage for neck, shoulders, lower back, knee and sciatica. Couples massage available too. Services are very affordable.

Title: Soul Signature Tattoo & Art Studio
Content: Bring your imagination and Soul Signature in Honolulu will make it a reality with the assistance of tattoo artists who strive to create the best original tattoo for their customers. More than simply creating a custom tattoo, they're about having each customer spiritually connect with his/her tattoo. Tattoo artists will work with you on a design until you're comfortable with it. Stop by and you'll receive personal attention, care and respect in their clean and professional shop.

Title: Kuhio Walk-In Medical Clinic
Content: This urgent care facility in Waikiki provides caring, professional service to all who step through their doors. Kuhio Walk In Medical Clinic mainly provides non-emergency medical care for conditions such as allergies; asthma; broken bones and sprains; burns; cold and flu symptoms; stomach viruses; ear, sinus and respiratory infections; insect and animal bites; skin rashes; and other non-life threatening conditions. They accept most medical insurance. Perfect for Hawaii's visitors who require attention to a health issue and residents for physical certification.

Title: Freaky Tiki Tropical Optical
Content: The staff at Freaky Tiki Tropical Optical have received lots of kudos from Yelpers for their extremely helpful and professional customer service. Rest assured that if you shop at a Freaky Tiki, you'll leave satisfied with sunglasses that perfectly reflect you and your lifestyle. They carry a wide range of eyewear brands from luxury to fashion to performance. Some of the brands include Coach, Gucci, Kate Space, Prada, Tiffany & Co., Tom Ford, Maui Jim, Oakley, Ray-Ban, Persol and more. You'll have to stop by to experience it for yourself. Locations at Ala Moana Center, Waikiki Beach Walk and Outrigger Waikiki Hotel.

Title: Kaimana Tours
Content: Experience the natural beauty and favorite attractions of Oahu with the knowledgeable staff of Kaimana Tours. Serving Hawaii's visitors since 2004, the company offers full-service transportation for sightseeing tours and excursions. Tours are available for hiking the Diamond Head State Monument, snorkeling at Hanauma Bay, walking on the Makapuu Lighthouse trail and Manoa Falls, plus a combination of the activities. They also rent snorkel gear with or without a tour purchase.

Title: Hunter Hanauma Bay Snorkel Shuttle
Content: Hunter Hanauma Bay Snorkel Shuttle is dedicated to shuttling visitors to and from Oahus #1 snorkel site every day. Call to schedule transportation and youll also be able to rent snorkel gear for your day in the bay. You'll be amazed by the incredible variety of colorful fish waiting just below the oceans surface. See large rainbow-colored parrot fish and hear them nibbling on the reef; see schools of bright yellow tangs; the slim trumpetfish; the state fish, humuhumunukunukuapuaa; and perhaps even an endangered Hawaiian green sea turtle. Call for reservations and enjoy your snorkel experience!

Title: Discover Hawaii Tours
Content: Discover Hawaii Tours provides tours on the four major islands of Oahu, Maui, the Big Island and Kauai with a wide array of activities to select from, including interisland tours. Every island has its' similarities, but each also has its natural landmarks and visitor attractions that set it apart: Pearl Harbor, Polynesian Cultural Center, Diamond Head, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, the summit of Mauna Kea, the road to Hana, Molokini and so much more. Eco tours, hiking, dolphin excursions, luau, cultural outings and helicopter tours round out the selection. Plus, you'll not only see the island, but learn about its history, cultural significance and folklore courtesy of your knowledgeable guide.

Title: Great Life Tours
Content: Great Life Tours is a small tour and activity company located at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony in Waikiki that provides information on a wide range of activities so you can plan your perfect Hawaii vacation. They offer cruises, visitor attractions, nighttime entertainment, interisland travel, one-day tours to the neighbor islands, as well as car rental services and more.

Title: Hawaii Convertible Tours
Content: Zip around Oahu with your own private chauffeur and knowledgeable guide in an easy-to-get-around convertible. Owner and operator Mark of Hawaii Cabriolet Tours is dedicated to creating an itinerary that reflects what you want to see and do, as well as offers insightful suggestions to make it ever better. Looking for picture-perfect photo ops? The best places to eat? Or see the islands historical sites? Mark will take you wherever you want to go while sharing historical, cultural and fun information along the way. This is a personalized tour at its best! Open daily.

Title: Hawaii Turtle Tours
Content:
Hawaii Turtle Tours prides itself on providing intimate, family-style tours to a variety of Oahu popular locations around the island. Jump on the shuttle for a day of sightseeing and learning about the history and culture of the island from a locals perspective. The Turtle Eco Adventure Tour is the most popular with stops at Diamond Head Lookout, Halona Blowhole, Sandy Beach, Makapuu Beach, Secret Beach, macadamia nut farm, Sunset Beach, lunch at Turtle Town, snorkeling at Turtle Beach and Dole Plantation. They also offer private, customized tours for groups of two to 25 people. Tours available daily.

Book A Private Hawaii Turtle Tour Today!

Oahu Private Island Tour

Our fun and adventurous private tours can include groups of two to 24 people to explore our island and create memories to last a lifetime.

9 Hrs.

DETAILS

Turtle Eco Adventure

 Oahu Turtle Eco Adventure is truly a unique tour and is great fun for the entire family.

9 Hrs.

DETAILS
Image Alt Text: Hawaii Turtle Tours - Private Oahu Island Tours||||||Hawaii Turtle Tours - Oahu Private Island Tour||||||Hawaii Turtle Tours - Turtle Eco Adventure - Oahu Private Tours||||

rank_math_title: %title% %page% %sep% Oahu Private Tours | %sitename%
rank_math_description: Hawaii Turtle Tours prides itself on providing intimate, family-style tours to a variety of Oahu popular locations around the island.

Title: Honolulu Exposed- Devil's Den
Content: Learn about Chinatown in the 1800s and its history of the bubonic plague and fire on Honolulu Exposed’s Devil’s Den Tour 7 p.m. every Friday and Saturday. Spots are limited so call for reservations. Located in front of O'Toole's Pub.

Title: KOS Tours, Inc.
Content: KOS Tours is the first and only HUMMER tour operation on Oahu. The island has been the film location of countless movies, films and TV shows, the most memorable being the series LOST, and KOS Tours takes you to see many of these locations. Three tours are offered, but the Circle Island Tour is the ultimate LOST tour visiting more than 30 locations/scenes shown in the series. The North Shore and South Shore tours also stop at LOST sites, as well as stops at various movie locations and areas where another popular series, Hawaii 5-0, have been filmed. This small, privately owned business specializes in private and small group tours, allowing guides the opportunity to accommodate the interests of the group, as well as share the history of the island.

Title: Oahu Nature Tours
Content: High marks on Yelp.com attest to the fact that the guides at Oahu Nature Tours are professionals and can share the island's geology, archaeology and history with their guests. Experience an in-depth adventure and learn about Oahu's rich environment and native flora and fauna. Oahu Nature Tours offers lots of activities on Oahu, Kauai, Maui and the Big Island ranging from circle-island tours to kayak and ocean activities, as well as luau to flight adventures and interisland tours. Visit their website to see the options available.

Title: North Shore Eco Tours
Content: Gain insight into Oahu away from white sand beaches and pineapple fields with North Shore Eco Tours, a company that guarantees you'll walk away from their tours with a deeper appreciation of Oahu. Guides are Hawaiian educators and cultural practitioners who strive to create fun and engaging educational tours for guests that also preserve the cultural integrity of Oahu's natural resources. Head out on one of three hiking adventures ranging from easy to challenging all offer unique off-road experiences in Oahu's environment and provide a deeper understanding of the landscape, flora and fauna. The only off-road expedition offered is a Hawaiian safari aboard a Swiss Military Pinzgauer taking you into the private lands of sacred Waimea Valley. There are only eight seats available on this 11-mile journey!

Title: Mopeds Direct
Content: Get your mopeds or rent one from Mopeds Direct located on Kapahulu Avenue. Established in 1989 and designated with an A rating from the Better Business Bureau, Mopeds Direct is ready to get you on one of their many selections of mopeds. When you just want something fast and zippy to get from Point A to Point B, choose a moped from a large fleet. Half-day up to seven-day rental rates are available.

Title: Mermaids of Hawaii
Content: Create a special memory as you transform yourself into a mermaid with the help of Rebecca, otherwise known as Mermaid Citrine, owner of Mermaids of Hawaii. Schedule a photo shoot, and Rebecca provides the tops, tails and accessories for babies to adultsmen and women of all sizes. Mermaid Citrine is also available for events such as birthday parties to add a special touch to your event. Call for more information.

Title: Hokulani Bake Shop
Content: Hokulani Bake Shop at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki creates delightful and delicious handmade cupcakes made from scratch that contain real butter and sugar, and no hydrogenated oils or corn syrup. Buy just one to satisfy that urge or a dozen to save for later. No worries, it's all natural! It'll be hard to choose a favorite chocolate, red velvet or strawberry guava with cream cheese frosting; lilikoi with lemon cream cheese frosting; chocolate with peanut buttercream cheese frosting; and more! There are also hand-decorated cookies made from all natural ingredients in the shape of aloha shirts, dolphins, starfish, slippers, lei, butterflies, hibiscus, octopus, crabs and golf accessories. These treats are available for pickup or delivery. Three other locations too.

Title: Liliha Bakery
Content: Liliha Bakery has its' roots in its Kalihi community where it first opened in 1950 selling loaves of bread. In 1961, it opened in its' current location with an expanded menu of baked goods where for decades, it has become a family favorite. Baking from 2 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, its oven-fresh cakes and pastries are known throughout the island. But the one item that they're known for is the coco puff: magically light, chocolate-filled pastry that isn't overly sweet. The newest flavor is the green tea coco puff, but the original is still the winner! You can also order up all kinds of comfort food and local favorites in the diner.

Title: Buho Cocina y Cantina
Content: Set in the middle of Waikiki atop the Waikiki Shopping Plaza surrounded by glass, Buho is a cool open-air oasis to chill out after exploring the island or a romantic spot for a special moment just for two. Everything here is fresh offering up locally sourced poblanos, tomatillos, cilantro, lime and more. Start off with a margarita, one of their signature cocktails or selection of beers. Menu items include local ingredients such as Kulana Farm beef in the Kulana Farm Burrito and Kauai shrimp in the Buho Burrito, among others. Also find quesadillas, enchiladas, tacos, as well as appetizers and entrees.

Title: Wolfgang Steakhouse
Content: This modern take on the classic steakhouse at the Royal Hawaiian Center has visitors and locals returning with its attention to steaks, specifically, its dry aged steaks. With his background working as head waiter at the great Peter Luger Steakhouse in New York City, Wolfgang Zweiner has taken the reins to open up his own restaurants matching the core principles of his former boss, and improving upon them. Dining at a steakhouse requires ordering one of their dry aged steaks, but popular items include the lobster mac and cheese side and steak sliders with french fries from the Happy Hour menu.

Title: The Signature Prime Steak & Seafood
Content: Located on the 36th floor of the Ala Moana Hotel, The Signature Prime Steak & Seafood is most known for its aged prime grade steaks and views of the Waikiki skyline (request a window table). Go early for a casual seat at the bar and order one of their signature craft cocktails or your favorite wine. The menu isn't an extensive one, but that allows for more attention to appetizers, soups, salads, steak and chops, seafood and sides. If seafood is what you love, the Signature Seafood Tower for two may be an option for you.

Title: Dave & Busters
Content: If you're looking for good food and fun, then you're in the right spot. First off, the menu is packed with appetizers, bar food, soups, surf and turf, seafood, steaks, ribs, burgers, pasta, salads, sandwiches and desserts. Second, the choice of beverages ranges from beers to specialty drinks, and D&B snow cones to milkshakes and fountain drinks. Prices are reasonable and portions are large! Ask about the Eat & Play Combos too.

Title: Ocean House
Content: Besides the spectacular unobstructed view of the sun setting on the horizon, Ocean House in the Outrigger Waikiki Beach Resort delivers on good food and great customer service. Designed with the comfortable feel of an old Hawaiian plantation home, you'll feel at ease with the oceanfront view just feet from your table. Signature dishes include the Seafood Lau Lau, Palehu Prime Rib, Sizzling Ahi Carpaccio and Macadamia Nut Crusted Mahi Mahi; honorable mention goes to the Hawaiian Sea Salt Slow Roasted Angus Prime Rib, according to a review on Yelp.com. Tip: Another good time for reservations is Friday to enjoy the fireworks display at the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

Title: Shore Bird Restaurant & Beach Bar
Content: Enjoy lovely ocean and Diamond Head views at the open-air Shore Bird Restaurant & Beach Bar at the Outrigger Waikiki Beach Resort as you grill your choice of meat. Choose from eight-ounce choice top sirloin, 10-ounce deluxe top sirloin, 10-ounce New York steak or 12-ounce rib eye steak. You can also opt for kabobs, chicken, ribs, lobster and mahi mahi. All entrees come with the all you care to eat salad bar too. The Sunset Dinner Special is a good value at $19.95 for a half-pound Premium Angus Top Sirloin Steak and all-you-can-eat salad bar, 4-5:30 p.m. daily (must be seated by 5:30 p.m.). Shore Bird also has a breakfast buffet, an extensive lunch menu, dinner and late-night menu up to midnight. If you're looking for someplace to show off your vocal talent, stop by 9:30 p.m. for free karaoke until closing. Be sure to check their website for specials.

Title: Jamba Juice
Content:
Feeling tired? Do you need an energy boost? Just finished a workout? Then stop by Jamba Juice located in the Queen Kaahumanu Center for a healthy and delicious fresh juice, smoothie or energy bowl to get you back on your feet.

Serving up healthy and wholesome items is the mission of Jamba Juice where they've been juicing for more than 25 years. The reason they've lasted so long isn't just because their juices and smoothies are freshly blended to order and free from artificial ingredients and flavors. It's because they taste good too! Customers also love their energy bowls, oatmeal, flatbreads, baked goods, wraps and bistro sandwiches. A refreshing juice or smoothie packed with nutrients, antioxidants and real fruit is perfect any time of day.
lp_listingpro_options: a:32:{s:12:"tagline_text";s:56:"Serving Up Fresh 'n Healthy Beverages, One Cup at a Time";s:8:"gAddress";s:58:"275 West Ka‘ahumanu Avenue, Suite F-3, Kahului, HI 96732";s:8:"latitude";s:10:"20.8871323";s:9:"longitude";s:12:"-156.4749542";s:6:"mappin";s:0:"";s:5:"phone";s:12:"808-873-2003";s:8:"whatsapp";s:0:"";s:5:"email";s:0:"";s:7:"website";s:31:"http://www.jambajuicehawaii.com";s:7:"twitter";s:0:"";s:8:"facebook";s:0:"";s:8:"linkedin";s:0:"";s:7:"youtube";s:0:"";s:9:"instagram";s:0:"";s:5:"video";s:0:"";s:7:"gallery";s:0:"";s:12:"price_status";s:6:"notsay";s:10:"list_price";s:0:"";s:13:"list_price_to";s:0:"";s:7:"Plan_id";s:2:"53";s:16:"lp_purchase_days";s:0:"";s:11:"reviews_ids";s:0:"";s:15:"claimed_section";s:11:"not_claimed";s:26:"listings_ads_purchase_date";s:0:"";s:30:"listings_ads_purchase_packages";s:0:"";s:4:"faqs";a:2:{s:3:"faq";a:1:{i:1;s:0:"";}s:6:"faqans";a:1:{i:1;s:0:"";}}s:14:"business_hours";s:0:"";s:11:"campaign_id";s:0:"";s:14:"changed_planid";s:0:"";s:19:"listing_reported_by";s:0:"";s:16:"listing_reported";s:0:"";s:13:"business_logo";s:0:"";}

Title: Lanikai Juice
Content: Lanikai Juice is a local, family-built business offering items using local organic ingredients for health-conscious and gourmet patrons. Items include a wide selection of smoothies, juices and bowls to which you can add a range of supplements such as chia seeds, spiraling, ginseng and more depending on your health needs. It's so good that its received numerous awards and national recognition. Five locations islandwide open daily.

Title: Honolulu Coffee
Content: Grab a cup of joe at Honolulu Coffee before heading out to roam the island roads. Grown on the verdant slopes of Mauna Loa on the Big Island since 1992, Honolulu Coffee roasts, brews and sells its own beans. Taste the difference in a variety of drinkshot or iced espresso drinks, regular brewed coffee and yummy Kona Frost. Visit the Honolulu Coffee Experience Center and learn about the process from bean to cup 6 am-6pm daily. Also available are smoothies, acai bowls and a baked goods. Locations in Waikiki and downtown Honolulu.

Title: Peet's Coffee & Tea
Content: It all started in 1966 when Holland-born Alfred Peet opened the first Peets Coffee & Tea in Berkeley, California. That's where the first stirrings of the artisan coffee movement began, which in turn influenced a generation of coffee entrepreneurs, including the founders of Starbucks. Stop by and savor coffee made from a dark roast in small batches using fresh beans with a commitment to quality. You can taste it in their hot and iced coffees, espressos and decafs at their Waikiki and Kailua shops. Celebrating its 50th anniversary this year! Second location in Kailua.

Title: Island Vintage Coffee
Content: Wake up to a steaming cup of 100 percent Kona coffee made from beans grown in the fertile volcanic soil of the Big Islands Kona district. Roasted fresh daily, the beans create delicious coffee drinks that include their signature drinks such as Island Latte, Hawaiian Honey Latte, Lava Mocha and Vintage Kona Mocha (may vary), as well as their regular coffees. Everyone loves the acai bowl, and there are other prepared foods available as well. If you love their coffee, you can also browse through the products while waiting for your drink to be prepared.

Title: Mulvadi Coffee
Content: You'll have to make your own Mulvadi Coffee to know how delicious it is. You can find it online and in grocery stores, and you'll find them most often on sale at the local CVS Store. Mulvadi Coffee in the gold bag comes from a company that's been in business since 1997. In addition to its coffees, they also sell teas, pancake mixes, syrups, cooking oils, spices, sauces, salad dressings, as well as cookies, granola and assorted nuts.

Title: Cookie Corner
Content: Everybody loves Cookie Corner cookies! Born on Oahu in 1981 as an idea between two friends who knew they had the right ingredients for success, Cookie Corner has grown over the years to 14 locations on Oahu. Whether you like your cookies soft and chewy in the center, small and crunchy or light and crispy, Cookie Corner has a cookie in all sorts of flavors just for you. You'll be wishing you had a glass of milk! The tropical fruit bars are also a local favorite with rich and buttery shortbread crusts topped with lilikoi, lemon or key limejust the right amount of sweet and tangy in one bite. The deliciousness doesn't end there. Shortbread cookies and twice-baked biscotti are also available. Grab a treat for yourself, for the office or give them as a gift. Luckily, stores are located around Oahu with several in Waikiki!

Title: Crepe No Ka Oi
Content: Lovely aromas, luscious goodness and delicious flavors are just a few of the reasons locals flock to Crepe No Ka Oi in Kailua. Morning, noon or night, but especially on the weekends, the place is packed with locals and visitors who love their sweet and savory selection of crepes. With crepes such as the savory Hukilau filled with warm cream cheese, smoked salmon, sauteed onions and capers or the delightfully sweet Hawaiian Sugar with melted butter sprinkled with raw cane sugar and fresh lemon juice, and topped with powdered sugar, this place is a must-try. Accompany your crepe with gourmet loose leaf teas that get high marks or a cup of gourmet Illy Italian coffee. Stop by and you'll be met with lots of aloha, and hopefully, not too much of a wait, so go early!

Title: Haili's Hawaiian Food
Content: You'll always experience friendly service and delicious authentic Hawaiian food at family-run Haili's Hawaiian Foods on Kapahulu Avenue. If it's your first attempt at eating Hawaiian food or you're not too sure what to order, the staff will gladly offer up suggestions to to get you started. Since the specialty is Hawaiian food, you'll have to try one of the Hawaiian plate lunches that include different combinations of the following items: kalua pig, pork or chicken laulau, chicken long rice, lomi salmon, poke, haupia, rice or poi. Also on the menu are stews, wraps, pastele, and bowls. Using the freshest ingredients in recipes and honoring the culinary lessons passed from generation to generation has made Haili's a local favorite since 1958.

Title: Genki Sushi
Content: Pluck your choice of freshly made Japanese sushi and maki rolls as they move on a conveyor belt that continually passes by your table.

Title: Da Hawaiian Poke Shop
Content: Up for some ono (delicious) fresh poke? Da Hawaiian Poke Shop located at the Safeway Kapahulu Center delivers. Fans claim it's the freshest of the fresh that tastes oh, so good! The focus here is serving customers the freshest poke while keeping its distinctly Hawaiian roots and practicing environmental sustainability. So delicious and so simple, poke is made with the best local ingredients: line-caught ahi from Hawaii waters, fresh limu (seaweed), freshly made tofu and vegetables grown and harvested by isle farmers. Choose to create your own bowl at the Poke Bar or order one from the menu. Though not extensive, plate lunches on the menu look really good!

Title: Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.
Content: If one of your favorite movies was Forrest Gump starring Tom Hanks, you'll be in heaven at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. located at Ala Moana Center, the only one on Oahu. Walk in the door and movie references are everywhere, including the gift shop to the left. If you're not a fan, just play along and have fun with it! Cool off from the heat with a drink; choices range from popular margaritas to a limited wine selection. Or you could always try a specialty drink. On the menu are soups, salads sandwiches, ribs, steak, and shrimp, of course. If you've got room after your meal, And don't forget dessert!

Title: Aloha Table
Content: It may be a little hard to find in an alley behind Waikiki Shopping Plaza, but Aloha Table offers friendly service and a American menu with local splashes of flavor. It's popular among Japanese visitors, so you might find a long line at times, but give it a try; they're even open late to accommodate the late-night crowd. A popular item is the Premium Kobe Style Beef Loco Moco using selected Kobe beef with a special mushroom and onion demiglace sauce.

Title: Goofy Cafe & Dine
Content: Billing itself as a surfer's cafe, Goofy Cafe & Dine is popular with visitors and locals. The menu offers favorite breakfast classics with an island twist all day! Twists such as using sweet potatoes and wheat bread in the dish make it special. Also find lunch time specials such as Kahuku Corn Fried Rice, Ahi Poke Avocado Bowl; locally made beers, cocktails, healthy juice and smoothies and soft drinks.

Title: Shore Fyre Fresh Grill & Bar
Content: Located slightly off the beaten path, Shore Fyre Fresh Grill & Bar is a casual, no-frills restaurant serving up American and local fare for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Although the restaurant itself is fairly small, the entree portions are generous and, according to Yelpers, tasty. Favorites include the loco moco with fried rice, banana nut pancakes, Bacon Burger with fries and omelettes.

Title: Zpizza
Content: The upper crust of pizza is Zpizza. They use non-GMO wheat flour prepared fresh daily, award-winning skim mozzarella from Wisconsin grass-fed cows, certified organic tomato sauce, MSG-free pepperoni, additive-free sausage and fresh produce, plus all pizzas are handmade fresh and fire baked. Choose from the wide range of pizzas, as well as salads and sandwiches. Vegan and gluten-free options are also available. Locations at Ward Centre and in Kailua.

Title: Crackin' Kitchen
Content: If you've never heard of Hawaiian-Cajun food, then you need to come here to see what all the fuss is about. Go to town with the Signature Hawaiian-Cajun: order your choice of seafood (combo or by the pound), select a flavor (Red: Crackin Kitchen Cajun with Hawaiian chili; Black: Hawaiian cacao and cracked black pepper; White: Maui onion-based, non-spicy lemon butter), pick your spice level and choose your sides. Portions are huge! You're going to need the gloves and bibs to dig into the food that's poured on the table. Add-ons such as the Guava Soy Chicken Wings, Lobster Dip and Chowder Fries have also received rave reviews on Yelp.

Title: Nashville Waikiki
Content: Bring out the country gal or guy in you with a stop at Nashville Waikiki (they've still kept the same name although they're no longer located in Waikiki). Friendly staff and bartenders keep it fun and casual. There's a spacious dance floor, but if you're not into boot scootin boogie-ing, then you can enjoy a game of pool or darts. Not sure how to line dance? Get there for the free line dancing lessons nightly.

Title: Cholo's Homestyle Mexican
Content: At Cholo’s you’ll experience festive surroundings, fun and fare inspired by colorful Mexico. Located in the North Shore Marketplace, this restaurant is a comfortable hangout for locals and visitors featuring authentic Mexican cuisine at generous portions and affordable prices. The signature dish is the Ahi Fish Tacos; pair it up with the signature drink, “The Ultimate” Patron Margarita, and you’re good to go! Food and drink specials during Happy Hour 4-6 p.m. Mon.-Fri. Don’t miss “Salsa Night” featuring live salsa bands and dancing. By the way, authentic Mexican collectibles on the walls are available for purchase.

Title: Kobe Japanese Steak House
Content: Bring the entire family for a uniquely fun dining experience at Kobe Japanese Steak House. You'll experience the traditional Japanese style of cooking, known as teppanyaki, made fun by a talented, knife-wielding chef who will commandeer your table and ensure all ages enjoy their time there. Who knew watching someone cook food could be so enjoyable? Tender aged beef, seafood and fresh vegetables are cooked to perfection right in front of your eyes, and it's delicious!

Title: Killer Tacos
Content: Craving Mexican fare on the go? Killer Tacos is up for the task. With eateries in Haleiwa and Wahiawa, this convenient taco place is good to go on your way to the North Shore or on your way home from a day in the water. A couple of the popular menu items include the kalua pork taco, fish taco and the Longboard Burrito with kalua pork, refried beans, rice, sour cream and guacamole.

Title: Eggs 'n Things
Content: Fresh ingredients, reasonable prices and treating all customers like family have been the cornerstone of Founders Jerry and Jan Fukunaga since they opened the first Eggs n Things in Waikiki in 1974. More than 40 years later, visitors, locals, and a lot of college students (who know a good deal when they see one) have made Eggs n Things the popular restaurant that it is. It's all about generous portions at reasonable prices. Choose from meat and eggs plates, specialty omelets and pancakes, crepes, waffles, French toast, plus a whole lot more!

Title: Hard Rock Cafe
Content: Hard Rock Cafe is still going strong after opening in the 90s in quick succession around the world. A friendly staff and fun and lively atmosphere make it a great gathering place. The revamped Hard Rock Cafe in Waikiki boasts an open-air island design with an amazing guitar wave spanning two floors. Enjoy American classics on the menu that include starters such as wings and potato skins, smokehouse sandwiches, burgers, sandwiches, salads and delicious desserts. Pick up a memento in the gift shop too. Hear live acoustic and hard rock bands.

Title: North Shore Marketplace
Content:
"Part of the allure of a day or two at the North Shore is wandering the shops and restaurants of historic Haleiwa Town, and the heart of Haleiwa is North Shore Marketplace.

Stop into Aloha General Store for refreshing shave ice before visiting the over twenty shops and restaurants. From quality souvenirs at Aloha Vintage Vibes to some of the island’s best Mexican and fresh fish, this quaint plantation style “village” offers the feel of “old Hawaii.”

Stroll the art galleries, admire local treasures, sip coffee, savor homemade gelato while under the spell of the cultural influences of China, Japan and the Philippines."

Title: Martin & MacArthur
Content: Martin & MacArthur features the highest quality works of Hawaiis wood artists. Every piece stands out for its superior quality, craftsmanship and attention to detail. Works of art include koa wood watches, jewelry, jewelry boxes, koa wood sunglasses, koa and leather handbags, mobile accessories, caps, as well as bowls, platters, cutting boards, wall decor, home office accents, furniture and many more. Whether for the home or a personal accessory, every piece is special and will bring back memories of Hawaii throughout the years. Six locations: four in Waikiki, at Ala Moana Center and Ward Center.

Title: Art on the Zoo Fence
Content: This outdoor art gallery located along the fence of Honolulu Zoo is a delightfully unique find across the street from Kapiolani Park. Admire the works of islands artists as they introduce you to Hawaii through their eyes. You'll find a wide variety of original works in a variety of mediums available. If you're looking for a piece of art for your home or as a gift, this is the place to start your search because prices are very reasonable.

Title: Hawaiian Crown Plantation
Content: Return home from your Hawaii vacation with fresh, local products from Hawaiian Crown Plantation. There's nothing like sweet, juicy pineapples to remind you of the islands, and that's what you'll find at this easy-to-miss store. Fresh pineapples are shipped every Monday through Wednesday. Items ready for purchase include chocolate, coffee, dried fruits and cookies, one of which is the signature Pineapple Oatmeal Cookieamazingly delicious! In store, you can enjoy the popular Acai Bowl, fresh smoothies and other edibles.

Title: Primo Popcorn
Content: Savory, spicy, salty, candied, chocolatewhatever your craving, Primo Popcorn located on Sand Island Road (on the way to the airport) can satisfy it. Chef Rylen Sato has created more than 100 flavors of popcorn, all made with aloha, and together with his parents, they've made gourmet popcorn a family business. Want more savory? Try the Li Hing Pineapple, Thai Crab Curry and Mac Nut Pesto. Bacon Ranch, Cheezy Garlic Bread and Tornado sounds good too. Spicy? Hmmm, try Wasa Ranch, Death by Habanero or Wasabi Soy BBQ. You'll have to sign a waiver for What Too Hot for You. And we can't forget the sweethow about Birthday Cake, Chocolate Haupia Pie or Coco Kona Coffee? Primo Popcorn has got the local flavors down!

Title: Ukulele Puapua
Content: The friendly, efficient and knowledgeable staff of Ukulele Puapua live and breathe the ukulele and know the instrument inside out; some have recordings, some play live and some teach how to play too. Whether you're in search of your childs (or your) first ukulele or wish to take the next step up in your ukulele journey, they'll gladly help. They carry Hawaii-made ukulele such as Kamaka, Kanilea, KoAloha, Koolau and others, plus imported models such as Kala, Risa, Fender and Ami Ami. One size does not fit all, so you'll get help finding the right type, size and shape ukulele and any accessories to suit you. They also carry books, instructional DVDs, CDs, and can recommend ongoing classes to continue learning. You can also join free, in-store group lessons from 4 pm daily, first come, first serve. Ask about private lessons too.

Title: Twin Islands Clothing
Content: The merchandise available at Twin Islands Clothing reflects the well-known Mokulua Islands known as the Twin Islands or the Mokesand the laid-back lifestyle of Kailua, a place where founder and owner Mike Miller grew up with his twin brother, Peter. Shop for apparel in cool styles made with the softest fabricst-shirts, polo shirts, aloha shirts, hoodies, tanks, caps, board shorts and rashguards.

Title: Paradise Soccer Club
Content: Founded by Max Anton, a lifelong soccer player, Paradise Soccer Club brings together people who are passionate about the game; feature premium soccer products, as well as the exclusive PSC brand and Hawaiian lifestyle brands; and carries a commitment to build Hawaiis soccer culture. Friendly staff are happy to assist whenever needed. Shop for jerseys, footwear, gear, accessories and other items.

Title: Aloha Sunday
Content: Aloha Sunday is an online men's clothing store featuring a collection of the contemporary mans finely tailored clothing built upon the belief that simple things can, and should, be made well. Inspired by a coastal lifestyle, the brand operates from California and New York. Shop online or find Aloha Sunday brand products in Koi Boutique.

Title: Goodguys Music & Sound
Content: Looking for a good priced guitar, ‘ukulele, electronics, sound system or musical accessories? Check out Goodguys Music & Sound specialty store offering great prices on new and used instruments. You can also bring in your used instrument for cash or take it in trade. Owner Bryan Aoyagi has 40 years of experience in Hawai‘i’s retail music scene, and they’re ready to share their expertise with anyone who’s looking for advice or have questions. Parking is available in the back next to Starbucks.

Title: Splash! Hawaii
Content: Carrying some of the best selection of swimwear for every body type for more than 35 years, Splash! Hawaii knows how to suit up every female for the beach. They carry mix-and-match bikini tops and bottoms in a wide variety of styles, plus beach accessories. Private label swimwear separates designed and made in Hawaii, as well as top international swimwear and products by sportswear designers are available. Stores in Ala Moana Center, Haleiwa and Kailua.

Title: Hawaiian Island Creations
Content: The Hawaiian Island Creations story began in 1971 with two brothers, Stephan and Jimmy Tsukayama, when they opened Kailua Bike Shop. Today, the HIC brand has international ties with licensees in Europe, Brazil and Japan. Locally, you'll be hard pressed to find someone in their 40's or 50's who doesn't remember going into their store to stock up on their quality tees, slippers, board shorts and surf boards. They've certainly got a loyal older following, but the apparel, beach wear, beach accessories, surfboards and other merchandise appeal to a younger generation as well. Shops also in Aiea, Kailua, Haleiwa, Mililani, Kapolei and at Ala Moana Center.

Title: Surf N Sea
Content: Surf N Sea is Hawai‘i’s oldest surf shop operating on O‘ahu’s North Shore since 1965. This family owned and operated business is a one-stop shop for ocean activities equipment and accessories, plus offers lessons, tours and boat cruises. Surfing, longboarding, SUP, bodyboarding, SCUBA diving, snorkeling equipment are available for sale or rent. Merchandise from top brands such as Hurley, Billabong, Rip Curl, O’Neil and Quiksilver also available. Here you’ll find whatever you need to enjoy the Pacific Ocean. Enjoy excellent customer service and join the Surf N Sea ‘ohana!

Title: Tori Richard
Content: In the upper echelon of the resortwear industry, Tori Richard was founded in 1956 and continues today as a family-run, resort lifestyle company. The fabrics that create such high-quality apparelcotton lawn, silk, custom jacquards and chiffonfeature printed art often applied in as many as 18 distinct colors to capture just the right hue and intricate design. Thus, a Tori Richard is like no other. Visit their shops in Ala Moana Center, Waikiki and Kahala to experience excellent customer service to help you find just what youre looking for. Three stores in Waikiki and at the Kahala Hotel & Resort.

Title: Urban Outfitters
Content: Located in the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Resort & Spa in Waikiki, Urban Outfitters is its first in the state. Popular with visitors and residents, the store carries trendy clothing and casual apparel for men and women. Footwear, jewelry, bags, home dcor items available too. A popular area for the guys tends to be the back where books and vinyl records, among other items, have been placed.

Title: Hawaiian Holy Smokes
Content: Hawaiian Holy Smokes is a smoke shop that sells everything for your smoking satisfaction (except cigarettes). Goodies include a selection of E-Cigs, attachments and accessories; vaporizers, rolling papers, novelty pipes and more. Also find water pipes, hookahs, vapor boxes, portable vaporizers, novelty pipes, pipe cleaners and more. Shops in Honolulu, Kaimuki, Pearl City and Kaneohe. Must be 21 or older to purchase items. They also have free shipping throughout the state. Four locations on Oahu.

Title: North Shore Soap Factory
Content: The North Shore Soap Factory is a working soap factory creating its line of Hawaiian Bath & Body products using all natural ingredients. Gentle on the skin as well as the environment, these handmade soaps and lotions are available individually (30 varieties of soaps!), in gift sets or in collections—Coconut, Lavender, Plumeria or Pikake. You’ll also find kukui nut oils, lip balms, body scrubs and more. The Hawaiian Bath & Body products are also available in stores islandwide.

Title: Menehune Mac Candies
Content: If you love chocolate, then this is the perfect place to visit! Menehune Mac is a longtime family-run business offering milk chocolate, dark chocolate and flavored chocolate treats; sugar-free items; Hawaiian snacks; and cookies and sandbars. They also create gifts and baskets for special occasions, and can assist with special favors for weddings, anniversary parties and other occasions. Make a reservation to stop by their factory on Waiakamilo Road in Kalihi for a guided tour and delicious samples.

Title: Fabric Mart
Content: One of the largest selections of quality fabrics in one place available on the island! Hawaiian fabrics in all kinds of designs and colors make great aloha shirts, dresses, pillows and quilts. Also find batik prints, Oriental prints, Hawaiian poly/cotton, Hawaiian cotton, Hawaiian upholstery fabrics and canvas bags. Now, you may be surprised to learn that Fabric Mart sells more than just bolts of fabric, sewing patterns, needles and thread. They also sell a variety of items that both visitors and locals will appreciate, that are both practical and can make for great souvenirs, too. The best part? Not only are these items reasonably priced, but they will also pack easily! For starters, Fabric Mart has an array of beautiful beach bags that will make you the envy of fellow beachgoers here, or at the local swim club back home. There is a large selection of prints and styles, and they’re only $20 for a medium sized bag, $24 for the large. You’ll be a hero with friends and family by loading up on the cutest, quilted coin purses at $2.99 each. They have so many different designs that you can give a different one to everyone at the office. They’ve also got quilted drawstring pouches, too. Stores in ‘Aiea and Kāne‘ohe too.

Title: Outlets of Maui
Content: Located on Front Street in the historic town of Lahaina, The Outlets of Maui has all the stores you've become to know, which include Adidas Outlet Store, Banana Republic, Brooks Brothers, Calvin Klein, Coach, Crocs, Gap Factory Store, Guess Factory Store, Lucky Brand Outlet, Tommy Hilfiger, Skechers, Perfumania, along with HIC Surf Outlet, Hilo Hattie Outlet, Aloha Swimwear Outlet and Maikai Woods Hawaii. This is also home to the restaurants Hard Rock Caf and Ruths Chris Steak House. Youll also enjoy cultural activities and performances; check online for the schedule. Restaurants vary.

Title: Tamura's Fine Wine & Liquors
Content: With its roots in four generations of the Tamura family, Tamura's Fine Wine & Liquors is a family business that includes Tamura Super Markets and an express store. Tamuras is known for its everyday low prices across the board, and their staff is always friendly and helpful when you need a suggestion. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion, searching for a beverage to serve your dinner guests, or even if it's just a little something to help you wind down, you'll find something here. Stop by for a look at their seasonal and limited beers, featured wine and spirits and more. Two other locations in Aiea and Kailua.

Title: Cycle City Hawaii
Content: Cruise the island roads in style with a bike rental from Cycle City Hawaii located at the Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa. The guys here are riders themselves and know how to match rider to bike, and can suggest the best routes, sights and places to eat! Shop for merchandise for men and women toot-shirts, tanks, tops, shorts, jackets, hoodies, footwear, caps, head wraps, visors, plus novelty items. You'll be geared up and ready to roll. Two other stores at the Royal Hawaiian Center and Hilton Hawaiian Village.

Title: Island Sole
Content: Spreading aloha with every step is the mission of Island Sole whose mascot is Hawaiis state bird, the nene (Hawaiian goose). Sharing aloha with every customer, this born-in-Hawaii shop has a friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff, and offers quality, casual footwear for every age. In addition to the exclusive line of Island Sole slippers, the shop also carries brands such as OluKai, Sanuk, Birkenstock and more. Five other shops in Waikiki, Kapolei and at Ala Moana Center and Kahala Mall.

Title: Island Slipper
Content: In business for more than 60 years, Island Slipper is the oldest manufacturer of made-in-Hawaii footwear. Remaining true to the island lifestyle and people, Island Slipper produces more than 80 styles for men and women, focusing on comfort and durability in everything from flip flops to fashion. Shop for quality footwear at reasonable prices with the assistance of a friendly and helpful staff. Shop at Royal Hawaiian Center, Ala Moana Center and Ward Warehouse.

Title: Flip Flop Shops
Content: Free your toes from confinement with Flip Flop Shops that lets you live, work and play with your toes exposed. Your first stop after getting off the plane should be this store where youll find the most popular brands and latest styles of flip flops and casual footwear. Brands include Sanuk, OluKai, Quiksilver, Roxy, Reef, Cobian, Havaianas, Crocs, Birkenstock, Teva, Volcom and a whole lot more. And for those who prefer stylish flip flops, youre remembered with brands such as Steve Madden, Rebels, Malibu, Volatile, Yellowbox, J/Slides and others. Stores located at the Moana Surfrider Hotel and Ala Moana Center. Open daily.

Title: Clark Little Gallery
Content: Clark Little's journey all started with his wife's request and a wave. And now there is Clark Little Gallery at the Haleiwa Store Lots. In between, images capturing the unique and often dangerous perspective of waves shot from the inside out, known as Clark's view, has taken award-winning photographer Clark Little from Hawaii to national and international fame. His award-winning image Mohawk is even on display in Smithsonian's National Museum of Natural History in Washington D.C. in the exhibition Nature's Best Photography: Best of the Best through August 2016. A visit to the gallery will find you wanting to take home gifts in the form of books, calendars, prints, iPhone 6 cases, mugs, cards, hats, mens and women apparel, bags and more, all featuring the photographer's images.

Title: Wyland Galleries
Content: Wyland was one of the first artists of his kind to exclusively focus on marine life. His depictions of underwater marine creatures in vivid colors existing harmoniously brought a sense of wonder to those who saw his works of art. See dolphins, fish, rays, whales and more captured by his brush in his Haleiwa, Ko Olina and Waikiki art galleries. And, of course, who can forget his majestic whaling walls created around the world? Wylands newest works are lucite sculptures that bring to life his travels to the top of the world. Visit his galleries to see his other workslimited edition, oil, watercolor, abstracts, Sumi-E, Chinese brush and sculptures.

Title: Popeyes
Content: Named after the character Popeye Doyle in The French Connection (not the Popeye of cartoon fame), this quick-service chicken chain started in 1972 in Louisiana. Just what makes Popeyes chicken more popular than its competitors? Some would say it's the spicy fried chicken, others claim it's the flaky biscuits, still others love the Cajun fries. Everyone may have a different opinion, but all agree that they love Popeyes! Five locations on Oahu.

Title: Doraku Sushi
Content:
“Doraku” in Doraku Sushi means “the road to happiness,” which is just how you’ll feel after you’ve experienced a meal. Savor traditional Japanese sushi and inventive fusion dishes made with quality ingredients artistically presented at your table and delectable to your palate. Japanese tradition calls for simplicity and that’s what you’ll find with the variety of sushi where fresh ingredients shine. The rest of the menu offers flavorful and textural delights such as Charred Shishito Peppers, Panko Corvina and Balsamic Teriyaki Spare Ribs. Desserts, as well as sake and cocktails are available too.

2nd location:
1009 Kapi‘olani Blvd, Honolulu • (808) 591-0101
11AM-4PM Mon-Sun, 4-11PM Sun-Thurs, 4PM-1AM Fri-Sat
Happy Hour 4-6PM Daily, Late Night Happy Hour 9PM-Close Daily

Title: Tropical Creations
Content: Creating unique island jewelry for 39 years, Tropical Creations located in Dole Cannery offers pieces that reflect life in the islands such as tropical flowers and marine life, as well as Hawaiian charms, Tahitian pearl jewelry and coral jewelry. The most popular items include an arrangement of tropical flower jewelry, traditional Hawaiian heirloom jewelry, and Tahitian pearl jewelry. Factory tours are available upon request to view the jewelry-making process. Purchase items directly from Tropical Creations and you'll pay factory prices 50-70 percent off retail prices.

Title: The Fish Hopper
Content: Fronting the ocean and overlooking Kailua Piers boat traffic, this Kona seafood/steak restaurant is known for clam chowder and island fish prepared a variety of ways. Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Cocktails.

Title: Da Poke Shack
Content: This tiny, tucked away eatery fronting Kona Bali Kai condos has unique variety of poke options to please everyone's taste. Other seafood choices include shrimp, scallop and octopus to name a few. The Hot Hawaiian Plates with Kalua Pork and Lau Lau will leave you satisfied.

Title: Umeke's Fishmarket Bar & Grill
Content: Enjoy award-winning poke chopped raw fish prepared a variety of ways plus hearty bowls featuring grilled chicken and beef piled high with two scoops rice. Local-style sides like tako (octopus), garlic edamame and crab salad.

Title: Frenchman's Cafe
Content: Tucked away in one of the shopping centers in Kona Marketplace, this cafe offers breakfast and lunch serving french fare like croque madam, cordon blue galette, crepes, omlettes. Limited seating.

Title: Broke Da Mouth Grindz
Content: Out of the way in Kailua-Kona's light industrial area, the family restaurant serves breakfast, lunch and dinner offering soups, omelets, burgers and local-style favorities like loco mocos, oxtail stew, pork adobo and lau lau.

Title: Jackie Reys Ohana Grill
Content: Serving salads, sandwiches, Guava BBQ-Glazed Baby Back Ribs and hearty Weekday Blue Plate Specials for lunch, plus pupus, fresh catch, rack of lamb, steak, chicken, pork chops for dinner, this full-service restaurant has a selection of wines, beers and cocktails.
Image Alt Text: Jackie Reys Ohana Grill - Big Island, Hawaii

Title: 808 Grindz Cafe
Content: Local-style fare is on tap here for breakfast and lunch with eight selections for loco moco alone, plus pancakes, waffles, omelets, Hawaiian-style grilled steak, crab hash, kalua pork patties, fried rice and sweetbread french toast.

Title: Island Ono Loa Grill
Content:
With seven different cheeseburgers, four different loco mocos, fresh—never frozen—fish, Island Ono Loa Grill knows how to please the palate. The signature dish would be their cheeseburgers, but the top three favorites are the local fish sandwiches, the Macadamia Nut Pesto Goat Cheese Burger made with locally sourced goat cheese, and the Volcano Burger made with pepper-infused cream cheese.

Ingredients are locally sourced whenever possible, so look for buns from Punalu‘u Bake Shop, goat cheese from Hawaii Island Goat Dairy, fish from island waters, lettuce from Waimea, grass-fed beef from Kā‘u, and tomatoes from O‘ahu. Enjoy truly local menu items at reasonable prices.

Title: On the Rocks
Content: You can dig your toes in the sand overlooking the ocean while enjoying lunch, pupus, standout sunset cocktails and dinner. Food is casual but taken up a notch with offerings like Asian Shrimp Lettuce Cups and Furikake-Crusted Fresh Catch. There's also burgers and sliders, nachos, salads, soups. Located next to Huggo's.

Title: Lemongrass Bistro
Content: This Asian eatery offers Asian-style appetizers, soups and noodles, entrees, curries, desserts and beverages.

Title: Island Naturals Market & Deli
Content: Find healthy eating options at this grocery and deli offering gluten- and sugar-free choices, nutriceuticals, natural body care and deli serving sandwiches, bentos and smoothies.

Title: Splashers Grill
Content: Serving breakfast, lunch and dinner overlooking Kailua Pier, this open-air eatery has full bar service and happy hour. Full American menu with ltropical-themed favorites, plus offerings for kids. Holiday buffets.

Title: Hawaii Outdoor Guides
Content: Offering customized, guided tours for small groups to volcanoes, reef ecosystems, lava flows, waterfalls and camping locales. Get the inside scoop on top natural attractions.

Title: Studio 55 Hawaii
Content: Browse for distinctive women's fashion and accessories perfect for the tropical lifestyle.

Title: Kohala Divers
Content: Dive charters, whale watching, instruction, rental/retail at this 5 Star, PADI, full-service dive center. Specializing in small group dives and flexible profiles.

Title: Hawaii Coffee Company
Content: Offering LION and Royal Kona Coffee brands, flavored coffees, Hawaii-grown coffees, plus Hawaiian Islands Tea.

Title: Tiki Shark Art Hawaii
Content: Focusing on "the beach" and "pineapple" Brad Parker offers his art of skateboards, beach towels, coffee mugs and more, plus giclees on canvas.

Title: Greenwell Farms
Content: In business since 1850, the Kona coffee farm offers free tours of its orchard and processing facility, plus coffee sampling and gift shop at a cool elevation

Title: Sam Choy's Kai Lanai
Content: At Sam Choy’s Kai Lanai, the stunning ocean and sunset views will leave you speechless while the innovative Hawaiian Heritage Cuisine and warmth of Hawaiian hospitality will make you a return guest. The love of good food and aloha for his guests have made Sam Choy an award-winning and popular chef, and it’s here that you’ll enjoy his popular dishes such as the Seafood Lau Lau, Macadamia Nut Crusted Chicken (also the signature dish) and Island Ahi Poké Plate, all made with fresh, local ingredients. But there’s a lot more savory fare on the menu! As for the signature dessert? It’s the award-winning Kai Lani Chocolate Cake! Whether you’re waiting for a table, meeting friends for drinks or waiting to watch the sunset by the fire pit, The Short Bait bar is your first stop. Enjoy pupus (appetizers) and a premium cocktail or island heritage cocktail during Happy Hour 3-5 p.m. daily.

Title: Quill & Feather
Content: Celebrating the "Fierce and Femine" in you, the boutique carries handmade jewelry, clothing and goods to adorn the home.

Content: It's fungal in the jungle at the Hamakua Heritage Farm where mushrooms are grown in exact conditions. Interesting tours and tasting on the scenic Hamakua Coast.

Title: Biggah Mo Bettah
Content: Located at Too Much Fun Hawaii, the Biggah Mo Bettah garment is designed for the guy who knows his way around a buffet table. Sizes up to 6XL and "Sumo Approved."

Title: Island Roots
Content: Serving shrimp prepared with sweet chili/liliko, cilanto/lime and Spicy Volcano. Try the fish salad and Hawbano Sandwich served with kim chee or seafood slaw and rice

Title: ChoiceMART
Content: Located at the Kealakekua Shopping Center, ChoiceMart stocks locally sourced produce and meats, dairy products, freshly caught seafood, basic grocery staples, wine and spirits, freshly baked goods, deli meats, on-site sushi, health foods, Kona coffe and local value-added products.

Title: Bleu Cupcakery
Content: Flavors change daily and there's also classic selections at this Kona cupcakery. Enjoy cafe seating, coffee, Italian sodas.

Title: Taco del Mar
Content: Located in Kona Commons, this quick-serve Mexican eatery offers Baja-style burritos and fish tacos, plus all the south-of-the-border favorites.

Title: Sandal Tree
Content: Featuring resort footwear for the entire family and accessories like handbags, hats and jewelry. Find men's and women's sandals and shoes, plus footwear for kids and slections suitable for wedding celebrations. Name brand and Sandal Tree exclusives. Available on the Big Island at Walking in Paradise store.

Title: Jet Vacation Destinations
Content: Jet Vacation in Kona plans the right travel experience for familes, school groups, reunions, corporate business travel, business trips, honeymoon and inter-island jaunts. Arranging travel by air, land and sea and helping Hawaii visitors with activity itineraries and need-to-know information.

Title: Hawaiian Ukulele & Guitar
Content: Large brand selection of instruments, plus cases, stands, tuners and humdifiers. Authorized distributor for Kamoa Ukuleles, Cordoba, Jose Ramirez, Guild ,Imua Ukulele, Sigma Guitar sand more. Located at the The Kings' Shops.

Content: Choose from a full lineup of craft beers like Paniolo Pale Air and Starshine Ginger Bier. Haus menu favorites include the Green Chili Burger, daily fresh fish catch and vegan delights.

Title: Mrs. Barry's Kona Cookies
Content: Crispy chocolate-dipped macadamia nut shortbread, coconut shortbread, chocolate chip mac nut and oatmeal raisin are some of the delicious cookie options at this long-time Kona establishment. Buy them by the bag or in gift box assortments. Also for sale is macadamia nut brittle and Kona coffee. Cookies made fresh daily. Purchase on site daily, shipping available.

Title: Kona Brewing Company
Content:
Stop in for a bite and a beer, and you’ll be welcomed like family by the friendly staff at Kona Brewing Co. It’s the perfect place for a mid-day meal or to sit back and relax at the end of the day with views of Hawaii Kai Marina and the Ko‘olau mountain range. Known for their pizzas, Kona Brewing Co. mixes the grain used to brew their beer into the pizza dough to create a whole grain flavor to the crust. You’ll also find a good selection of food and beverages on the menu, but popular items include Pele’s Thrown Ahi Salad, the Hawaiian Lu‘au Pizza and Macadamia Nut Crusted Fish. Not sure what beer you’ll like? Leave it to the experts to find one that’ll bring on a smile. Try the Lemongrass Ginger Ale or Wailua Wheat Ale that uses fresh lilikoi. On the darker side, the Kona coffee Pipeline Porter or Black Sand Porter will surely hit the spot.

As Hawai‘i’s longest-running craft brewery, Kona Brewing Co. celebrates its 25th anniversary by launching the Hibiscus Brut IPA. It features a combination dry characteristic with hibiscus to deliver a refreshing brew with hints of gooseberry and melon. For now, get it at the pub until its nationwide release in September.

Title: Plenty Pupule Kayaks and Watersports
Content: Source for kayaks, kayak fishing gear, sailing gear, paddleboards, surf/snorkel/dive gear, camping gear and activewear. Plenty Pupule helps you determine what you need for your adventures on Hawaii Island.

Title: Kealakekua Ranch Center
Content: Anchored by Choice Mart Supermarket and Ace Hardware, the two-level center offers restaurants, day spa, health care, pharmac, hair salon and Fly HI Ziplines.

Title: Royal Hawaiian Heritage Jewelry
Content: Hawaiian heirloom jewelry has been an island tradition since the days of the monarchy. Known for elaborate scrolls depicting island themes, the jewelry is typically passed down from mother to child. A local company since 1972 with two location on Oahu, RHHJ offers heirloom barrel bracelets, rings, pendants and earrings, plus watches and other jewelry.

Title: Kona Coffee and Tea Company
Content: Enjoy and buy coffee using beans grown and handpicked at the company's farm. Pastries, snacks, locally made value added products like honey, jams, salad dressings and salts.

Content: Kayak and snorkel a marine sanctuary with guide, gear and snacks included. Learn how to stand up paddleboard at a private lesson. Also available are kayak/SUP beach rentals. Serving the Kohala Coast and Waimea.

Title: Kona Joe Coffee
Content: Kona Joe grows award-winning coffee using a trellis system similar to vineyards. Free self-guided tour with video offered daily. Also available is a guided tour for a fee with souvenir mug and coffee.

Title: Hilo Sharks Coffee
Content: Experience the unique regional tastes of the Hawaiian Islands with coffee from Kona, Kau, Hilo and Maui, freshly roasted in small batches. Also available are walking tours of a coffee and cacao is the bean used to make chocolate.

Content: Down the hatch with cold-pressed and custom juices, super food smoothies, vital health shots, coconut wate, lemonades and cold-brewed coffee. Also serving salads, sandwiches and acai bowls.

Title: Chill'n on the Bay
Content: Start with a chill, open air bar on the water, add great food, great prices and great staff, and you’ll understand why Chill’n on the Bay has “the best vibe in Hawai‘i.” Try their signature Lava Flow or Mick’s Mai Tai, or taste the Chill’n Fish & Chips, and learn for yourself why people can’t get enough of this place.

Title: Kona Family Fishing
Content: Catering to fishermen and familes of all angling abilities, Kona Family Fishing hunts for trophy fish, smaller game and combines snorkel and fishing for an unforgettable family adventure. Photo/video package available.
Image Alt Text: Kona Family Fishing - Big Island - Hawaii

Title: Bike Volcano
Content: Witness Kilauea Volcano's historic summit crater eruption and explore dynamic Hawaii Volcanoes National Park by bicycle. Choose from half- and full-day tours to experience the beauty and scientific wonder of incredible HVNP. Guided tours include all gear, lunch and beverages and are on easy riding, paved roads and trails. Great way to explore while getting exercise!

Title: UFO Parasail
Content: Take to the skies as a parasailor for an adventure you'll never forget! Takeoffs and landings are completely dry and you can sail alone, tandem or even three at a time. Once aloft, the silence is wonderful and the view inpsiring. Operating in Kona from the lobby of Courtyard Marritott's King Kamehameha Kona Beach Hotel. Trips depart adjacent Kailua Pier.

Title: Big Island Candies
Content: Big Island Candies captures the diverse flavors of Hawaii in its many products that are perfect for gift-giving: Chocolate Macadamia Nut Crunchies, Pineapple Manju, Orange Cream Chocolate Brownies, Guava Mac Nut Cookies, Bien Vivente Cookies with Hawaiian Ginger, Sesame and Almond, Mac Nut Biscotti with Dark Chocolate Waves, Li Hing Mui Cookies....and so much more! Visit the retail showroom for samples and sales, shipping available.

Title: Urgent Care of Kona
Content: Visitors to Hawaii can depend on Urgent Care to treat the cold, flu, sunburn, sprains, urinary tract infections, sinus issues, rashes, earache, lacerations and sea urchin encounters in a professional setting.

Title: Honolua Surf Company
Content: Located in Kona Inn Shopping Village in Historic Kailua Village, Honolua stocks surfboards, rashguards and all you need to surf, plus apparel for men and women. Shop for tees and tanks, hoosies, UV shirts, boardshorts, hats and aloha shirts for men while gals can browse for the same, plus dresses, sweaters and skirts. With 13 stores statewide, as second Big Isle location is at the Waikoloa Kings' Shops.
Image Alt Text: Honolua Surf Company - Big Island - Hawaii

Title: Kadota Liquor
Content: Head to Kadota's for a wide variety of domestic and imported beers, craft brews, microbrews, Asian spirits and more. The store offers 50 varieties of sake and monthly, in-store specials.

Title: Blue Dragon Restaurant & Spa
Content: Located across from Kawaihae Harbor, this restaurant features the freshest fish prepared a variety of innovative ways. Without a roof, the Blue Dragon offers dinner and dancing under the stars, fringed by palm trees. Also on tap is massage at the mini spa.

Title: Puako General Store
Content: Serving as the hub for the Kohala Coast hamlet of Puako, the Puako General Store offers grocery staples and delivery, wine,cold beverages, souvenirs and freshly made pizzas, sandwiches, salads and meals to go by Puako Provisions Catering.

Title: Roy's Waikoloa Bar & Grill
Content: Internationally influenced and Hawaii inspired, cuisine by Chef Roy Yamaguchi is not to be missed. Chef utilizes ingredients from local farmers and ranchers and prepares them using traditional island flavors. Menu items include Hawaiian Style Misoyaki Butterfish, Blackened Island Ahi and Big Island Goat Cheese Hollandaise Filet Mignon.

Title: Hawaii Ocean Sports
Content: With a fleet of three sailing and power catamarans, Ocean Sports offers snorkel adventures plus sunset, whale watch, glassbotoom boat and scuba cruises. Play at Anaehoomalu Bay with stand-up paddleboards, kayaks, hydrobikes, boogie boards and snorkel gear. Six Kohala Coast locations.
Categories: Activities & Fun>Dolphin Watching Tours|Activities & Fun>Scuba Diving|Tours

Title: Discovery Hawaii Tours
Content: Book your Big Island tour to visit Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, seek the summit of Mauna Kea or get up close and personal on a manta ray night dive. Takes a snorkel/dolphin adventure and more. Discover Hawaii Tours offers fun on the Big Isle, Maui, Kauai and Oahu.

Title: King Kayak Hawaii
Content: Go dolphin watching, cliff jumping and visit sea caves, underwater arches and a turtle cleaning station. King Kayak Hawaii offers diverse kayak and snorkling activities on the Kona-Kohala Coast. Certfied guides.
Image Alt Text: King Kayak Hawaii - Big Island - Hawaii

Title: Ocean Safari Kayak Adventures
Content: Focusing on small groups, Kona Kayak offers a lineup of tours offering dolphin and whale watching, snorkeling, sea cave exploration and cliff jumping. Tours are led by Hawaii Lifeguard Certified professionals.

Title: Kona Surf Adventures
Content: Hang 10 in no time after taking a surf lesson with Kona Mike and his team of experienced surfers. Lesson includes surfing gear plus water and snacks, safety briefing and about two hours in the water. Surf spots are chosen according to ocean conditions.
Image Alt Text: Kona Surf Adventures - Big Island - Hawaii

Title: One Love One Spirit
Content: Head aboard the 39-foot Cabo yacht for a half-day swim with dolphins or take a longer cruise and combine your dolphin fun with a snorkel at Kealakekua Bay Marine Preserve, a top island snorkel site. Shared and private charters.

Title: Bongo Ben's Island Cafe
Content: Overlooking the Kona Coast in Kailua Village, Bong Ben's serves a hearty breakfast until 2pm offering fresh baked breads and biscuits and 100% Kona coffee, lunch, dinner and cocktails. Full menu with a wide variety of salads and dinner deals for two. Local beers on draft.

Title: Umauma Falls Zipline
Content: Visit the scenic falls for a self-guided garden trek, ride the giant swing, do the zipline, the river swim and kayak and the Zip & Dip or do them all. Located on the scenic Hamakua Coast, drive-ups are welcome!

Title: Hulakai Surf & Paddle
Content: Located at the Shops at Mauna Lani and in downtown Hilo, Hulakai shapes surfboards and stand-up paddleboards and sells paddles and stylish tees, boardshorts, rashguards and hats for both men and women. Also available are lessons and rentals.
Image Alt Text: Hulakai Surf & Paddle - Big Island - Hawaii

Title: Hawaiian Vanilla Company
Content: Find out about the nation's first commercially grown vanilla which comes from orchids! Take a tour, enjoy lunch or afternoon tea and visit the vanilla shop, which offers vanilla bean extract, cookies, body care products and more.

Title: Siren Sportfishing
Content: Departing from Kawaihae Harbor, Siren's 34-foot Black Watch fly bridge sport fisher heads to the trolling grounds along the island's northern end. Siren specializes in dorado, wahoo and yellow fin tuna and also catches spearfish, sailfish and marlin. Offering fishing for the experienced and novice anglerkids are welcome!

Title: Home Tours Hawaii
Content: Want to know what it's like to live in Hawaii? Home Tours Hawaii offers five-hour excursions to visit private homes and gardens. Enjoy a four-course progressive brunch along the way prepared by the culinary Home Tours team. The activity was named the Cruise Shore Excursion of the Season by the Hilo Princess.

Title: Friends of Hawaii Volcanoes National Park
Content: Friends of Hawaii Volcanoes National Park (FHVNP) is a non-profit organization with members worldwide who support the National Park Service in the protection, preservation, and interpretation of the natural and cultural resources at HVNP for the enjoyment of current and future generations. Membership offers discounts on activities.

Title: Kona Blue Sky Coffee
Content: Kona Blue Sky Coffee Company offers guided tours and sampling headquartered from the visitor center along the Kona Coffee Belt. The 15-min. tours include a short video. Learn how coffee is grown, processed and roasted; no need for reservations.

Title: Heavenly Hawaiian Farms Coffee
Content: Taste Heavenly Hawaiian's award-winning coffee, available at the farm or online. Tours available.

Title: Kahaluu Bay Surf and Sea
Content: For top-of-the-line surfboards, stand-up paddleboards, bodyboards, kayaks and snorkeling gear Kahuluu Bay Surf and Sea offers rentals, surf and SUP lessons, plus tips to where to go and why.
Image Alt Text: Kahaluu Bay Surf and Sea - Big Island, Hawaii

Title: Fishing Miss Mojo
Content: Calling all anglers, of all abilities, on deck Miss Mojo, one of Hawaii's tournament-winning boats. Take a full day, 3/4 day, half-day and shared charter aboard the 41-foot G & S with Capt. Bill Benbow.

Title: Alii Ocean Tours
Content: Dolphin and whale watching tours, plus snorkeling, are offered aboard the 38-foot Hoku Elima, which departs Honokohau Marina. Visit spinner dolphins in their natural habitat, snorkel amid colorful marine life and then finish off the fun with a delicious lunch.

Title: Holualoa Village
Content: Offering art, coffee and history, charming Holualoa Village sits above Kailua-Kona at a cool 1,500-foot elevation. Park your car and stroll the many shops and galleries. Drive along Mamalahoa Hwy. 180 for stops at Kimura's Lauhala Shop, coffee farms, The Donkey Mill Art Center and the Keauhou Store. Enjoyed panoramic views all along the way.

Title: Akatsuka Orchid Garden
Content: Take a behind-the-scenes orchid tour or browse through the 13,000-square-foot "garden oasis" showroom to enter the colorful, exotic world of orchids. Life-long orchid grower Moriyasu Akatsuka has been hypridizing and cloning cattleyas for decades. Also on site is a gift shop and the company offers shipping.

Title: Big Island Water Sports
Content: Take a personalized, custom tour to snorkel, Snuba, scuba, whale/dolphin watcheven Snuba Doo for kids age 4-7. First-time scuba divers welcome and Big Island Water Sports offers open water certification.

Title: Nui Pohaku Adventure Tours
Content: Ride a mountain bike around an active volcano, stroll a black sand beach, zipline through the rainforest and see the amazing glow of volcanic eruption after dark... Nui Pohaku strives to make every memory exceptional!

Title: Honu Sports
Content: Located in Kona Shopping Village in Historic Kailua Village, Honu offers daily scuba diving and snorkeling adventures, plus PADI-certified activities for divers to get certificiation and advanced specialization. Second location at: 74 Kealakehe Pkwy.

Title: Torpedo Tours
Content: Take a personalized boat excursion on the Kona Coast aboard a 38-foot custom charter vessel for your choice of diving, snorkeling, manta ray night dives, dolphin/whale watching and sportfishing. Boat has a hot shower, ample shade and dry storage.

Title: Miller's Surf & Sport
Content: It's all about the gear at Miller's Surf and Sport. Buy bodyboards and accessories, plus skate and roller derby needs. Surf boards for rent by the hour, day or week, plus roof racks. Bodyboard and fins rental, plus snorkel gear. Selection of watches, sunglasses and sandals.

Title: Waipio Valley Shuttle
Content: Visit the verdant valley of kings on Hawaii Island and travel back in time to Old Hawaii. Choose from a narrated van tour, horseback ride, ATV adventure or guided hike atop the valley's rim.

Title: Wailea Horseback Adventure
Content: Get away from it all on your choice of a Waipio Valley Rim Ride or long Hidden Water Fall in isolated and breathtaking Waipio Valley. Picnic and swim in hidden paradise!

Title: Captain Dan McSweeney's Whale Watch
Content: Ahoy matey with Capt. Dan McSweeney, long-time Kona whale researcher, conservationist and whale watch captain. Capt. Dan's four decades of experience gets passengers where best to see whales and he has been chronicling the 45-ton, gentle giants for the Wild Whale Research Foundation.

Title: Original Hawaiian Chocolate Factory
Content: Does chocolate grow on trees? Not exactly! Find out what does at the home of Hawaii's first homegrown, artisan chocolate. Tours available.

Title: Friends of the Natural Energy Lab Tours
Content: Discover how many aquaculture operations are utilizing deep, cold, nutrient-rich water and warm, surface water to farm our food at the Hawaii Ocean Science and Technology Park (HOST) and taste samples. See the world's largest operational Ocean Thermal Energy Conversion (OTEC) power plant and find out how it works. Learn about what HOST facilities are working to protect and restore our unique ocean inhabitants and why its important.
Image Alt Text: Friends of the Natural Energy Lab Tours - Big Island - Hawaii

Title: Kilauea Lodge
Content: Serving breakfast, lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch under the watchful eye of owner-chef Albert Jeyte, Kilauea Lodge serves European favorites and fresh fish from the island. Anchored by the Fireplace of Friendship decorated with stones and coins from around the world, the lodge offers accommodations in guest rooms and private cottages.

Title: Volcano's Lava Rock Cafe
Content: Grab a quick bite after visiting Hawaii Volcano's National Park at this busy eatery. Serving breakfast, sandwiches, salads, burgers and local favorites like loco moco, kalua pork and chicken katsu.

Title: Thai Thai Bistro & Bar
Content: Nicely decorated, this restaurant transports you to Thailand even though you're a mile from Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. Authentic Thai cuisine tastefully prepared starting at noon through dinner.

Title: Cafe Pesto Hilo
Content: Serving "creative island cuisine" for lunch and dinner, Caf Pesto's menu offerings are inspired by Hawaii's diverse ethnic mix. Beside pizzas and calzones, choose from mango-glazed chicken, seafood risotto, wok-fired shrimp and scallops and local beef cooked to order. Sister location at Kawaihae Harbor.

Title: Hilo Bay Cafe
Content: Offering menus for lunch, afternoon, dinner, dessert and keiki, Hilo Bay serves signature appetizers like spicy tuna wonton chips, tasty salads and entrees like Hamakua Mushroom Curry Pot Pie, local pork and beef, and house-made spaetzle pasta. Vegetarian offerings.

Title: Cafe 100
Content: Local-style island food is served at this walk-up eatery credited with inventing the loco moco: 2 scoops rice, hamburger patty and brown gravy topped with a fried egg. Cafe 100 serves 30 variations of the local moco plus local favorites like beef curry stew, chicken katsu, pupu platters, shoyu roast, oxtail soup and kalua pig. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Title: Kuhio Grille
Content: Known as the "Home of the 1 Lb. Laulau," Kuhio Grille serves Hawaiian plates, the origina "fried rice loco," grass-fed beef burgers, local-style plate lunches and entree like grilled fish, pork cutlet and yakitori chicken. Serving breakfast, lunch and dinner at Prince Kuhio Plaza.

Title: Village Burger
Content: Open for lunch and dinner at Parker Ranch Center, Village Burger has won national acclaim for its juicy, pasture-raised burgers and toppings. Village Burger takes pride in sourcing its ingredients within a few miles of the eatery. Fries can be dipped in your choie of wasabi mayo, sundried tomato/caper mayo or creamy sweet chili.

Title: Merriman's
Content: Serving lunch weekdays, brunch weekends and dinner nightly, Merriman's serves food focusing on local ingredients that is prepared to highlight Hawaii's ethnic flavors. Dinner classic include the Original Wok Charred Ahi, Kahua Ranch lamb, Sauteed Day Boat Ono, Mac-Nut Crusted Mahimahi and the Molten Chocolate Purse. Don't forget the Carmelized Coconut Creme Brulee.

Title: Monstera Sushi
Content: Located at The Shops at Mauna Lani, this Asian-style restaurant is open for dinner and has a hip, Japanese pub atmosphere. Large menu of starters, small plates, sushi, rolls and salads that are fun to share among a group of friends. Also serving sizzle plates (entre with sides). Shochu cocktails, sake.

Title: Prince Kuhio Plaza
Content: Indoor shopping mall with a selection of stores, restuarants and services like banking and beauty. Anchored by Sears and Macy's, the mall also has a megaplex cinema complex.

Title: Punaluʻu Beach Park
Content:
This palm-fringed beach near Naʻālehu, Big Island is commonly known by its nickname, "Black Sand Beach." As the nickname implies, Punaluʻu Beach Park boasts iconic black sand, which is made from jet-black fragments of lava rock. This sand gives the beach a unique, mystical appearance, and is a popular attraction for locals and visitors alike.

In addition to its distinctive black sand, Punaluʻu Beach is also a popular spot to watch green sea turtles lingering near the shore. Turtles are regular residents here, and beachgoers love snapping photos of these majestic creatures on land and at sea!

A word of warning: Punaluʻu Beach Park isn’t an ideal spot for swimming. Because of its frequently strong currents, beachgoers should be cautious when entering the water, especially at high tide or when surf is especially high.

For those looking to sit back, relax and enjoy the sights, Punaluʻu Beach is perfect for picnicking and tidepool exploring. Remember to bring your camera, because you don’t want to miss out on its many picturesque sights!
