Title: Monkeypod Jam
Content:
Former schoolteacher turned entrepreneur, Aletha Thomas, built Monkeypod Jam as a result of being placed on furlough. Ensuring that none of Kaua‘i’s fruits go to waste while preserving childhood memories, Thomas focuses on handcrafted artisanal jellies and spreads made in wide copper jam pots.

   Working together with more than 25 island farmers to create 55 seasonal preserves, Monkeypod Jam offers Kaua‘i-grown and made tropical fruit preserves including curds, butters, jam, jellies, chutneys, syrups, pickles and relishes. Visitors will also find exclusive items such as coconut curd, piccalilli, pickled beets, dilly beans and shrubs, as well as breakfast and lunch items and picnics to go.

Title: Japanese Grandma’s Cafe
Content: Located within the retail store Blü Umi, Japanese Grandma’s Cafe features a menu of authentic Japanese cuisine by Master Sushi Chef Shinji Ueki, who understands that the basis of exceptional sushi lies in the preparation of rice. Featured menu items include traditional a variety of nigiri; Eel Futomaki, a complete meal of rice, salad, eel and savory sauce; and a new creation, the Hanapepe Roll. Additional items are available. Ingredients include local organic produce, fresh fish and organic eggs. Take-out and catering are also available.

Title: Klub at Kiahuna
Content: Located at Kiahuna Golf Club, Klub at Kiahuna invites everyone into its home with aloha and a menu of delicious comfort food. The signature dish is the Big Ronald, a 1/3-pound Makaweli Beef Burger topped with onion rings, mushrooms, jalapeno, lettuce, tomato, onion, avocado and BBQ and teriyaki sauce. Homemade coconut cream pie is the signature dessert made with toasted coconut and topped with whipped cream. Popular menu items include the Crab Benedict, BBQ Bacon Burger, Fish & Chips, Banana Pancake and specialty burgers incorporating local Makaweli beef. Also enjoy great Happy Hour prices, 3-6 p.m. daily, plus live, local music. Come hungry and leave with a full belly!

Title: Blü Umi
Content: With its dreamy name, Blü Umi, owner Keiko Napier has successfully created a bright, modern retail space within the former USO Building located in historic Hanapepe town. Shop among a carefully curated range of clothing, jewelry and vacation necessities that include an exclusive line of apparel and jewelry made of vintage kimono fabric designed by Napier and made on the island. Also find contemporary jewelry made with Niihau and sunrise shells, as well as vintage-inspired beads. After shopping, enjoy authentic Japanese fare at Japanese Grandma’s Cafe located inside the shop.

Title: Latitudes Fine Art Gallery
Content:
Step inside Latitudes Fine Art Gallery in Poipu, and you’ll discover beautiful images of the Earth’s natural beauty as captured by professional photographers Steve Munch and Stephanie Hogue. It’s through their works of art that the two hope to “take your breath away!” An unparalleled artistic vision combines with compelling and exotic prints on wood, metal, acrylic and canvas to inspire guests looking to take home something special. Also see exclusive, one-of-a-kind handcarved wood prints of island images in the gallery.

Located in The Shops at Kaukui'ula.

Title: Clark’s Hawaii Tours
Content: Clark’s Hawaii Tours offers visitors two ways to explore the Garden Isle. The four-hour Kauai History Tour begins at 9 a.m. and stops at five locations: ‘Ōpaeka‘a Falls, Hanapēpē River Valley Lookout, the famous Tree Tunnel, Kauai Coffee Co., Spouting Horn and Old Koloa Town. On ship days only, catch the hop-on, hop-off shuttle that operates 8 a.m.-4 p.m. out of Nāwiliwili Harbor.

Title: Chick & Meck
Content: Specializing in fried chicken and draft beer combinations, Chick and Meck offer up a variety of fried chicken—featuring local recipes and regional Asian favorites—and local and craft beer on tap. If you can’t decide what to try, the friendly staff recommends the Combination Chicken, a combination of Original Fried Chicken and Korean Spicy Chicken; the “Pok Pok” Vietnamese Style Fried Chicken topped with cilantro and garlic chips; or the L.A. Style Kalbi, Korean BBQ short ribs tenderized in a secret house recipe. Happy Hour is 4-6 p.m. daily.

Title: District Nightclub
Content: Hawai‘i’s newest nightclub, District Nightclub, boasts a specially designed 23-ft. DJ booth, VIP lounge and 12 private tables catering to Honolulu’s hip night time crowd. Worldclass DJs such as R City, Pia Mia, DJ Felli Fel and Ty Dolla $ign spin hip-hop and club hits. Experience excellent table service and bottle presentations, plus enjoy competitive drink prices and Wednesday late-night table service specials. Happy Hour is 10-11 p.m.

Title: Ginza Nightclub
Content: The Ginza Nightclub is “Honolulu’s Exclusive After Party Destination” providing Honolulu’s only true late-night party experience. Enjoy late-night table service specials, plus world class DJs including Diplo, Graves, Bro Safari, Max Vangeli, Chuckie, Tokimonsta and LA Riots playing EDM and top hits until 4 a.m. Stop by Thursday nights for “Salsamor.” Located one block from Ala Moana Center.

Title: The Lounge HI
Content: The Lounge HI is a cool place to hang out with its comfortable seating areas and intimate atmosphere. Here, you’ll be welcomed like family whether you need a cold one after work or are meeting up with friends. Enjoy handcrafted pizza made with local ingredients baked in the 800-degree kiawe wood fire oven. Their signature menu item is That Pizza with Egg made with mushrooms, onions, garlic, truffle oil and prosciutto topped with a freshly cracked egg. Two other top picks are the BBQ Smoked Pork Pizza and PSM, Pepperoni, Sausage, Mushrooms Pizza. Happy Hour Specials available 5:30-11:30pm daily.

Title: Leelawadee Massage & Spa
Content:
Leelawadee Massage & Spa offers a new approach to leisure and life-style based on quality service and professionalism. All you need, they provide in the way of a variety of massages. Professional therapists provide gentle and relaxing Swedish Massage; Deep Tissue Massage that reaches the muscles deep layers; Thai Massage that incorporates stretching; Hot and Cold Stone Massage; and a Combination Massage—whatever your body requires. Call for an appointment, walk-ins also welcome. Validated parking.

Also located in Wahiawa at 906 Kilani Avenue, (808) 859-4492, 8 a.m.-9 p.m. daily. Free parking.
Image Title: Woman having massage of body in nature spa
Image Description: Woman having massage of body in the spa salon over green nature background

Title: Hale Ho‘ike‘ike at the Bailey House
Content: Run by the Maui Historical Society, the museum is in a mission home built in 1833 on what was once the royal compound of King Kahekili, Maui’s last ruling chief. Until 1888, it was the home of missionary teacher Edward Bailey and his family. See Maui's largest collection of Hawaiian antiquities and 19th century artifacts, as well as an ethnobotanical garden featuring rare indigenous, endemic and endangered Hawaiian plant species. Gift shop also on the premises. $7 general admission, $5 seniors 60+, $2 kids 7-12.
Image Alt Text: Hale Ho‘ike‘ike at the Bailey House - Maui

Title: Kaahumanu Church
Content: Historic Kaahumanu Church in Wailuku was built in 1876 by Reverend Edward Bailey after Queen Kaahumanu attended a religious service in Wailuku in 1832 conducted by Jonathan Smith Green. Visitors are welcome to join 9 a.m. Sunday services with hymns and invocation in the Hawaiian language.

Title: Waimanalo Bay Beach Park
Content: This three-mile long shoreline is wide and mostly empty during weekdays. A sandbar provides good waves perfect for bodysurfing and bodyboarding. Picnic areas, restrooms, showers and fishing.

Title: Kaanapali Beach
Content: Stretching The Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas to Hyatt Regency Maui Resort, this golden sand beach is perfect for people watching, walking, fun in the sun, snorkeling and swimming, not to mention the gorgeous sunset views! Restrooms, equipment rentals and showers.

Title: Hookipa Beach Park
Content: Hookipa is world-famous for windsurfing, but not great for swimming due to the strong currents. Use caution! Phones, restrooms, showers and picnic areas are available at the park.

Title: ZipCar
Content: Join Zipcar, download the app and start driving—it’s as easy as that! Once you’re approved, you’ll get a Zipcard to access vehicles around the world. On Oahu, pick one up at Pacific Beach Hotel. Rent it for an hour or the day; gas, insurance and 180 miles/day are included. It’s an alternative to the typical vehicle rental experience.

Title: The Snorkel Store
Content:
Not only do you get 2-for-1 snorkel gear rentals but The Snorkel Store also offers expert, friendly advice on hand-selected tours and books them as your full-service concierge. Their quality beach gear, whether mask, fin or snorkel, is custom fitted to each person. They can provide beach umbrellas, chairs and boogie boards because they know that a few extra items go a long way to making you comfortable for the day. SUP boards, surfboards and ocean kayaks are also available. If you’re looking for adventures, they have the inside scoop on preferred Maui activities.

Three locations:
The Fairway Shops, 2580 Kekaa Dr #114, Kaanapali HI 96761
Lahaina Square Center, 840 Wainee St #203, Lahaina HI 96761
South Maui Center, 95 E. Lipoa St #101, Kihei, Maui, HI 96753

Title: Ramada Plaza Waikiki
Content: Aloha, E Komo Mai! Your island stay begins at Ramada Plaza Waikiki located just steps away from beautiful Waikiki Beach, Ala Moana Shopping Center, Hawaii Convention Center and surrounded by an array of restaurants and local attractions. Dive into the spacious pool, work on your tan or reenergize in the well-equipped Fitness Center. As an off-beach property, Ramada Plaza Waikiki offers affordable accommodations with NO resort fees. Their primary goal is to provide you with gracious hospitality and superior service. Whether it’s for business or pleasure, come and relax, recharge and experience the aloha spirit that welcomes you at Ramada Plaza Waikiki!

Title: Yim Siam Thai Massage
Content: Non Sexual Service. Trained & certified in Bangkok, Thailand at the WATPO Temple School of Thai Traditional Medical Massage. Our healing Therapeutic massage is our experience from BANGKOK, THAILAND with Traditional Thai Massage. We know how it relates to the body's systems, physiology and kinesiology. Our goal is to assist clients seeking chronic or acute pain relief, relaxation, increased flexibility, and we have treated over a thousand clients, guaranteed.

Title: Na Pali Explorer
Content: Na Pali Explorer invites guests to explore its Garden Isle home, specifically, the magnificent beauty of the wild and remote Napali Coast. Experience fun-filled ocean adventures with sea caves, waterfalls, dolphins and more with your choice of two tours aboard rigid hull inflatable boats guaranteed to give you a thrill. The Snorkel & Sightseeing Tour aboard the comfortable Na Pali Explorer II offers snorkeling and lunch on the water. The Beach Landing Excursion Tour aboard the Explorer I provides rare access to a beach landing at Nualolo Kai State Park where you’ll explore an ancient Hawaiian fishing village. Hear about the history and culture of the Napali Coast from friendly guides sharing the spirit of aloha. Seasonal whale watch are available. Reservations required; get a $10 discount per person with online reservations.

Title: Tasting Kauai
Content: If you’re frustrated with eating food that’s not quite up to par while on vacation, book a unique tour with Tasting Kauai created by Kaua‘i-based journalist Marta Lane. As a freelance food writer, Lane has cultivated relationships with the island’s top chefs and farmers and her food tours reflect it. She is also the author of “Tasting Kauai” showcasing restaurants that make food from scratch, using local ingredients when possible. Choose from four weekly, intimate tours featuring six stops at restaurants and farms, plus generous tastings. Enjoy a truly unique edible experience! Reservations are required.

Title: Tahiti Nui Luau
Content: Since 1963, Tahiti Nui has brought back their wonderful luau experience which captures the essence of Hanalei. Bruce T Marston, of California, (USA) met Louise in Tahiti while in the United States Air Force as a Lt. Colonel over 50 years ago. Louise was a native of Tubuai (Austral Islands, French Polynesia) which is just south of Tahiti. Louise was a descendant of Tahiti Royalty in the lineage of King Tomatoa. They met in Tahiti, fell in love and married. They moved to the beautiful island of Kauai and opened a small diner. They became successful and added a small curio shop adjacent to their restaurant. Over the years The Tahiti Nui has had many changes but the one thing that remains constant is the atmosphere of friendliness, service and good food and drinks that people from over the world have come to love. Many years later Nanea, granddaughter of Bruce and Louise, continues the tradition that both locals and visitors cherish. Come celebrate the “Best of Hanalei” Luau featuring food, music, and dance from the heart of tradition that have made the Tahiti Nui a home away from home!

Title: Little Fish Coffee
Content:
This delightful coffee shop in the art community of Hanapepe and in Waimea offers a wide range of coffee drinks, smoothies, pastries, bagels, sandwiches and salads for breakfast, lunch and snacks. They also recently opened a second location at Koke‘e Lodge—perfect for loading up before hitting the trails! Be sure to ask about the daily special panini sandwiches, schmears and seasonal drinks. Nice, eclectic place to get the day started or chill down at day’s end.

Two Locations: Hours - open daily
Hanapepe - 3900 Hanapepe Rd., Hanapepe- 808-335-5000
Poipu - 2290 Poipu Beach Rd., in front of Poipu Beach Athletic Club, 808-742-2113

Title: Gina's Anykine Grinds Cafe
Content: Gina’s is the perfect place to fill up on breakfast or lunch before or after your Waimea Canyon adventure. Customers appreciate the friendly service and delicious, home-cooked comfort food available at affordable prices. Menu items include the loco moco, chicken katsu, hamburger steak, burgers and daily specials. You might also want to consider the Portuguese Sweetbread French Toast and their famous apple or coconut pies and pumpkin crunch. Breakfast is available until 10:30 a.m.

Title: Sherri Reeve Gallery & Gifts
Content: Artist Sherri Reeve lives and works in Makawao, but her watercolor artworks can be found in art collections around the world. Reflecting the pastel colors of the islands, Reeve’s work depicts trees, flowers, tropical fruits, lush fields, birds and marine life. Sherri Reeve Gallery & Gifts store features a wide selection of art prints, apparel, ornaments, calendars, stationery, notebooks, magnets, housewares and greeting cards. It’s perfect one-stop shop for your gifts and souvenirs.

Title: Sassabella Boutique
Content: Indulge in contemporary, versatile and quality pieces at Sassabella Boutique. This mini apparel abode overflows with streamlined ready-to-wear, accessories and jewelry. One stop will leave you feeling chic, beautiful and a little bit sassy. Gather your girlfriends for a soiree of wardrobe styling, trunk shows, designer appearances, locally designed products, pieces not found elsewhere on Maui and more!

Title: ONO GELATO KIHEI
Content: ‘Ono Gelato Company has made a name for itself with accolades like the “Best Local Ice Cream on Maui.” It produces locally made, traditional Italian gelato and sorbetto with an island flair using fresh, natural ingredients. Flavors are blended into unique combinations like Hawaiian Hottie, a rich chocolate gelato infused with cinnamon and spicy Hawaiian chiles, and Island Passion, a sorbetto made with passion fruit, orange and guava. The Kihei store also features island style sandwiches and salads made to order.

Title: Cronies Bar & Grill
Content: Cronies Bar and Grill has delicous bread bowls, pizza, crab cakes, angus steak and seafood to satisfy everyone.  Grilled island fish, chicken penne primavera go great with any of our new craft beers!  We also feature a kids menu and desserts that will make your mouth water!
Image Alt Text: Cronies Bar & Grill - Big Island, Hawaii

Title: wiki FRESH - Tropical Fusion Restaurant
Content: WikiFRESH is a fast-casual Tropical Fusion restaurant that focuses on ingredients that are prepared fresh. You choose from a taco, burrito or bowl to start; pick rice or lettuce; then decide on a protein and salsa to top it off!  It's a quick, easy meal on-the-go.

Title: Surfin’ Ass Coffee & Donkey Balls
Content: Surfin’ Ass Coffee & Donkey Balls is the Donkey Balls Café in Historic Kailua Village. Focusing on coffee, candy and teas, Surfin’ Ass is centrally located in the sprawling Kona Inn Shopping Village. Find chocolate-covered macadamia specialties like Donkey Balls, Flakey Balls, Mocha Balls and Salty Balls, plus Hawaiian honey. Choose from Surfin’ Ass or Happy Hawaiian Coffee and Teas. Savor a cappuccino drink. All products are made in Hawai‘i. Take with you or Surfin’ Ass ships across the U.S.

Title: Keoki’s Ono Fish & Chips
Content:
Keoki’s Ono Fish & Chips not only offers tasty fish and chips, but grass-fed burgers made with local Kealia Ranch beef. Try the freshly made, baked fish tacos concocted with island-caught ono, potatoes, zucchini and carrots. Also on tap are vegan burgers, deli sandwiches, grilled cheese and fresh salads. Wet your whistle with a fresh fruit smoothie—try passionfruit or mango, or a specialty coffee drink.

Dine inside or out of the homey café. Place your order and browse at the adjacent gift shop stocked with local artwork, Keoki Donkey Ball confections and homemade peanut brittle.

Title: Foster’s Kitchen
Content: Foster’s Kitchen prepares their menu items in-house daily from scratch. It may take a little longer, but it’s definitely worth the wait. They procure the freshest ingredients from local farmers and are committed to the highest quality of service. Experience fine dining that feels casual and family-friendly, and enjoy liquid perfection with their handcrafted cocktails. One of the highlights is the Lele Cocktail made with hibiscus, citrus and lemongrass in Kai Coconut Pandan. Pair it with one of the delicious appetizers for a perfect taste of Foster's.

Title: Banzai Pipeline (‘Ehukai Beach Park)

Title: Sunset Beach Park
Content:
Home to big wave surf, Sunset Beach Park is one of the most popular surf destinations in the world. The two-mile stretch spans from ʻEhukai Beach (Banzai Pipeline) to Sunset Point on the North Shore of Oʻahu and boasts huge swells up to 30 feet, particularly in the winter. Because of its ideal surfing conditions, Sunset Beach is home to multiple surf competitions including the Vans Triple Crown of Surfing and the HIC Pro. Avoid tackling these massive waves unless you’re an experienced surfer, as winter season surf can be incredibly dangerous for those who are inexperienced!

In addition to its breathtaking surf, the beauty of Sunset Beach Park is right there in its name—the sunsets here are incredible! These dramatic Haleʻiwa sunsets are truly beautiful, so remember to bring your camera!

Though swimming is decent during the summer, beachgoers should pay close attention to the warning flags posted by lifeguards. When the waves are flat, Sunset Beach is also a great place for some shallow water snorkeling.

Of course, you don’t want to leave Sunset Beach without stopping at the iconic Ted’s Bakery! Situated just across from the beach, Ted’s Bakery is a local staple offering “a slice of heaven” with its famous cream pies as well as plate lunch style fare.

Title: Hale‘iwa Beach Park
Content: Located near the charming town of  Hale‘iwa, this beach park is a great setting for a picnic and offers a stunning view of Keana Point. Kayaking, canoeing and surfing are popular here but the rocky and shallow open bottom makes it difficult to swim. There are no lifeguards on duty. Amenities include: restrooms, showers, picnic areas, basketball and volleyball courts, a baseball field and parking.

Title: Hawaii’s Favorite Kitchens
Content: Hawaii’s Favorite Kitchens makes it easy for you to enjoy some of the island’s most popular signature dishes in one spot! Locals are familiar with the favorite comfort foods from Poke Stop, KC Drive Inn, Mike’s Huli Chicken, Rainbow Drive In, Shimazu Shave Ice and Bubbies, and these are what you can order up without the typical wait. Order up and take out for the family—Raw Poke Stop Bowl, KC Waffle Dog with or without chili, BB Chicken Plate, a “Rainbowl” with your choice of protein, yummy shave ice or mochi ice cream!

Title: Pagoda Hotel / Pagoda Floating Restaurant
Content: Located in the landmark Pagoda Hotel, the Pagoda Floating Restaurant is surrounded by relaxing koi ponds and a Japanese garden. Its three semi-private teahouses offer guests the opportunity to celebrate special occasions. Enjoy an award-winning menu of Asian, Western and Hawaiian flavors. The new dinner menu includes Asian Braised Pork Belly, Baked Oysters, Sake Soy Braised Beef Short Ribs, Seared Furikake Ahi and Pan Roasted Kona Kampachi.

Title: Coral Crater Adventure Park
Content:
Venture to O‘ahu’s west side and you’ll be rewarded with more breathing space, as well as the opportunity to zipline over a 60-foot-deep crater created by the Navy in the 1940s who dug for coral to build runways at Barber’s Point Naval Air Station. You’ll find it—and more family-fun activities—at Coral Crater Adventure Park, created by CEO Jim Owen.

“At the time I began (drawing out plans for) the project, there wasn’t a zipline on O‘ahu,” says Owen. However, by the time Coral Crater officially opened to the public, there were two other ziplines that had opened for business.

“I think ziplining is a very inclusive activity because it requires a sense of adventure, but not athletic ability,” he says. “I believe we need to encourage people to spend more time outdoors doing healthy things and Coral Crater Adventure Park makes that easy.”

He shares that there are two new activities in the works for 2020, but “those are top secret right now.”

Until we hear more, visitors can enjoy the park’s unique features.

“We are the only park with an adventure tower,” explains Owen. “This creates an opportunity for guests to challenge themselves. It’s unusual in tourism, and the result is a strong feeling of pride and satisfaction.” You can also enjoy side-by-side ATVs and the island’s only night ziplining. Owen adds, “Our ziplines are uniquely designed in that when you stand on the platform, you can’t see the landing platform; stepping off requires a degree of courage.”

Owen is also proud of the fact that Coral Crater incorporates sustainability into its daily practices. “Coral Crater is a true eco-park because we operate using off-the-grid solar power,” he says. “We recycle and repurpose. For example, the shipping container that our ATVs were brought in is now our office. We also have a small orchard with exotic fruits like lemon drop mangosteens, miracle berries and ice cream bananas that we share with our guests.”

“All types of visitors to Coral Crater Adventure Park become fast friends on the tour,” says Owen. So stop by and get to know your fellow travelers while getting an adrenaline rush!

Title: Koloa Gulch
Content:
This hike is about 8 miles round trip. You will need a hiking permit to complete it.

This somewhat rugged hike will lead you to an 80-foot-tall waterfall and pool. The trail starts off with a bit of an incline but it's not this incline that makes the path moderate. The hike becomes a little more difficult due to continuously crossing many streams, walking over rocks and light bouldering. Flash floods are what make this hike dangerous. Be sure to check any advisory before heading out. Watch out for falling rocks.  If you feel like you’re lost, continue upstream. The journey is truly rewarding when you encounter the waterfall.  If you have a bit more energy to keep trekking, go left at the fork towards another trail that will lead you to another massive waterfall.

Tips: Follow the yellow ribbons. They will tell you when to cross. Don’t rock-hop. It is much safer to just cross if the path allows for it. A permit can be picked up at Hawai‘i Reserves at the La‘ie Shopping Center.

Title: Maunawili Falls Trail
Content:
This hike is about 3.0 miles round trip. 

Short and sweet, this moderate hike takes travelers and locals alike, through the jungle on the windward side of the island.  The trail follows the river, which you will need to cross many times during the course of the hike. Breaks in the trail lead to marvelous views of Kailua, Olomana and the Koolaupoko watershed.  A beautiful waterfall and swimming hole await you at the end of this adventure.  It isn’t uncommon to see locals and visitors jumping from the falls or even the ridge into the swimming hole. Jump at your own risk.  This is a great family trail and dog friendly, as long as your dog is on a leash.

Tips: This is a muddy trail, especially after rainfall. Wear/bring appropriate gear. Mountain bikers often use this trail, be aware they may not be visible from a distance and vice versa. Take caution.

Title: Lulumahu Falls
Content:
This hike is 2.5 miles round trip.

This hidden gem is worth discovering. Located past the tumbling ruins of the late King Kamehameha’s summer palace, this trail leads you through military terrain, (heed warning signs) and off to a tropical haven. Locals and tourists alike, venture through the beautiful bamboo forest, conquer some light bouldering and trek up the rugged trail. The result? A beautiful 50ft. cascading waterfall that makes this short hike, truly spectacular.

Tip: This is a wet hike. Be sure to have the proper hiking attire, gear and boots for the adventure.

Title: Manana Trail
Content:
A long, yet beautiful hike on the outskirts of Pearl City. Adorned with magnificent flora, this ridge trail hike leads you through hilly terrain that will require some climbing. Ropes are there along the path for assistance if needed. The total hike is about 12 miles, round trip, however there are shady spots along the trail to keep you cool on your journey up. This trail is centrally located, giving the perfect vantage point of the windward side of the island. The hike to the summit is about 4-5 miles but once to the top, the view is breathtaking.

Tip: Go in August or September when the wild strawberries and guava are in season.

Title: BREKKIE BOWLS
Content: Made with aloha and the spirit of the island, Brekkie Bowls delivers fresh fruit and beautiful ingredients to fit your healthy and active lifestyle. Every creation is handcrafted to fit your palate and brought to you with a smile. Authentic, vegan-friendly and non-gmo, our acai bowls, smoothies and pitaya bowls are just what you need after a long workout or to start the day. Enjoy lovely conversation as your order is prepared and leave as part of the ohana.  Stop by the Brekkie Bowls truck today for a delicious experience! Ladies, save a dollar off your bowl purchase on “Wahine Wednesday.”

Title: Makalei Golf Club
Content:
Makalei Golf Club is a breathtakingly beautiful golf course on the western slopes of Hualalai Mountain on Hawai‘i Island. Designed by Dick Nugent & Associates, the course reflects the raw, natural beauty of the island, incorporating native forests, mountain slopes and unique volcanic features such as lava tubes and cinder cones. It is some the finest in Kona golf.

“Makalei has the best overall vistas of any course on the Kailua side,” says This Week Big Island General Manager Ed Chung. “And it has bent grass greens, which is unusual for Hawai‘i.”

Makalei offers challenging play for golfers of all levels, with multiple tees that can extend the course from 5,242 yards to a championship length of 7,091 yards.

Golf shop on the premises and club rentals available.

See our Makalei Golf Article here.

Title: The Ocean Course at Hokuala
Content:
With the longest continuous stretch of oceanfront golfing in all of Hawai‘i, the Ocean Course at Hokuala A Timbers Resort, offers the perfect view for a perfect Kaua‘i day. Vibrant, lush greenery transcends acres of sky and sea. Spend all day and evening having fun and unwinding to an ocean view that you’ll remember for a lifetime.

The course has been fully renovated and features a brand new practice facility. The front nine holes of the golf course complete those previously made to the Ocean Course back nine, including new world-class putting surfaces with TifEagle grass and new bright white silica sand bunkers. Landscape enhancements not only improve the visual aesthetics of the course by featuring the exceptional natural beauty of the Garden Isle, but also provide new innovative designs for players. The expanded and improved driving range and practice facility will soon accommodate a diverse offering of player improvement programs. 

“Both experienced players and novices will find that the Ocean Course complements each player’s level, providing an enjoyable game for all. We are thrilled to introduce a new tier of golf in Hawaii to both travelers and the local community,” said Fran Roach, General Manager of the Ocean Course at Hokuala. “Our swift completion of these renovations of this first phase will allow visitors to look forward to the upcoming chapters for Hokuala.”

The course delights the eyes with stunning views of the ocean as well as mango groves. Eighteen holes allow each player the time and concentration they need in order to putt a perfect game. With wonderful rates and kama‘aina special pricing you can be sure to make the most out of your special trip. Hokuala invites you to experience luxury golfing, like never before. Bask in the true spirit of aloha with gracious and accommodating staff. 

Exceptional golf instructors such as Kellie Hines share their professional experience with those looking to enhance their skills or want to get into the swing of things.  This PGA pro is highly renowned in the golf scene and is a life-long resident of Kaua‘i. She also coaches Hawai‘i’s championship girls’ team.  Let Kellie along with the staff at Hokuala help you get your best foot forward and improve your game today. 

In addition to amazing PGA instructors, the Ocean Course also plays host to a variety of tournaments throughout Hawai‘i to take your A game to another level.  Start your own group or join one of the many kama‘aina groups that are always looking for new players.  Hokuala handles everything from scoring, to planning pairings, awards and even food and beverage. Professional and courteous staff are always there to assist in the perfect setting so you can focus on creating memorable moments.

Fancy a way to get around the course? Opt for the golfboard. Golfboarding allows players to maneuver a surf-like motorized board with a stability bar for balance. There is also a place on the front of the board to store your clubs. Pivot and turn your body to change direction of the board as you explore beautiful green acres. Golfboarding is fun way to travel on a warm, sunny day.

Experience a different side of Hokuala’s glittering scenery and spectacular ocean view. The sunset cruise invites visitors to rent a golf cart and watch the sunset over the Pacific Ocean. The sunset cruise includes a complimentary adult beverage (beer or wine) that you can enjoy while gazing over the colorful horizon.  Book your tee time or cruise adventure today and see why MSN Travel calls the Ocean Course one of the 12 most beautiful in the world.

Title: Dive Oahu
Content:
As the most isolated landmass in the world, Hawai‘i is also home to some of the most unique marine life. You can explore below the ocean’s surface with Dive Oahu, serving the dive community and visitor market for over 25 years. 

Asked to name a favorite dive site, Owner Brian Benton says, “The Sea Tiger wreck is one of our favorites! It lies in about 127 feet of sand, with the main deck between 85 and 100 feet. The Sea Tiger sits perfectly upright and hosts an abundance of marine life with consistently excellent dive conditions.” 

The Sea Tiger is home to Undulated, Yellow Margin and Dwarf Morays. There is a “resident” Java Moray, the largest of all morays!  “Octopus love to hang out in the floorboards and White Tip Reef Sharks will sleep underneath or inside the wreck,” says Benton. 

Dive Oahu will not only take you on safe diving adventures on their beautiful, new 46-foot boat “Anger Management,” they also offer surf lessons, canoe rides and snorkel adventure. They also host a Friday evening fireworks cruise.

Dive Oahu has morning, afternoon and night dives daily; PADI scuba training; and certifies up to Master Scuba Diver. For those looking to expand their training, PADI continuing education and specialty instructor training are a great option. Free pickup is available from any Waikiki hotel. First time divers welcome too.

Receive a FREE Dive Oahu souvenir T-shirt! Just mention This Week Oahu Magazine when you book your dive.

Book a Dive Oahu Excursion Today!

Private Charter

Think outside the norm! Book a private charter for your next event or adventure! We cater for special requests or events, including birthdays, wedding/holiday parties, anniversaries, corporate meetings, and more!

-

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="241" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

Night Dives

See what comes out to play when the lights go out! Come experience a whole new perspective on your favorite dive sites at night!

3 - 4 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="3108" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

Shallow Reefs Tour

Enjoy exceptional diving along Honolulu's famous reefs such as Kaiser's, Turtle Canyons and Secrets!

3 - 4 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="8984" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

Wreck & Reef Tour

The best wreck diving experience in Hawaiian waters! Join us on a guided tour of a stunning wreck on the south shore of Oahu followed by a beautiful guided tour of one of Honolulu's favorite reef sites.

3 - 4 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="9120" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

BYOB Fireworks Cruise

Observe the vibrant Waikiki Fireworks Show with an unobstructed view aboard Dive Oahu's boat every Friday. Watch the Honolulu skyline light up as the Waikiki Fireworks show dazzles you from the comfort of the boat.

2 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="32995" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

South Shore Boat Cruise - BYOB

This is a a must-do activity! Cruise out from Waikiki, with a picturesque view of Waikiki Beach, south shore Oahu, and Diamond Head. Relax on board with a drink as you keep an eye out for various marine life, to include turtles and dolphins.

2 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="166394" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

Turtle Canyon Adventure

Snorkel in azure seas alongside the majestic Honu, Hawaii's Green Sea Turtle with the Waikiki coastline as your backdrop.

3+ Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="212159" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

Introductory Diving

Introductory Divers will receive a 1-on-1 skills session, that will provide basic safety guidelines and skills needed to dive under the direct supervision of a PADI Professional, followed by a guided reef tour! 

3 - 4 Hrs.

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="212164" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

PADI Open Water Course

If you’ve always wanted to take scuba diving lessons, experience unparalleled adventure and see the world beneath the waves, this is where it starts.

-

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="78940" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

PADI Advanced Open Water Course

This course can be taken after completing the PADI Open Water Diver certification.

-

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="82562" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

PADI Rescue Diver Course

Learn to prevent and manage problems in the water, and become more confident in your skills as a diver. It's challenging, yet very rewarding.

-

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="110725" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

Emergency First Response Course

Emergency First Response training focuses on building confidence in lay rescuers and increasing their willingness to respond when faced with a medical emergency.

-

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="111340" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

PADI Open Water Referral Course

With PADI's Open Water Referral Course, you can complete your Knowledge Development and Pool Dives at a local PADI dive store near you and then join Dive Oahu's ohana to finish your scuba certification in paradise!

2 Days

[lightframe shortname="diveoahu" items="219116" asn="fhdn" asn-ref="thisweekhawaii" full-item="yes" flow="no" branding="yes" bookable-only="yes"] BOOK NOW [/lightframe]

PADI Freediver Course

Join Dive Oahu's ohana and get freedive certified!

Title: Alan Akana Gallery
Content: Elegant watercolor paintings line the walls of the Alan Akana Gallery. Beautiful pieces depict flowers indigenous to Hawai‘i with vibrant and enticing colors. Locally owned and flourishing with sophisticated artwork, this gallery is a must-see for any local or traveling art-collector, artist or art-curious individual. Presenting a variety of options from original watercolors to prints, posters and greeting cards, Alan Akana Gallery displays exquisite, cultural and divine pieces. Whether you’re a collector or just looking for an eye-catching piece, the Alan Akana Gallery will wow your guests and dazzle your space. Bring home a unique and inspiring part of the collection today.

Title: Na Hoku
Content: The essence of Hawaiian lifestyle and tradition has been captured in the Na Hoku collection of fine jewelry.  Hawaiian for “stars,” Na Hoku also stands for incomparable quality and craftsmanship. At Na Hoku, you will find exquisite designs by Kabana, Le Vian, Bellarri, and other jewelry artisans. The stores feature a wide selection of exceptional jewelry. Visit NaHoku.com to find the store nearest you.

Title: VIVE Hotel Waikiki
Content:
Vive Hotel Waikiki is a stylish and modern lifestyle boutique hotel, perfectly located just three blocks from Waikiki Beach in Honolulu, HI. The hotel provides a stylish and inviting place to call home when visiting the island of Oahu. The hotel is known for its warm and attentive service that keeps guests coming back again and again.

Guests staying at Vive do not pay ANY resort fees and are treated to a host of complimentary amenities. Upon check-in guests are treated to a cold scented towel and chilled beverage to refresh after their journey. All guests are also provided with complimentary WiFi, use of beach gear (boogie boards and beach mats, beach towels) and a daily complimentary continental breakfast.

Our lobby, known as The Living Room, is a great place to gather before a night out on the town or after a day at the beach. Comfortable club style seating is combined with communal areas, which are great for large groups or business travelers checking email. We offer tea and coffee service throughout the day as well as chilled water and a microwave and toaster oven is available in the kitchen-style area for guests who might like to heat anything up. Guests are encouraged to use the recycled reads library – leave the book you finished on the beach and grab one to take home and read on the plane.

Title: Pipeline Bakeshop & Creamery
Content: Bite into a uniquely delicious malasada or yummy cake bomb bursting with flavor. These one-of-a-kind sweets are the original creations of owner/founder Gayla of Pipeline Bakeshop & Creamery located not on the North Shore, but in Kaimuki. Here you’ll find the Pipeline Classic Malasada, a result of more than 100 test batches, with your choice of sugar coatings on the exterior, and oh, so soft interior minus the oil. So very pretty and perfect for any occasion, the Cake Bomb is a moist, mini flavored cake with flavors such as Lemon (lemon cake, lemon glaze dusted with fresh lemon zest), Coconut (coconut cake, coconut glaze, topped with toasted coconut) and Strawberry Guava (ditto everything in strawberry!). Other flavors available too! And finally, there’s a variety of ice cream made inhouse minus artificial flavors, colors, preservatives and stabilizers. The newest creation is the MALAFROZADA®, a malasada ice cream made with chunks of malasada! Made fresh daily!

Title: Volcano Shakes
Content: These shakes are huge—HUGE—and oh, so good. Made with rich, house-made ice cream made in small batches, these thick, creamy milkshakes come with all the yummy fixings piled on top. Top three flavors are the Mauna Loa Coffee & Donut, Mauna Kea S’mores and Haleakala Red Velvet Volcano Shakes, but the signature shake is the Mauna Loa Coffee & Donut made with rich espresso ice cream served affogato-style (drowning in espresso) and adorned with small donuts, a biscotti and large iced donut. It also stands over a foot tall! If you’re looking for something more ”normal sized,” Volcano Shakes also has smaller Lava Shakes and a signature drink, the Lava Latte. Volcano Shakes is a really fun and unique experience guaranteed to “Wow!” you.

Title: koa pancake
Content: If singing in the shower bothers your neighbors or singing in the car draws too many stares, Karaoke GS Studio provides the opportunity for you to sing, even dance and express yourself to your heart’s content in your own private space. To loosen up those vocal chords, the full bar offers soft drinks, cocktails, and other beverages. Choose from six rooms that can accommodate one person up to a group of 25. Save by asking about their early bird special noon-8 p.m.or the evening special 5-8 p.m.

Title: Bikeadelic
Content: Now you can rent top-of-the-line bikes to explore the island on an easy, eco-friendly adventure with Bikeadelic. Owners Don and wife Dorinda make it easy with the top five bike-friendly routes and a helpful map to take with you. Head out on lightweight, high-end road and mountain bikes to six different island parks, historic Honolulu, Mt. Tantalus, Diamond Head and Hanauma Bay (and you don’t have to worry about parking!). All rentals come with helmets, locks, and bags and racks for storing goodies you find along the way. Kids’ bikes and bike seats, trail-a-bikes and Burley Trailers are available too.

Title: Waikiki Ocean Thriller
Content: Satisfy your need for speed with Waikiki Ocean Thriller as the 32-ft. rigid hull, inflatable boat races across the ocean past the Waikiki coastline and landmark Diamond Head. Sit back and enjoy the ride as the expert crew shares Waikiki’s history, Hawaiian culture and marine ecology. Because the vessel sits low in the water, you’ll also get a close up view of marine life. They’ll take it slow as you visit one of the tour highlights, Turtle Canyon, where endangered Green Sea Turtles congregate. Spend some time out on the water and get ready for an exhilarating ride!

Title: Lilly & Emma
Content: Located next to ABC Store inside Malino, Lilly & Emma is an adorable boutique featuring casual apparel. Sisters Lilly and Emma offer tees, pants, outerwear and totes inspired by tropical breezes, sunlight filtering through palm leaves and waves rolling onto the Waikiki shoreline. You can just feel it, can't you? One of their original items and best sellers is the “Feel Aloha” tee destined to spread the aloha vibe whenever you put it on.

Title: Olive & Oliver
Content: This unique boutique and coffee bar offers much for visitors and locals alike. Find resort attire for both men and women including accessories and Hawaii memorabilia. Enjoy a cup of coffee or tea while you shop for that perfect gift for someone special or to treat yourself. Also located in Kailua. 2 Locations: 43 Kihapa St., Kailua (808) 263-9919 Mon-Fri 10am-6pm, Sat 10am - 5pm and in the Surfjack Boutique Hotel on Lewers Street in Waikiki.

Title: Farmers Market of Maui
Content:
Farmers Market of Maui has a tradition of offering the tastiest Maui-grown produce direct from local farms. Shop for avocados, bananas, coconuts, mangoes and papayas. Pick up airport-ready Maui pineapples and onions, island macadamia nuts and coffee. You’ll also find fresh home baked goods.

Check out their other location at: 3636 Lower Honoapiilani Rd, Lahaina, HI 96761 as well.

West Maui Market

South Maui Market

Title: Ho‘oulu Community Farmers Market and Artisans Fair
Content: Find fresh food and art, 100 percent grown-and-created on Hawai‘i Island, at Ho‘oulu Community Farmers Market and Artisans Fair, 9 a.m.-2 p.m. Wednesdays. This outdoor “Gallery on the Green” offers exclusive products, plus a Hawaiian cultural booth staging hands-on educational opportunities to make arts and crafts. Enjoy freshly prepared, on-site breakfast and lunch, plus LIVE, LOCAL music!

Title: Queen's Nails & Spa
Content: Fall in love with the perfect cure... manicure that is! Queens Nails & Spa is SET to give you the perfect set, care and attention, whether it is a massage, mani-pedi or facial. Relax in comfort as specialized technicians care for your skin, nails and pamper you with a massage. Leave feeling refreshed and beautiful just like the queen that you are. Waxing, skincare, specialty nail services and eyelash extensions are available. Call or visit the website to schedule an appointment.

Title: The Shops at Wailea
Content: Step into luxury and fun with a variety of shopping options to satisfy your vacation needs. The Shops at Grand Wailea offer a variety merchandise geared for perfecting your trip. Splash into fun with the Beach & Pool store and grab water toys, sunglasses, waterwear, waterproof cameras and other accessories. When you’re done diving in, grab a bite and a coffee at Café Kula. Scrumptious meals are always on the menu as well as gelato to help you cool down during those warm Hawai‘i days. Don’t forget to stop by Na Hoku for specialty Hawai‘i-made jewelry and view the exotic and intricate works of art at various galleries. Reserve your free 45-minute session (for Grand Wailea guests) at Pacific Dream Photography, at a scenic location. Shop around at local boutiques for beauty essentials and resortwear. Visit the website for a full list of shops and more information.

Title: Hukilau Marketplace
Content: The Hukilau Marketplace at the Polynesian Cultural Center reestablishes Laie as a gathering place for old-fashioned family fun, shopping and dining. Enjoy more than 40 retail, dining and activity providers in an inviting, open-air atmosphere that brings back the Laie of old.

Title: The Shops at Grand Wailea
Content: Step into luxury and fun with a variety of shopping options to satisfy your vacation needs. The Shops at Grand Wailea offer merchandise geared for perfecting your trip. Splash into fun with the Beach & Pool store and snag water toys, sunglasses, waterwear, waterproof cameras and other accessories. When you’re done diving in, grab a bite and a coffee at Café Kula. Be sure to grab a tasty gelato which will help you cool down during those warm Hawai‘i days.

Title: Wiki Fresh
Content:
With the promise of serving customers fresh daily, giving back to the community through fundraisers and using bio-combustible utensils, WikiFRESH is focused on offering tropical fusion fare with a conscience.

   A menu of fresh ingredients make it easy to build your own bowl, wrap or taco, plus get tortilla chips on the side. Beer on tap, wine and WikiRITAs available too. Happy Hour at 4 and 6 p.m. Monday-Friday.

Title: Alchemy Maui
Content: Looking for a healthy bite? Alchemy Maui serves delicious, light meals as well as a wide variety of house-made, Valley Isle Kombucha. Locals and visitors alike are sure to enjoy a casual ambiance and delightful service. Enjoy the pastrami panini and ahi panini both served on homemade sourdough bread. Also take a bite out of their delicious kale salad while enjoying their refreshing lemongrass, mint and basil kombucha. Each dish is served to please and created with local and organic ingredients. Take advantage of a loyalty card for frequent visits.

Title: Mai Grille
Content:
A friend to local farmers, fishermen and ranchers, Chef/Owner Allen Hess brings his slow food dishes to the forefront at Mai Grille overlooking the Kings’ Golf Course. Some of his dishes have a modern and sophisticated spin on a few local classics as well. Stop by for breakfast, Sunday Brunch, lunch and dinner—the must-try are the bacon dishes!

Mai Grille defines OTP—Original True Pairing—as a “perfect pour and a dish you can’t. stop. eating.” That said, stop by for Happy Hour, 2-5 p.m.daily. Enjoy local brews and a selection of wines alongside delicious bites such as the Pulled Mai Bacon Quesadilla with a sweet sour pineapple sauce; Mai BLT, house-cured bacon; or the Mai Bacon, a half-pound of bacon with barbecue sauce.

Title: Ocean Sports Bar & Grill
Content:
Residents and visitors have been coming and going from Oceans Sports Bar & Grill for the last 15 years, and it’s all thanks to owners Todd and Shirley Hull.

“My husband and I love watching sports, and enjoy food and drinks while doing so,” says Shirley. It was the inspiration behind opening this casual dining spot featuring sports games on TV monitors. But don’t let that distract you from the ocean and sunset views—they’re incredible!

There’s lots to like on the menu. Shirley’s favorite is the “one-pound peel-and-eat Cajun or Garlic Butter Shrimp, as well as the Cobb Salad and Tomato Stack. People love our fried pickles too!”

Check on their daily specials as well. “We’re known for our Taco Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday,” says Shirley. “Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays we run a $9.95 fish and chips special that’s become really popular too. And you can’t beat the $4 Mai Tai all day, every day.”

One of Oceans Sports Bar’s signature cocktails is the Queen’s Favorite. “It’s a Lilikoi Margarita with Li Hing Mui on the rim. Another is the Passion Tea, which is a twist on a Long Island Iced Tea with lilikoi (passion fruit),” shares Shirley. And let's not forget the Oceans World Famous Mai Tai, referred to as “sunset in a glass,” a layered mix of guava, light rum, orange and pineapple juices, plus a dose of dark rum. Accompanied by an island sunset on the water, sounds perfect.

She says Oceans Sports Bar’s casual open-air atmosphere along with affordable prices is what brings people back, which makes it a great stop along Ali‘i Drive.

Title: Big Island Running Company
Content: Drop by Big Island Running Co., the only specialty running store on Hawai‘i Island. Find high-quality shoes, apparel, accessories—and everything in between—to fulfill your running needs. The expert staff also provides expert shoe fittings—and inserts if needed—to ensure the right shoe for your feet and running style. You can also get advice on shoe and equipment selection, nutrition and training tips.

Title: Big Island Gravity Skydiving
Content: Big Island Gravity Skydiving is guaranteed to provide a life time memory. Guests take off from Upola Airport and fly up to 12,000 feet above the Seven Sacred Valleys and the Kohala Coast before jumping with a tandem instructor. After experiencing the sensations of a one mile free fall, you’ll float back gently to the earth while soaking in the beauty of Hawai‘i.

Title: Legends of Hawaiʻi Lūʻau
Content: Experience an exhilarating, captivating lūʻau that brings to life the ancestral song and dance of Hawaiʻi at Legends of Hawaiʻi Lūʻau. Telling the story of the Big Island, Legends of Hawaiʻi Lūʻau features exotic dance, music and entertainment the whole family will enjoy. Highlights include thrilling fire knife dancing, live Polynesian music and delicious, island-inspired cuisine like kalua pig, fresh island fish and tropical fruits.

Title: Kamuela Provision Company
Content:
There’s nothing more luxurious than enjoying a fresh, seasonal meal using the best locally sourced ingredients by the sea. You'll experience just that at Kamuela Provision Company. 

Chef Dayne Tanabe's new menu takes these ingredients of Hawai‘i and the Pacific in unexpected and exciting directions.

"We're proud that a majority of the ingredients on our new menu continue to be locally sourced, and when at all possible, sustainable and organic," says Tanabe. "We've kept some of our fan favorites on the menu, but have added new dishes that offer diners a taste of place delivered at an elevated, fine dining level."

Every menu item, from the Pork Belly Bao Bun to the Deconstructed Mahi Lau Lau, the Roasted Pineapple Chipotle BBQ Glazed Beef Short Ribs to the Portobello Mushroom & Porcini Ravioli and Waimea Sweet Corn Mousse, is a wonderful journey, sure to delight the palate and your tummy.

Reservations are recommended.
Image Alt Text: Kamuela Provision Company - Big Island, Hawaii||

Title: WikiFRESH
Content:
With the promise of serving customers fresh daily, giving back to the community through fundraisers and using bio-combustible utensils, WikiFRESH is focused on offering tropical fusion fare with a conscience.

A menu of fresh ingredients make it easy to build your own bowl, wrap or taco, plus get tortilla chips on the side. Beer on tap, wine and WikiRITAs available too. Happy Hour at 4 and 6 p.m. Monday-Friday and all day Sunday.

Title: FERRARI COFFEE
Content: In Ali‘i Gardens Marketplace, stop by the new Ferrari Kona Coffee Shop & Visitor Center in Kailua-Kona for 100 percent Kona coffee and coffee blends to take home, plus Aloha Specials and a free cup of coffee.

Title: Brennecke's Happy Hour
Content: Brennecke's is located across from Poipu Beach, with awesome ambience and views is a local favorite, serving great cuisine. Happy Hour 3-5 p.m. & 8:30 p.m.-closing daily. Live music Thursday, Friday, Saturday starting at 8:30 p.m. (808) 742-7588, brenneckes.com.

Title: B.I.G. SKYDIVING
Content: Who knew jumping out of an airplane could be so intoxicating and crazy fun?Experience an adrenaline rush of a lifetime and check off one of your bucket list items with B.I.G. Skydiving. Part of the anticipation is getting on the airplane and the Big Jump, but before that, really see Hawai‘i Island from a different perspective as you soar above the Kohala Coast, deep valleys and open pastures of Waimea. Then it’s time to jump from over 12,000 feet in altitude! Feel the amazing rush of freefalling then drift under canopy until you touch ground. What a rush!
Image Alt Text: B.I.G Air Skydiving - Tandem Skydiving on the Big Island Hawaii|||

Title: Kona Scooters
Content: Journey through the Big Island in comfort and style with the help of Kona Scooters! Kona Scooters leads the way in moped and scooter rental, repair and sales in beautiful Kailua-Kona. By embracing and promoting the community’s scooter and moped lifestyle, Kona Scooters offers visitors and locals alike an opportunity to let down their hair and feel the fresh island breeze on their faces as they enjoy the freedom and convenience of a scooter.

Title: Hilton Waikoloa Village
Content: A destination in itself, this impressive property is nestled within 62 oceanfront acres, offering breathtaking tropical gardens and abundant wildlife. Explore our waterfront resort by air-conditioned trams. Or take a leisurely stroll along flagstone walkways flanked by Polynesian and Asian artwork. Located on the Kohala Coast of the Big Island of Hawaii, Hilton Waikoloa Village features 1,240 guest rooms and suites - perfectly suited to any taste.

Title: Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ
Content: Be your own chef at Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ and savor the delicious flavors of grilled meats and vegetables prepared yakiniku style at your own table-top grill to suit your tastebuds. Select from a wide range of meats that include Harami Skirt Steak in a miso marinade, Certified Angus Kalbi Short Rib in tare soy marinade and soft and flavorful 21-day aged Angus Beef. Top dishes include the Bistro Hangar Steak, Garlic Shoyu Chicken and Pork Belly. A popular dessert is the dorayaki with gelato; dorayaki is a Japanese-style pancake ice cream sandwich. Gyukaku also has Happy Hour 11:30 a.m.-6:30 p.m. and late night 9:30-11:30 p.m. daily.

Title: Lash Love Hawaii
Content: Enhance your natural beauty with long and lovely lashes courtesy of the specialists at Lash Love Hawaii. Owner Nikki Sanchez customizes each eyelash set to fit your unique style using high-quality individual strands of lashes. Look great 24/7! Services include lash extensions, eyelash perms, Brazilian waxing and more in a modern space similar to those in New York and Los Angeles.

Title: ARVO Cafe
Content: This bright and modern Australian-inspired spot, Arvo Cafe, focuses on light Aussie-style food and coffee at reasonable prices. Specialties include the Loaded Avocado Toast, Matcha Chia Seed Pudding and Flat White Latte. You may also want to try the Smoked Salmon Toast and Prosciutto and Cheese Croissant. Arvo Cafe “Brings love of Australia to Hawaii.”

Title: Mauna Loa
Content:
Did you know macadamia nuts are heart healthy? Macadamia nuts are a source of monounsaturated fat that’s said to help lower LDL cholesterol (the bad one). Mauna Loa macadamia nuts are popular year round, whether it’s for a Christmas, birthdays, gifts for family and friends, even as party favors. Salted, unsalted, flavored or chocolate covered, mac nuts are available in island stores and online in boxes, pouches and tins. Savory flavors include mango chipotle, Maui onion and garlic; or go for sweet with honey roasted, cookies and créme, Kona coffee glaze or butter candy glaze. You’re sure to find a favorite!

Available in island stores and online

Title: Koa Cafe
Content: Find lots of choices on the menu, but these require a second look—Guava Lava Mochi Waffle, a butter-mochi waffle topped with guava puree and whip cream; Angry Korean Benedict, kalbi (short ribs) and kim chee topped with Sriracha Hollandaise sauce; and the Sweet Bread French Toast, three thick cut pieces of sweet bread dipped in a cinnamon and vanilla egg bath. Omelettes, egg breakfast plates, pancakes are the menu too, plus your choice of sides if needed.

Title: Koa Pancake House
Content: Casual and comfortable with six locations on O‘ahu, Koa Pancake Housecontinues to serve customers traditional breakfast and lunch plates with a touch of Hawai‘i. And all at reasonable prices and hearty portions! Enjoy savory omelettes, breakfast plates, eggs benedict, as well as waffles, french toast, pancakes, crepes any time of day. Or choose from lunch items such as burgers, sandwiches and plates after 11 a.m. If you’re looking for fast service, large portions and friendly service, stop by Koa Pancake House.

Title: Alchemy Maui/Valley Isle Kombucha
Content:
Looking for a healthy bite? Drop by Alchemy Maui, a tasting room and bakery in Lahaina serving delicious, light meals, as well as 14 blends of their Valley Isle Kombucha. Kombucha is a deliciously fermented, sweetened tea regarded as a health tonic. It’s made inhouse with local fruits and herbs, and is served on tap! 

Enjoy popular menu items such as the pastrami panini and ahi panini both served on Chef Mark’s homemade sourdough bread. Also take a bite out of the fresh kale salad while enjoying a refreshing lemongrass, mint and basil kombucha. 

Everything on the menu is non-GMO and made with fresh isle ingredients. 

Locals and visitors alike can enjoy Alchemy’s friendly service and casual ambiance.  Also take advantage of the loyalty card for frequent visits.

Title: Taqueria Cruz
Content: For authentic Mexican cuisine look no further than Taqueria Cruz. This restaurant serves up traditional and made-to-order classics such as blackened fish, street tacos, burritos, quesadillas, nachos, taquitos, chimichangas, enchiladas, tostadas, fresh guacamole and many more favorites. Each family generational recipe is crafted from scratch and served from el corazón.  Enjoy live music Tuesday and Friday nights.

Title: Kauai Museum
Content: The Kaua‘i Museum develops and preserves outstanding collections which reflect the heritage and artistic achievements of the indigenous and immigrant peoples of Kaua‘i and Ni‘ihau. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to learn the rich, fascinating, and controversial history of the Kingdom of Hawaiʻi’s royal families. “King Kaumualiʻi is the star here,” says Director Chucky Boy Chock. “He is the biggest difference between us and the other island museums.” For some context Chock explains, “Long before the small group of non-native Hawaiians plotted the overthrow of Queen Liliʻuokalani in 1893, which set in motion the annexation of the Hawaiian Kingdom in 1898, there was Kauaʻi’s fight for independence in the early 1800’s. Our amazing team of volunteers walk our guests through the preserved artifacts from the infamous ship Haʻahei o Hawaiʻi, the luxury vessel King Kamehameha II used to capture King Kamualiʻi near two centuries later and have donated most of the rare discoveries to the museum.” Their fascinating Exhibits, Publications, Educational Programs and Archival artifacts tell beautiful stories of Kaua‘i and Ni‘ihau Islands rich history!

Title: Emperor’s Emporium
Content: Emperor’s Emporium located in Old Koloa Town is a one-stop shop for souvenirs and gifts. Find a beautiful selection of gold and silver jewelry as well as shark-teeth necklaces. Take home a stunning piece of Hawai‘i with you. You're sure to find something to treasure.
Image Alt Text: Emperor's Emporium - Gifts and Souvenirs - Kauai

Title: Destination Hilo
Content: Destination Hilo is your resource for all things East Hawaii, offering exclusive tips on lodging, restaurants, tours, attractions, and much more. This non-profit is dedicated to promoting sustainable, responsible tourism while perpetuating authentic Hawaiian culture for visitors and locals alike. Through its innovative "Hawaiian Greetings Program," you'll have the opportunity to enjoy music, entertainment and aloha on ship days at the pier and on Tuesdays at the Hilo Bandstand. For insider tips, discounts and more, visit their website.

Title: Blue Ocean Breeze Surf School
Content:
You’re on a beach in Hawai‘i surrounded by the shimmering blue Pacific Ocean. Don’t sell yourself short—you could be one of those surfers riding in to shore on a wave, and Blue Ocean Breeze Surf School can teach you how. Surfing is for any body and every body—young, old, short, tall and in any shape. Knowledgeable instructors are trained to tailor lessons to each individual’s needs, providing you with the skills to feel confident and proficient in the water. Feel the joy of accomplishment as instructors share their passion for the sport and the ocean with you as you make your surfing dreams come true! If you’d prefer a private lesson, get 20 percent off the first one!

Surfing and stand up paddle board lessons are available. Reservations are suggested. Transportation is available for a fee or free on the East side. Discounts available too.

Title: Beauty Lux Salon
Content:
Enjoy a truly pampered experience at Beauty Lux Salon where the focus is on you! Receive an oil neck and scalp massage with your haircut or a delightful hand massage with color processing—now that’s special. Beauty pros bring out your inner beauty offering haircuts and color, hair styling, nail care services, waxing, lashes and massage services. They specialize in bridal hair and makeup service too. AVEDA Hair & Skin Care, AVEDA Makeup and Borboleta lash extensions available exclusively at Beauty Lux Salon. Online booking available. www.vagaro.com/beautyluxsalon

Their newest location is at the Hilton Waikoloa Village at 69-425 Waikoloa Beach Drive, Waikoloa HI 96738. (808) 854-0979. beautyluxsalonwaikoloa.com.

Title: Loko Wraps
Content: Fast and fresh are on the menu for lunch and dinner at Loko Wraps. Most of the ingredients for their wraps, burritos, tacos, sandwiches, salads, real fruit smoothies, freshly squeezed juices and local kombucha come from local farmers. Tease your palate with a slow-cooked, sweet and smoky Kalua Pork Wrap or Shoyu Chicken Wrap made with a secret tangy spiced marinade. Vegan and gluten-free options are available. Best of all, prices are really reasonable.   Also located at 75-5595 Palani Rd, Kailua-Kona next to Sak n Save

Title: Hawaiian Horizons Fishing
Content: Explore Hawaiʻi’s diverse underwater world with Hawaiian Horizons, Oʻahu’s premier sport and leisure fishing charter boat service. Located just minutes from Waikīkī, Hawaiian Horizons boasts over 20 years of experience sailing in Hawaiian waters on big game fishing adventures and other memorable aquatic experiences. Climb aboard and troll for big game fish like Mahi-Mahi, Marlin, Tuna and Ono or opt for the Midnight “Shark” Hunt, perfect for the thrillseeker looking to spot seven different varieties of these ocean predators. Close out your evening with an unforgettable Sunset Dinner Cruise. Embark on fun-filled ocean adventures and experience aloha with Hawaiian Horizons.

Title: Paradise Tattoo
Content: Ditch the traditional Hawaiʻi souvenir and opt for a permanent reminder of your time on Maui with Paradise Tattoo. Offering hundreds of designs from which to choose, Paradise Tattoo’s three talented artists can also create a unique, custom design to commemorate your Maui vacation. Located on the bustling south shore of Maui across from Kamaole Beach Park, Paradise Tattoo’s shop is clean and family friendly.

Title: Lahaina Gateway Center
Content: Experience shopping local at Lahaina Gateway Center, West Maui's premier open air shopping center just blocks away from Front Street. Shop the latest fashions at Local Motion or Mahina Boutique. Grab a delicious and healthy bite to eat at Moku Roots, or satisfy your comfort food cravings at Teddy's Bigger Burgers. Plus enjoy a variety of other services, shops and eateries! Explore Lahaina Gateway today!  The Maui Gift & Craft Fair takes place every Sunday from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m., and live music is offered every second Sunday of the month from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. during the craft fair.

Title: Lucky Owl Car Rental
Content: Enjoy discounted prices on over 120 vehicles with Lucky Owl Car Rental. Perfect for customers looking for the ultimate Hawaiʻi experience, Lucky Owl offers used compact, mid-size and full-size rental cars that blend in with the local environment. Located on Mapunapuna St. just five minutes from the airport, catch the free shuttle to or from the airport or Waikiki. Debit and credit cards and cash accepted for reservations; walk-ins welcome.

Title: Jai Dee Thai Massage
Content: Pamper yourself with a relaxing massage in a tranquil environment at Jai Dee Thai Massage. Known for its affordable couples packages and ongoing discounts, Jai Dee Thai Massage offers therapeutic massage treatments that involve stretching and deep tissue massage to leave you feeling refreshed and at peace. Enjoy hot or iced tea and tasty treats following your massage.

Title: Island Seaplane  Service
Content: With over 50 years of experience in seaplane activity and more than 30,000 hours of accident-free flying, Island Seaplane Service is Hawaiʻi’s only seaplane operation with a rich history of engaging and entertaining guests. From the thrilling takeoff and landing on Keʻehi Lagoon to the picturesque views of Oʻahu’s majestic landscape, flying with Island Seaplane Service is an exciting opportunity to observe the island from a different view. In addition to four popular packages, Island Seaplane Service also caters to chartered groups looking to enjoy a memorable day at and above sea. Complimentary van service is also offered to and from Waikiki hotels. With Island Seaplane Service, everyone enjoys a window seat!

Title: Cafe Glace
Content: Located along the bustling Waikiki Beach Walk, Café Glacé is an intimate eatery offering delicious gelato, premium coffee, crepes and pastries. Made on site daily with locally sourced ingredients, Café Glacé gelato and sorbet are customer favorites—with 32 different flavors, it's hard to choose just one! Other signature offerings include organic acai and pitaya bowls, sweet and savory crepes, Illy brand coffee and traditional Italian pastries like napoleons, croissants and tarts.

Title: SHOR
Content: Located at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa, SHOR takes care of your mornings so you'll have time to explore Oʻahu with energy to spare. Find one of Waikīkī's largest buffets featuring hot and cold items made with locally grown ingredients. Chef Dale mans the made-to-order omelet station using only cage-free eggs. His Special Omelet is a popular item made with ham, kim chee, onion, spinach and jalapeño—it'll get your blood flowing! Get there before the crowd for the Early Bird Special available before 7 a.m. daily. Click the link below to reserve a table.

Title: Kokee Lodge
Content: Situated in the heart of Kōkeʻe State Park, Kōke‘e Lodge is a popular island destination for local classics with the most popular being the Portuguese Bean Soup with their Famous Kokeʻe Lodge Cornbread, Makaweli Beef Hamburgers and Chocolate Coconut Pie, as well as a selection of breakfast, sandwiches and salads. The Café is a gathering place for visitors and locals alike, serving up island-style comfort food in a setting filled with aloha. Also stop by the store for a memento—logo apparel, unique tees and an array of made-in-Hawai‘i products.

Title: The Cabana Bar & Grill
Content:
Located in the Poipu Beach Athletic Club, The Cabana Bar & Grill serves up delicious and nutritious menu items in a casual setting. Open to everyone, The Cabana welcomes workout gurus after breaking a sweat, gym members at the end of a long day or visitors simply looking for a great place to eat. The Cabana is known for its daily 4-6 p.m. Happy Hour featuring beverage specials and discounts on all pūpū. Specialties include the Cabana Burger, Seared Ahi Tacos and the signature Poipu Tiki, a frozen Piña Colada blended with the tropical fruit purée of the day.

Celebrate Aloha Friday at The Cabana Bar & Grill, located on-site at Poipu Beach Athletic Club. Every Friday, enjoy Happy Hour specials on food and drinks and beautiful island-style tunes by Kauaʻi recording artist Wayne Kealohi Powell from 4-6 p.m., starting May 4. Don't leave without sampling the Fish Tacos, The Cabana's #1 best-seller!

Title: Snorkel Tours Hawaii
Content:
Hanauma Bay is a popular snorkeling destination on Oʻahu, and one of the best ways to enjoy the underwater experience is with Snorkel Tours Hawaii! For over 17 years, Snorkel Tours Hawaii has lead memorable snorkeling tours of Hanauma Bay, providing you with everything you need to enjoy your time in Hawaiʻi’s waters. Snorkel Tours Hawaii offers roundtrip transportation from your hotel, a guided coastline tour and snorkeling equipment, including snorkel, mask, fins and instruction. Also available at an additional cost are corrective lenses, flotation devices, underwater cameras and dry snorkel. Cost is $19.95 per person.

Pick-up Times:
7:10 a.m. / 8:40 a.m. / 10:10 a.m. / 11:45 a.m. / 1:15 p.m.

Return Times:
11:00 a.m. / 12:20 p.m. / 2:00 p.m. / 3:15 p.m. / 4:30 p.m.

Title: Kailani Tours Hawaii
Content:
Experience the beauty of the Big Island with Kailani Tours Hawaii. Operating exclusive, road-based tours to Kilauea Volcanoes National Park, Kailani Tours Hawaii delivers the ultimate Big Island experience, committed to its three tenants of better vehicles, better food and better service. By utilizing Mercedes Sprinter mini coaches, partnering with outstanding food vendors and offering the best guides, Kailani Tours Hawaii works to ensure every guest leaves feeling the true aloha spirit. Choose between the “Deluxe Volcano Experience” and the “Grand Volcano Experience.”

​ 

Book A Kailani Tours Big Island Tour Today!

Big Island Circle Tour

Tour Big Islands coffee country, visits the world-famous Punalu’u Black Sand Beach, and explores all the beauty of Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Rainbow Falls, and Waipio Valley.

11 Hrs.

5 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Coffee, Cloud Forest & Brewery Experience - Waikoloa & Kohala Hotels

This luxury tour is the perfect way to learn Hawaiian history, sip Kona coffee, explore an exotic cloud forest and discover Kona’s tastiest beer.

6 Hrs.

5 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Deluxe Volcano Experience

Cruise along the scenic Kona coastline on your way to Hawaii’s most active volcano – Kilauea!

11 Hrs.

5 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Volcano Hiking Adventure

Join us on our most exploratory volcano adventure. Journey over Saddle Road, take a short walk up a cinder cone before dropping down Kaumana Caves in Hilo.

11 Hrs.

8 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Wild & Scenic Volcano Experience

Cruise along the wild and scenic Hamakua coastline on your way to see Akaka Falls, Onomea Bay, and Kilauea Volcano!

11 Hrs.

5 Yrs. +

DETAILS

Title: Fun Virtual Hawaii
Content:
With Fun Virtual Hawaii, experience the beauty of Hawaiʻi any day, any time, anywhere! Fun Virtual Hawaii is a 35-minute virtual video easily streamed on your tablet, computer or phone. Experience a powerful lava flow under a full moon, snorkel and learn the names of Hawaiian reef fish, make a splash with spinner dolphins and more. Plus get the Bonus Directors Edition and enjoy one hour and 24 more minutes of extraordinary adventures. 

Rebecca Melendez, the creator of Fun Virtual Hawaii, has lived on the Big Island on and off for over 20 years. As a captain and divemaster, she's gotten up close and personal with dolphins, whales, manta rays, sharks—and now you can too. Rebecca has made it easy for you to relive your time in paradise! Gone are the days of vacation endings—now you can take your Hawaiian vacation home with you. Order your two Fun Virtual Hawaii videos today!

Title: Urinda Movies
Content: Get ready to feel like a movie star with Urinda Movies when you make a cameo appearance in the feature-length movie, Project Z. Urinda Movies produces customized versions of the film featuring you and three friends or family members. After filming in Waikoloa, you’ll receive the finished product on a flash drive—the perfect way to relive your Hawai‘i vacation again and again! Reservations required; same-day service may be available.

Title: Hawaiian Legacy Tours
Content: Hawaiian Legacy Tours, based in Hilo, offers both helicopter tours, as well as ATV tree planting tours throughout the Island of Hawai‘i. Soar above Kīlauea volcano, the plunging Wai‘ānuenue and other natural wonders, or plant your own King Koa Legacy Tree along the slopes of Mauna Kea. In fact, some of the Merrie Monarch flowers and ferns were originally planted during a Planters Tour!

Title: The Buffet at Hyatt
Content: With a focus on fresh ingredients, sustainability and organic menu options, The Buffet at Hyatt is perfect for visitors with hearty appetites. Specialties include Kiawe Smoked ʻAlaea Salt Crusted Prime Rib, Island Fresh Poke Station, Southern King Crab Legs and the long-time favorite Coconut Crème Brûlée. Don’t leave without stopping at the interactive Soft Serve station, where you can create your own soft serve using a digital screen!

Title: Longs Drug Stores
Content: Dedicated to putting its customers on the path to better health, Longs Drugs Stores offers a variety of merchandise for shoppers around Hawaiʻi. Products and services include grocery, beauty and health, pharmacy services, photo and electronics, as well as various local and national brands. Specialty items sold exclusively at Longs Drugs Stores include CVS Health and Hawaiian Tradition brands. Don’t leave without purchasing a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts—Longs Drugs Stores’ #1 selling item!
