Title: No Ka Oi Oahu Private Island Tours
Content: For nearly 20 years, No Ka Oi Oahu Private Island Tours has remained committed to its mission to share the true meaning of aloha with Hawaiʻi’s visitors. Offering fully customizable Private Island Tours, Private Car Service and Airport Transfers, No Ka Oi Oahu is your go-to resource for experiencing authentic Hawaiian culture and the breathtaking sights of Oʻahu. Personalize your tour with stops at Oʻahu’s most popular attractions including Sunset Beach, Makapuʻu Lookout, Haleʻiwa Town and more! Whether you’re looking to circle the island or simply head back to the airport, No Ka Oi Oahu has got you covered. Reservations required.

Title: Manu Antiques
Content: Manu Antiques is a collector’s heaven, offering a wide selection of authentic Hawaiian antiques, artwork, photography and more. Located in Downtown Honolulu, the gallery features one of the most extensive privately held collections of Hawaiian and Polynesian artifacts. Whether you’re a first-time visitor looking to commemorate your trip with unique souvenirs or a serious collector searching for rare artifacts, you’re sure to find hidden gems embodying the beauty of Hawaiʻi. You can also browse through featured collections online.

Title: Kai Coffee Hawaii
Content: Dedicated to providing “Aloha in Every Cup”®, Kai Coffee Hawaii is a coffee lover’s paradise in the heart of Waikīkī. Brewing each shot and pouring every drink by hand and heart, Kai Coffee Hawaii works to ensure guests enjoy fantastic experiences and truly feel the aloha spirit. Don’t leave without sampling the signature Kai Latte, an island-inspired concoction featuring macadamia nut flavor, espresso, milk and whipped cream! Other favorites include Avo Toast and a delicious assortment of sandwiches

Title: Hawaiian Hurricane Company
Content: Popping up one of Hawaiʻi’s favorite munchies, Hawaiian Hurricane Company specializes in exotic and delicious popcorn flavors that embody Hawaiʻi’s unique cultural melting pot. What began as a popcorn pushcart business in Kāneʻohe has grown into a wildly successful snack brand offering ready-to-eat bagged popcorn snacks, creative toppings and an extensive microwave popcorn line. Popular flavors include Kim Chee Hurricane, Hawaiian Typhoon (Sour Cream & Nori), Hawaiian Red & Green and Li Hing Hurricane. Of course, you can’t go wrong with its best-selling flavor: The Original Hawaiian Hurricane Microwave Popcorn! Look for Hawaiian Hurricane Company popcorn at 7-11, ABC Stores, Costco, Foodland, Longs Drugs, NEX, Safeway, Sam’s Club, Walgreens, Walmart and other major supermarkets.

Title: Crispy Grindz
Content: Sample a taste of Brazil in Hawaiʻi at Crispy Grindz. Located on Oʻahu’s beautiful North Shore, this trendy food truck serves up tasty Brazilian fare including Pastel (wonton wrap), Coxinha (chicken balls) and Brigadeiro (dessert). Crispy Grindz is also known for its fresh fruit smoothies and organic acai bowls, made with 100 percent acai and no juices or frozen fruits. Before you leave, treat yourself to the refreshing Guaraná Soda, imported from Brazil! Find Crispy Grindz’s two locations at Pipeline Beach across from Sunset Beach Elementary School and in Haleʻiwa Town.

Title: Ali‘i Agriculture Farm
Content: Make lasting memories on a recreational fishing adventure with Ali‘i Agriculture Farm! As the only fishing farm on Oʻahu, Aliʻi Agriculture Farms offers visitors and locals the chance to catch tilapia, catfish and prawns in a breathtaking setting. At the close of your fishing voyage, visit the food truck and sample your catch for lunch! Bring sunscreen, a hat and a chair to this organic fishing farm and enjoy a memorable outdoor excursion with family and friends.

Title: Mike's Huli Chicken
Content:
A unique isle tradition, huli huli chicken was a staple while growing up, mainly as a fundraiser for organizations. For Mike Fuse, owner of Mike’s Huli Chicken located at Kahuku Sugar Mill, huli huli chicken has always had a special place.

“Growing up in Hale‘iwa,” says Fuse, “I was always in the water surfing or at community events, and we would always eat huli huli chicken because it was so good and everyone loved it. Huli Huli means "turn, turn." I started Mike’s Huli Chicken in 2010 with the main focus of making sure customers from all over the world leave our restaurant feeling satisfied, and that they’ve tasted some of the best huli chicken Hawaiʻi has to offer.”

The food truck was featured on Food Network’s “Diners, Drive Ins and Dives” and that’s when business really skyrocketed. But it takes more than a TV show to bring in the customers and keep them returning time and again.

“Our variation of huli chicken is unique because we use different spices with Hawaiian rock salt and cook it over kiawe wood for everyone to see,” says Fuse. In fact, Fuse created his own special dipping sauce that can be used on everything, says his wife, Debbie. It’s just that good. Debbie’s favorite menu item is the Chicken/Kalua Pig Combo; Mike’s is the Steak & Garlic Shrimp. To savor the true essence of Mike’s Huli Chicken, Debbie suggests the Chicken & Garlic Shrimp.

“People always ask me what makes my food truck unique,” says Mike, “and I always say it’s the feeling of aloha that we create for our customers. I’m constantly working on new projects to improve our customers’ experience.”

Second Location at: Radford High School Parking Lot, Saturday & Sundays Only from 10:30 am - 2:30 pm (Chicken Only)

Title: Pleasant Holidays
Content: Trust the experts at Pleasant Holidays to take your Hawaiʻi vacation to the next level with exclusive packages, flights, hotels, car rentals and more. With a reputation as one of the largest tour operators in the U.S., Pleasant Holidays is committed to working with its customers to plan a Big Island getaway that fits all needs and budgets.

Title: Haleakala EcoTours
Content: Experience the summit of Haleakala, breathe in the cool, refreshing Hawaiian tradewinds and gaze out at the incredible island landscapes. On your tour back down the mountain, you'll explore Upcountry Maui with stops in the beautiful farming area of Kula, historic Makawao, lively Paia and quaint Haiku. Private luxury van tours available and include Haleakala National Park entrance fees.

Title: Bike Maui
Content:
Haleakalā Bike Company, Inc. dba Bike Maui and Haleakalā EcoTours is dedicated to the education of Maui visitors and residents through quality interpretative tour services that respects the native Hawaiian culture and protects the natural resources of Haleakalā.   We seek to share the Aloha Spirit with our guests as we welcome them to the place we are privileged to call home, Maui.

Explore the epic volcanic landscapes of Haleakala National Park with guided or self-guided bike tours. Begin your experience with a guided van trek up to the 10,023 ft. summit, then cruise down 23 miles of uninterrupted whoo-hoo! on top-of-the-line Kona bikes.

Book A Bike Maui Tour Today!

Haleakala Guided Sunrise Bike Tour

Tour of Haleakala National Park and GUIDED bike ride down Haleakala. Tour and transportation up to the summit of Haleakala, watch sunrise at summit, and view the crater.

8 Hrs.

12 Yrs. Older

DETAILS

Title: Aʻu Struck Sportfishing
Content: If you’re in the mood for a sportfishing adventure, look no further than Aʻu Struck Sportfishing! Offering a highly rated, personalized fishing experience, Aʻu Struck Sportfishing Charters is a great fit for families and travelers on a budget. Onboard you’ll pursue many of the game fishes found off the Big Island’s west coast, including Mahi-mahi, Ono, Yellowfin Tuna and Pacific Blue Marlin. Keep your eyes peeled while cruising through Hawaiʻi waters—you may even spot dolphins or whales (in season)!

Title: TJ’s Pau Hana Hale
Content: Searching for your new favorite pau hana joint? Look no further than TJ’s Pau Hana Hale! At TJ’s, you’ll find a variety of cocktails, wine and beer, as well as delicious quick bites to satisfy your hunger. Sample one of the popular beers on tap, including Sierra Nevada, Primo and Maui Brewing Company Bikini Blonde. Whether you’re stopping by after work or planning a weekend gathering, TJ’s Pau Hana Hale is the place to be.

Title: San Francisco Bay Gourmet Coffee
Content: Roasting up 100 percent Kona Coffee from its Māmalahoa Estate farm, San Francisco Bay Gourmet Coffee also offers Acai and Pitaya Bowls, pastries baked fresh in Waimea and ice cream made locally from Tropical Dreams. Pull up a chair in the coffee bar’s friendly and relaxed environment while you enjoy your beverage or sweet treat. Don’t leave without sampling one of the Single Origin Coffee Pour Overs!

Title: Kanaloa Octopus Farm
Content:
If you're looking for a unique and interesting experience while in Hawaii, be sure to visit the Kanaloa Octopus Farm. This farm is the only one of its kind in the state, and it offers visitors a chance to learn about octopuses and see them up close. Read on to learn more about this truly unique Big Island destination.

What Is The Kanaloa Octopus Farm

The Kanaloa Octopus Farm is a conservation-minded research facility that is studying the best way to raise the day Octopus (O. cyanea) from the paralarva stage to adulthood. They are a unique aquaculture facility located in the State's Hawaii Ocean Science and Technology Park's research campus at Keahole Point.. Their headquarters are a 4,000-square-foot lab facility found in the State's Hawaii Ocean Science and Technology Park's research campus.

The Kanaloa Octopus Farm Research

Marine aquaculture is extremely important, with a main goal being to decrease the number of resources we extract from the natural environment and marine ecosystems. The challenge is that we don't know how to raise many important marine creatures in human care to do so. Octopuses have a very delicate larval phase, and their optimal environmental and feeding habits have eluded scientists for a long time. The Kanaloa Octopus Farm is focused on completing the life cycle of these delicate animals and the research surrounding it. Some of these research opportunities include pathology, water quality, environmental system designs, and much more.

Conservation Efforts

The focus of these conservation efforts is extremely important to preserve the lives of octopuses and other cephalopods and to maintain their natural environments.
  • Producing and creating technologies used for aquaculture with octopuses and other cephalopods. It is one of the fastest growing industries right now and is a cornerstone of fighting climate change and preserving Earth's natural ecosystems.
  • Sharing octopus populations with other zoos and aquariums, which helps to preserve the wild octopus and cephalopod population.
  • Providing research and learning opportunities to labs and researchers around the world.
  • Working towards releasing these octopuses back into ecosystems that have been damaged by overfishing and other human activity.

NELHA

The Kanaloa Octopus farm is administered by NELHA, the Natural Energy Lab of Hawaii Authority: a State of Hawaii agency. They are committed to providing resources and facilities for energy, ocean-related research, and other environmental causes.

Tour the Kanaloa Octopus Farm

To tour the facilities, you do need to make a booking in advance. They offer 3 public tours that are available daily and last around one hour. Learn about their facilities, the research they are doing, and feed & interact with the octopuses! If this is something you are interested in we recommend booking at least a week in advance. It is a popular attraction and tours fill up quickly. Enjoy your time at Kanaloa Octopus Farm, and learn more about the stunning marine life of our oceans!

Useful Information For Your Visit:

  • The facility is outdoors
  • Reservations are required
  • Closed on New Year's Day, July 4th, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day
  • Cancellations must be made 48 hours in advance for a refund
  • If you are interested in contributing to the Kanaloa Octopus Farm, you can donate on their website.
  • They do not sell octopus as a food source
  • The facility is not best setup for wheelchairs or walkers. It is possible, but will be a challenge

Title: Bamboo Island Bath & Body
Content: Trust Bamboo Island Bath & Body for your uniquely Hawaiian bath and body needs! Browse a variety of Bath Bomb Fizzies and body butters in tempting, tropical scents. Other Hawaiʻi-made products include women’s dresses and men’s aloha shirts. Bamboo Island Bath & Body also carries 100 percent natural and organic products. Take part of Kauaʻi home with you when you shop Bamboo Island Bath & Body’s quality products.

Title: Na Pali Exclusive Charters
Content: Explore the beauty of the Garden Isle’s Nāpali Coast with the experts at Nā Pali Exclusive Charters. Embark on an underwater adventure you’ll never forget as you enjoy up-close encounters with dolphins, Hawaiian sea turtles and whales (seasonal). You’ll even have the chance to travel under waterfalls and into sea caves when conditions permit! You could also opt for a Shared Tour, Private Tour or Sunset Cruise option.

Title: BioAstin (Ironman)
Content: BioAstin and Pure Hawaiian Spirulina are both made in Kona from farm to bottle, and used to benefit overall health. Bioastin, used by everyone from pro triathletes to power walkers, is great for joint and tendon health, and quick muscle recovery—especially after undertaking the 140.6-mile Ironman® World Championship! Pure Hawaiian Spirulina is your all-natural multi-vitamin; one serving equals five servings of fruits and veggies. Items are available at fine retailers around the island.

Title: Diamond Parking Service
Content:
Trust Diamond Parking Service for your parking needs during your time in paradise! Diamond Parking Service manages facilities around Kailua-Kona and Hilo for your convenience when you’re ready to park your vehicle and explore the neighborhood or attend awe-inspiring events such as the Ironman®!

Title: The Vanillerie
Content: Taste, tour and treasure the vanilla grown by the experts at The Vanillerie. Operating a small vanilla farm on the west side of the Big Island, The Vanillerie offers guided farm tours for guests eager to enjoy a unique, unexpected and vanilla-infused experience. Learn about the fascinating history of the beautiful vanilla orchid, observe the vanilla growing in abundance and sample food and body products that will delight your senses. Groups of all sizes welcome.

Title: IMauiNation
Content:
When in Maui, shop IMauiNation—The Name Station! Situated on Front Street, this specialty store is stocked with fun Maui apparel and gifts. Custom name bracelets are their specialty—if you don’t find your name, they’ll make one for you!
Browse a variety of retail products for all ages, including bracelets, custom keychains, necklaces, keychains, sunglasses, hats, swimwear, ponchos and more.

Title: Maui Plane Rides
Content: Strap on your seatbelts and get ready for an aerial experience unlike any other with Maui Plane Rides! Treat yourself to a comfortable, private cabin and enjoy panoramic window seats aboard one of Maui Plane Ride’s exciting air tours. Choose from a variety of tour packages and flight lesson options, all of which feature stunning views of the Valley Isle. When flying with Maui Plane Rides, expect to be amazed!

Title: Basalt
Content: Basalt is a contemporary and refined, yet casual and friendly restaurant located inside Dukes Lane Market & Eatery features internationally and seasonally inspired cuisine created by Chef Keith Kong. A look at the menu offerings provide a perfect selection of appetizers and main course dishes, as well as daily specials from morning to night. Happy Hour features craft cocktails, beer and wine. Also stop by to enjoy live music 6-9 p.m. daily.

Title: Ka Moana Luau
Content:
Literally translating to “the ocean,” Ka Moana is part of Ka Moana Lū‘au, situated at Sea Life Park, overlooking the turquoise waters of the Pacific Ocean. Best of all, lū‘au guests get to enjoy two experiences for the price of one!

“Every lū‘au ticket includes admission to Sea Life Park,” says Dean Calibraro, Ka Moana Lū‘au’s vice president of sales and marketing, “and guests have the option to either start their day with Sea Life Park and cap their night with Ka Moana Lū‘au…or attend the lū‘au, and have up to seven days to return to the park with their admission.” He talks about the park’s incredible shows, exhibits and educational experiences such as the touch pool, which guests of all ages enjoy.

At the lū‘au, everyone has the opportunity to participate in cultural activities such as lei making, ‘ukulele lessons, hula lessons, coconut weaving, and even get a temporary tattoo to commemorate the night.

What makes Ka Moana Lū‘au special? “Easily, the people,” states Calibraro, matter of factly. “I could tell you it’s our world-class production company or the second-to-none venue, both worthy of recognition. But the people set us apart from any other activity out there. From the moment you’re greeted and adorned with a lei, you know you’re in for an incredible evening where everyone has the single goal to go above and beyond to make this lū‘au experience the best part of your vacation!

“I feel that each guest will have a unique experience and different aspects will stand out,” shares Calibraro when asked how he hopes each guest will experience the lū‘au. “For some, it’s the traditional kahiko hula that opens the show with the fire that stands out. For others it’s the ability to interact with the entertainers.”

He says he smiles when seeing parents get teary-eyed as their child is invited onstage to perform the hula. It’s that kind of joy experienced by visitors while on vacation that makes him happy.

“All of us at Ka Moana Lū‘au are fortunate to be able to share the aloha with our guests, wherever they’re from,” says Calibraro. “Their smiles, joy and comments make what we do so fulfilling. They keep us striving to improve the experience and strengthen our connection with them.”

Title: Walmart
Content:
There’s something to be said for convenience and Walmart offers most everything you might want while on vacation. From daily necessities to gifts and accessories, they’ve got it—beach accessories, check! Rubber slippers for cruising, check! Snacks and groceries, check! Island gifts and edibles such as coffee and macadamia nuts for family and friends, check! Souvenirs for the keiki, final check! And if you want to add to your aloha apparel, you’ll find aloha shirts and casual dresses too. Walmart is a one-stop shop for your everyday essentials at “Every Day Low Prices.”

Other locations: 1032 Fort Street Mall, Honolulu; Pearl City; Kapolei; Waipahu; Mililani

Title: My Go Kids
Content:
Kids, ages 3 to 11, get to have all the fun in a stimulating environment with experienced educators and programs at MyGoKids. Offering innovative hourly child care, mom and dad won’t be missed a minute with tons of fun and educational activities designed to challenge kids mentally, physically and socially.

The 3,000-square-foot space features an indoor playground, toddler play area, rock climbing wall, virtual surf room, homework area, imagination station, gym/basketball court and a multi-purpose room for crafts, music and more. Off-site adventures will also be available. 

(street level near The Vitamin Shoppe where Sears was once located)

Title: Botanical World Adventures
Content:
“If your traveling party has different ideas of fun, then Botanical World Adventures is the perfect destination,” says owner Mark Robinson. “BWA,” as it’s known, opened in 1995 as a botanical garden. There are thousands plant species and two of the most pristine waterfalls in the State. For the thrill seekers in the group, the Zip Isle Zipline Adventure was added in 2009 and gives guests a birds eye view of the garden.

For those looking for a relaxed tour of the gardens, BWA offers a Segway Tour option. “In May, we added a Jungle Falls Bike Experience,” adds Robinson. “We are particularly attractive to the large, multi-generational groups who come to the Big Island. We built out our park to appeal to everyone who visits by providing such diverse activities.”

Title: Star Beachboys
Content: Star Beachboys is the 2nd oldest beach boy operation in Waikiki, offering up surf lessons, canoe rides and beach rentals to visitors. Our licensed beach boys have spent years honing their talents so they can provide you with an old-style experience just like Waikīkī visitors of yesteryear. Why settle for typical surf instructors when you can be taught by a real beach boy? “Come experience Aloha!”

Title: Punaluu Bake Shop
Content:
Breathe deep and the delicious scent of freshly baked goodies will lead you to Punalu‘u Bake Shop. As America’s “Southernmost Bake Shop” located in rural Kaʻū, this oasis is a popular landmark for visitors and residents on the way to Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park.

“It’s a nice rest stop where people can see our sweetbread and cookie bakery operations,” says General Manager Connie Koi, a 27-year veteran of the bakery. “My favorites are the lilikoi-glazed malasada and traditional sweetbread loaf.”

She says the malasada are the most popular item. “Our guests rave about them,” says Koi. “You should see their faces light up when they see our pastry cases. They simply can’t decide which one to buy, so they end up buying a box full of them. We have a variety of them such as the lilikoi-glazed, traditional taro, mango or guava sugared, apple, strawberry, haupia (coconut cream), guava, pineapple or mango filled, vanilla or chocolate filled, and our rendition of the Boston Cream Pie we call the Bismark—vanilla cream filled topped with a delicious chocolate icing.”

Opening its doors in January 1991, Punalu‘u Bake Shop was the brainchild of former mayor Mufi Hanneman, who was the CEO of former owner C. Brewer & Co. at the time. He wanted to create jobs for people living in the area.

“I love the environment of being out in the country and working in such a beautiful setting that is close to home,” says Koi.

In addition to savoring the baked treats, visitors can also stop by the gift shop and pick up islandmade gifts, crafts and souvenirs such as postcards, coasters, t-shirts, ball caps and more.

Title: Aloha Vista Bar & Grill
Content:
Located on the grounds of the Kona Country Club, Aloha Vista Bar & Grill is an Italian and American restaurant featuring recipes with the authentic flavors of Italy, prepared with both passion and aloha by Chef Saffoti, who hails from Genoa, Italy. The majestic view of Keauhou Bay compliments the beauty of the dishes, including their housemade bread, pesto sauce and tiramisu.

Hours: Breakfast 8AM-11AM Daily Lunch 11AM-2PM Mon-Fri, 10:30AM-3PM Sat-Sun Happy Hour 2PM-5PM Tues-Fri, 3PM-5PM Sat-Sun Dinner 5PM-8:30PM Tues-Sun

Title: Chill’n on the Bay
Content: Start with a chill, open air bar on the water, add great food, great prices and great staff, and you’ll understand why Chill’n on the Bay has “the best vibe in Hawai‘i.” Try their signature Lava Flow or Mick’s Mai Tai, or taste the Chill’n Fish & Chips, and learn for yourself why people can’t get enough of this place.

Title: Mi’s Waterfront Bistro
Content: Whether you come for their authentic and delicious, freshly made pasta, the beautiful ocean view, or attentive service, you won’t be able to get enough of Mi’s Waterfront Bistro. Signature dishes such as Mi's Fresh Lasagna or Mi's Signature Tiramisu for dessert are crafted with care using only the freshest ingredients. Other menu favorites are the Fresh Catch with Risotto and Herb & Cheese Ravioli with blue cheese cream sauce, but one look at their menu and you won't be able to decide on your personal favorite!

Title: Tony Romaʻs
Content:
With a history that dates back more than 40 years, Tony Roma’s clearly holds the title for everybody’s favorite ribs. Their focus then were the baby back ribs, and it’s still the most popular, according to Ryo Shibazaki, manager of Tony Roma’s Waikiki. 

“People love our ribs,” says Shibazaki when asked about Tony Roma’s solid customer base. “They keep coming back from all over the world to enjoy the world-famous ribs. We have the best ribs in the world!”

Step into Tony Roma’s and you’re in for a comfortable, casual dining experience with a menu that has all the items you’d typically find—starters, soups, salads, burgers and sandwiches, steak, seafood, chicken, desserts. But in a category all its own are the “World-Famous Ribs,” the “stuff that legends are made of.” 

Shibazaki’s personal favorite? The Baby Back Ribs and Filet Medallion combo with mashed potato. “I love this combination,” he says. “It comes with not only our famous ribs, but also filet medallion steak topped with house-made cabernet demi-glace sauce. I always choose the mash potatoes that our chef cooks every morning for my side.”

For a well-rounded Tony Roma’s dining experience, Shibazaki suggests the Star-Studded Sampler. “This is a combination of different ribs,” he explains. “Guests can enjoy the different kinds of ribs we have and find their favorite one.” For good measure, he includes the signature Agave Nectar Romarita, their most popular Tequila-based cocktail that comes in different flavors.

Tony Roma’s also has a kid’s menu, so bring the family!

Happy Hour 11 a.m.-3 p.m. daily.

Title: Rocky Japanese Steak Teppan Restaurant
Content: “Why just have a meal when you can have a memory?” Visitors from around the world visit Rocky Japanese Steak Teppanyaki Restaurant to experience world-class chefs perform the art of “eatertainment”—a concept blending exceptional cuisine with the grandeur of showmanship. The cosmopolitan menu blends styles from Asia, the Americans and beyond—from their hand-rolled Yaki Sushi to New York cut steak and filet mignon dinners, to their signature cocktail, the Ninjatini—astounding diners with a truly international teppanyaki experience.

Title: Fatt Chick Burgers
Content: Carnivores and vegans alike can’t get enough of Fatt Chicks Burgers! Enjoy our one of a kind gourmet burgers and sandwiches, signature all beef hot dogs, plate lunches and fresh salads.And you can’t go wrong with the Original Korean Burger! Whether you’re a local or a visitor, our friendly service and local comfort food selections will make you feel like you’re part of the ‘ohana.

Title: Maui Skydiving
Content: For a one of a kind adventure with views that will take your breath away, you’ll want to check out Maui Skydiving. Soar over the beautiful Hana coast and take in the scenic landscape. Then make a tandem parachute jump with an experienced, certified professional who has your care and safety in mind. Be sure to take advantage of their shuttle service to and from your hotel! Title: Maui Gift & Craft Fair
Content: Every Sunday is Funday in Lahaina at the Maui Gift & Craft Fair, one of Maui’s largest craft shows. The fair features over 50 local vendors offering jewelry, fine art, crafts and more. Located in the Lahaina Gateway, with ample parking and free admission, the Maui Gift & Craft Fair is your convenient one-stop-shop to find keepsakes for yourself and your loved ones back home.

Title: Ohana Transit
Content: This locally owned and operated shuttle service and its team of professionals guarantee a comfortable, convenient and hassle-free transportation experience. They’ll pick you up and drop you off directly anywhere in Waikīkī to/from the airport, plus features transport to Waikele Premium Outlets and Aloha Stadium. The eight-hour Private Island Tour takes guests around the island accompanied by a knowledgeable driver with guaranteed stops that include Diamond Head, Halona Blowhole, Makapu‘u Lookout, Macadamia Nut and Coffee Farm, Hale‘iwa Town and Dole Plantation.

Title: Ohana Hale Marketplace
Content: Think of Ohana Hale Marketplace as a permanent Hawai‘i Expo featuring truly one-of-a-kind shops and eateries in a free-flowing, air-conditioned environment. The more than 200 businesses are unique to Hawai‘i and to the marketplace since this is the only place you’ll find them! Discover isle apparel, jewelry, gifts, food, beverages and more, plus onsite spa services and live local musicians. Hop on the shuttle from Waikīkī, 9:45 a.m.–7:45 p.m.

Title: Flour & Barley
Content:
Sometimes, nothing satisfies the belly more than pizza and beer, and Flour & Barley does both in the most excellent way.

The buzz is all about their pizzas made with a local IPA—Waikiki Brewing Skinny Jeans—incorporated into the sourdough base that provides their signature texture and flavor. 

You must try the Aloha Pie made with Maui Golden pineapple, Spam®, bacon and Calabrian chilis or the Kahlua Pork Pizza that’s broke-da-mouth good made with slow roasted pork, jalapenos, cilantro, roasted tomato and sweet Thai chili sauce. For a non-pizza option, look no further than the Braised Short Ribs “Ossobucco,” fork tender short ribs served with polenta, wild mushrooms and Chianti demi glace. Pair it with their popular Mai Tai or a delicious craft beer—perfection!

Happy Hour calls for the signature Mai Tai, one of their most popular cocktails, with a modern spin incorporating grapefruit juice, pineapple, silver and dark rum, angostura and ogreat. Happy Hour is 2-6 p.m. daily, plus 10 p.m.-closing on weekends.

Title: Honolulu Cookie Company - Maui
Content:
Honolulu Cookie Company started in 1998 when entrepreneurs Keith and Janet Sung developed a recipe for premium shortbread cookies. As an artist, Keith wanted to develop something unique—a cookie that represented true Hawaiian hospitality. What he created was a line of island-inspired flavors in a signature pineapple shape. The recipe has been refined over the years, but dedication to quality ingredients inspired by the flavors of the islands haven’t wavered.

From their bakery, stores opened throughout Honolulu, particularly in Waikīkī, to ensure the hospitality that inspired the cookies was delivered to visitors from around the world. Eventually, new locations opened on Maui, in Las Vegas and in Guam.

Each progression is informed by a commitment to sharing the best experience of a Hawaiian vacation. The cookie collection packages are designed to delight and the stores are eager to share the Aloha Spirit, but it all begins with the cookies. The finest ingredients are selected to bake fresh daily and ship internationally to friends and fans around the world.

Title: Hiking Hawaii
Content:
Hiking Hawaii hosts custom hiking and sightseeing tours around Oahu. Our fun and professional guides get you to the trailheads stress free, give local insight and keep you safe all the way back to your door. Call us to arrange your group’s ideal hiking adventure based on wants and abilities. Hiking Hawaii is inside the Hiking Hawaii Café inside the Doubletree Hotel in Waikiki.

Title: Hiking Hawaii Café
Content:
Eat, drink and be healthy. Even though we’re conveniently located in the Doubletree Hotel in Waikiki, half of our customers are locals! Why? Because we cater to those looking for hearty meals to vegans with specific dietary needs. From sausage egg scrambles to quinoa burritos, it’s all DELICIOUS!  Smoothies, juices, coffee, pizza and paninis! Come check us out!

Title: Halia Tours
Content: You are going to love Your Private Tours of O`ahu with Hali`a Tours and Transportation!  We offer flat rate, group pricing for three different tour lengths, on a variety of routes.  All tours are 100% custom and 100% private.  Ditch the crowds and get a more intimate, personalized experience.  Hanauma Bay, Pearl Harbor, North Shore, Waimea Valley, and Dole Plantation are just some of the great highlights you can explore.  Mention HIWEEKLY or redeem online for a 15% discount. www.haliatours.com

Title: Kenai Koffee ---OLD
Content: John and Karen Zwolkoski  of Kenai Koffee offer 100 percent Kona coffee grown on the fertile slopes of Mauna Loa. Choose from medium roast, medium dark or the chocolate/mac nut flavor for a distinct cup of joe. They also offer meat rubs in three flavors. You’ll find “A Local Farm with Charm,” as well as two adorable resident doggos.

Title: Dukes Lane Market & Eatery
Content: You’ll appreciate Dukes Lane Market & Eatery, a bright and eclectic one-stop dining and shopping spot conveniently located in the middle of Waikīkī. Dining choices range from grab-and-go selections to fresh baked delights to the signature 150-seat Basalt restaurant. While here, you can also stock up on fresh grocery items, gourmet foods, and craft beers and local and international wines with gourmet coffee and frozen treats to go. Grab something for yourself and to take home!

Title: Maui Aloha Adventures
Content: Enjoy a custom-tailored adventure created just for you with Maui Aloha Adventures. Whether you want to experience the rich culture of the islands or take a beautiful hike off the beaten path or explore the grandeur of Hawaiʻi’s natural wonders, their passionate guides will show you a one of a kind adventure that you’ll cherish. Maui Aloha Adventures offer a range of tours for groups of any size, created with your interests and needs in mind.

Title: Azeka Shopping Center
Content: Azeka Shopping Center is your one-stop destination, right in the heart of Kihei. With over 50 shops, restaurants and services, you can get your banking done, visit your doctor, or shop for everything from flora to apparel to furniture and more. Dine on a variety of cuisines and enjoy an after-hours beverage while watching some live, local music. Conveniently located just minutes from the beach and resorts, with lots of parking—Azeka Shopping Center a true gem.

Title: Westside Bagel
Content: Westside Bagel does things the old-fashioned way, making fresh, organic bagels that are hand-rolled and boiled. Enjoy yours with a schmear of cream cheese, savor their classic bacon, egg and cheese bagel sandwich, or try one of their other tasty concoctions. Their lunch menu features a variety of delicious comfort foods and they even have a local coffee bar. Add in a cozy vibe, friendly service and ample parking and Westside Bagel just may become a favorite stop.

Title: Chief’s Luau
Content: Join the chief and his ohana (family) for an amazing evening of Polynesian culture and fun. Produced by Chief Sielu Avea, the original world champion fire-knife dancer and widely regarded as the best and funniest Polynesian entertainer in the South Pacific. Come and join Chief Sielu and his ohana (family) for an evening and immerse yourself in the rich heritage of the Islands. Sip a Mai Tai cocktail and sink your teeth into a lavish Hawaiian feast, a sumptuous blend of traditional luau foods blended with Hawaiian regional cuisine. And finally, enjoy a thrilling Polynesian show.

Title: E Noa Tours Pearl Harbor Remembered
Content:
Stops and sites on the Pearl Harbor Remembered Tour may include: 
  • WWII Valor in the Pacific Monument & USS Arizona Memorial 
  • USS Missouri Battleship on Ford Island 
  • Historic Downtown Honolulu (Drive Through Only) 
  • National Memorial of the Pacific

Title: Lahaina Cruise Company Dinner Cruise
Content: Experience the enchantment of a romantic dinner cruise on the Maui Princess. You'll see spectacular sunset views and night lights from the islands of Molokai, Lanai and Maui, while being served table-side by our friendly staff. Watch the stars come out over the ocean on our "open-air" upper dining deck. Live music after dinner in our air-conditioned main cabin, or you can stay at your table and enjoy the rest of your evening cruise along the Maui coastline.

Title: Poly Ad Tours Haleakala Sunrise
Content:
Experience a sunrise like no other from the Haleakala Visitor Center Lookout located 9,740 ft. above sea level! Those who have seen a sunrise from Haleakala say that it’s a fabulous way to spend the morning. 

Brand new luxurious Grech mini coaches will have your guests touring in style and comfort soaring above endless miles of beauty from what seems like the top of the world.

Title: Royal Lahaina Myths of Maui Luau
Content:
You are oceanfront at the Royal Lahaina Resort's Luau grounds on the beautiful Kaanapali Beach. The natives are preparing your dinner in the imu, (an underground stove) the traditional way of cooking. You watch in "awe" as they take the Kalua Pig (Roast Pork) out of the imu, one of your entree's tonight. You are served tropical drinks such as a Hawaiian Mai Tai or a Blue Hawaii which puts you in the Luau Mood. The delightful Luau Emcee appears on stage to inform you what you can expect for the rest of the evening.

Book Your Myths of Maui Luau!

Myths of Maui Luau - General Seating

You will enjoy a breathtaking celebration of traditional Hawaiian, Tahitian, Samoan and Maori dance and music as performers weave the legends of the South Pacific into a spellbinding performance.

2.25 Hrs.

DETAILS

Myths of Maui Luau - VIP Seating

You will enjoy a breathtaking ceVisit like VIP. Enjoy exclusive perks, on top of general admission inclusions, that allow you to fully immerse yourself in the luau experience. Live it up with exclusive services.

2.25 Hrs.

DETAILS

Title: Blue Hawaiian Helicopters Big Isle Spectacular
Content: Discover both the Big Island's beauty and its volcanic fury. Tour the most geologically active environment on earth-the famous Kilauea volcano, which has been continuosly erupting since 1983. View lava flows and black sand beaches. Experience all the awesome spectacle of Madame Pele's lava and volcanic badlands, then explore the lush rainforests of the Hamakua Coast.
Image Alt Text: Blue Hawaiian Helicopters - Big Island Hawaii

Title: Island Breeze Haleo Luau
Content: Held under the starry skies and the hala trees on the shores of Keauhou Bay, Haleo - the Voice of Life is Hawaii's newest lu'au. From the birth of Hawaii's royalty to the surfing stories of He'eia Bay, the dancers and musicians of Island Breeze take you on a colorful and entertaining journey through a very special time in our history.

Title: Wasabi Big Island in One Day Tour
Content: This full day nature tour offers an in-depth look at Hawaii’s youngest and largest island. From desert to rainforest, pasture to dry forest, discover diverse landscapes and 8 out of 13 climate zones in the world as you traverse the island, walk through rainforests to soaring waterfalls, and stroll black-sand beaches as you scan the horizon for green sea turtles.
Tags: all day tour|big island|nature|rainforest|scenic tour|scenic views

Title: Kipu Ranch Waterfall Picnic Adventure
Content:
Minimum of 2 and maximum of 4 guests per vehicle. 

For a fun filled day with your family and friends, our waterfall tour is the adventure for you! This is a swimming tour so be sure to pack your towels and swim gear. Hop into the Huleia River via Indiana Jones rope swing and splash into our tropical spring fed waterfall. Enjoy historic Kipu Ranch, its cattle, abundant wildlife, beautiful views, lush tropical landscape, and various movie locations!

Title: Luau Kalamaku
Content:
Lu'au Kalamaku is an unforgettable experience that is a "must-see" for any visitor to the islands. 

Your cultural journey begins with craft demonstrations and Hawaiian games followed by the traditional Imu Ceremony and a sumptuous buffet. 

The skies darken and lights dim as dancers take the stage to share the ancient Hawaiian legend, Kalamaku; the Polynesians' amazing and dangerous journey from Tahiti to Kauai.

Book A Luau Kalamaku Adventure Today!

Luau Kalamaku Gold Package

Luau Kalamaku’s exclusive Gold Package includes Premium Seating so you can experience our theatrical show close to the stage.

3.5 Hrs.

DETAILS

Luau Kalamaku Regular Package

Join us for a night filled with fire dancers, graceful hula, and delicious food all under the beautiful tropical Kauai night skies.

3.5 Hrs.

DETAILS

Luau Kalamaku Plantation Owners Evening Package

Join us for a night filled with fire dancers, graceful hula, and delicious food all under the beautiful tropical Kauai night skies.

3.5 Hrs.

DETAILS

Title: Luau Makaiwa
Content: Held at a beautiful oceanfront location on Kauai’s east shore, the Luau Maka'iwa celebrates the royal surfing grounds and the Polynesian islands’ connection with the ocean. The Wailua and Kapa'a areas on the island of Kauai were the original home to the first Hawaiian settlers who came from the Marquesas Islands to Kauai almost 1500 years ago.

Title: Atlantis Submarines Waikiki
Content: Atlantis Submarines offers a one-of-a-kind underwater experience off the coast of Oahu, Maui, and Hawaii Island, giving guests a close-up view of an array of marine life, exotic tropical reefs and numerous sunken vessels. It's like scuba diving in a giant aquarium, but staying dry the whole time! Enjoy your underwater adventure in the comfort and safety of a spacious air-conditioned, Coast Guard approved submarine. Our environmentally friendly, battery powered subs are the perfect activity for families of all ages!

Title: Hawaii Helicopter Molokai and West Maui
Content: An opportunity of a lifetime to travel across the Legendary Pailolo channel and venture to Molokai. Molokai is unique as it remains undeveloped compared to it's neighboring islands. It's like taking a step back into the past and seeing how things used to be.

Title: Wailele Polynesian Luau
Content:
The Wailele Polynesian Luau has been designed to bring traditional and authentic dances, songs and colorful costumes to visitors of this beautiful island, Maui. 

Guests will embark on a vibrant and exciting journey to the Polynesian Islands where dance was considered not just as a form of entertainment, but as a means of telling stories. Welcome drinks upon arrival: Lei greeting, Photo with dancers, Polynesian Village interactive cultural activities, Guests to be seated, Conch shell call and tiki torch lighting ceremony.

Title: Waikiki Yokocho
Content:
Leisurely stroll down the aisles of Waikiki Yokocho and you'll feel as if you've been transported to a true yokocho, a maze of alleys lined with small restaurants, in the middle of Japan! This is the vision of CEO Frank Clark, who wanted to create a place that truly represents the visual appeal and flavors of Japan.

Fourteen restaurants offer their own specialty dishes. Enjoy the best of Japan with something for everyone—ramen, tempura, yakiniku, teppanyaki, sushi and much more. Start with a drink and some appetizers at the bar, then head to the next restaurant for entrees, and end the evening with a delicious dessert at the next stop. Stop by for lunch too! Happy Hours vary at each restaurant.

Title: Aloha Petroleum
Content: With aloha in its name and in its people, Aloha Petroleum strives to improve the quality of life for its customers and the community. Fill up a tank of gas, then drop into the convenience store for your daily necessities and accessories such fast food and fountain drinks, candy, snacks, sandwiches, chips, beverages, beer and ice, tobacco, groceries, health and beauty aids, and lots more.

Title: Massage Hop
Content:
Sometimes you pay a lot of money for a beautiful hotel room and then spend zero time enjoying it because you feel like you have to go, go, go. And maybe you wake up one morning, it’s raining and you’re sore from all the go, go, go. That might be the ideal time to book a massage with Massage Hop—right in your room.

During his years in the massage business, Chris Grossi found that his out-call clients were always more relaxed and at ease being serviced in their own environment. He turned this realization into a mobile massage service, enlisting like-minded, licensed and talented massage therapists.

There are 30-, 60-, 90- and 120-minute sessions available, and there’s even an option for a massage chair. Whatever you choose, Chris’ goal is to keep the process simple while maintaining your comfort level as they work away all your tensions and muscle aches.

Title: Kona Style Snorkel & Sail
Content: An ocean adventure that’s sure to be the highlight of your trip! Witness the beauty of a Kona sunset from a 50-foot luxury sailing catamaran as you sail to Keauhou Bay for an evening snorkel with the majestic hāhālua (manta rays). Jump into the ocean with professional guides and see these gentle giants up close. Afterwards, enjoy freshly baked cookies, hot coffee and tea as you return to Kailua beneath the stars. All non-alcoholic beverages are complimentary with beer, wine and spirits available for purchase from the full bar. Snorkel equipment, instruction and T-top wetsuits are included. Seats sell out fast, so make your reservation today!

Title: Irie Hawaii Smoke & Vape Shop
Content:
If you’re in Hilo and low on smokes, stop in to Irie Hawaii Smoke & Vape Shop. Started by two community-minded friends, Irie offers customers friendly service in a casual atmosphere. Here you’ll find custom quality glass pipes, electronic cigarettes, smoking accessories and even detox supplies if you’re trying to kick the habit! In addition, they carry CBD oil products, rasta wear, and local and urban apparel.

Title: Big Island Beef Jerky
Content:
In January 2019, Theresa and Mariner Revell’s long time dream came true. They opened Big Island Beef Jerky & Snacks in Hilo. “We love jerky!” exclaims Theresa. “It’s our mission to bring our customers the best quality, best tasting gourmet jerky and snack products in Hawai‘i. We carry over 100 types of gourmet jerkies including beef jerky, exotic jerky, vegan jerky, pork jerky and more. We also have local favorites including a large assortment of crack seeds, Li Hing mui snacks, arare (Japanese rice crackers), Asian snacks and others.”

Vegan? Jerky? “Yes, we have a great selection of vegan products,” confirms Theresa. “They include jerky that are soy and mushroom based.”

Big Island Beef Jerky is known for their specialty, made-in-Hawai‘i goodies including “some of the best tasting cookies on the planet from ‘Ohana Cookies that don’t contain eggs or butter, and are made with a vegan margarine base. These cookies are locally made on the Big Island and taste wonderful!” says Theresa.

With shelves filled with almost every variety of jerky you can imagine, it may be tough to find a favorite, but not for the couple. “One of our favorite jerky items are the thin, crispy, Hawai‘i-made jerky,” says Theresa. “It’s almost like a potato chip and has a delicious crunch to it. They’re so easy to chew and can be enjoyed by everyone.”

For customers who wish to purchase a gift basket, they have that too. Whether ready-made or custom gift baskets, they contain a selection of jerky, cookies, seeds, chips and lots more.

“We’re here for our customers,” shares Theresa, “and want each one of them to have a one-of-a-kind experience at our ultimate jerky and snack shop.”

Title: Honoka‘a Chocolate Co.
Content: Located on picturesque Kahi Ola Mau Farm on the Hamakua Coast, Honoka‘a Chocolate Co. handcrafts their artisan chocolates and cacao products in small batches. Owners Mike and Rhonda Pollard have created an intimate, engaging experience on their farm tours for visitors based on the aloha spirit. Talk story with them as they share a diverse crop of cacao, white pineapple, exotic/tropical fruits, avocados, vanilla orchids and native Hawaiian varieties of sugar cane. Afterwards, spend an hour tasting chocolates from Hawai‘i and around the world made right on the farm. Reservations are required.

Title: Kona Snorkel Trips
Content: Experience exceptional customer service from the get-go with Kona Snorkel Trips. They’ll go the extra mile to get you in the middle of the action! Cruise into pristine Kealakekua Bay as highly knowledgeable guides share local information for a quality day on the water. Tours include dolphin swim, manta ray night snorkel, daytime reef snorkel and moonlight manta ray snorkels. Reservations required. Ask about military and resident discounts.

Title: Holualoa Kona Coffee Company
Content: A visit to Kona Le‘a Plantation provides a look into a thriving mill and roasting operation, Holualoa Kona Coffee Company, that’s also committed to sustainability. Take a free self-guided tour of this organic coffee plantation and see the wet milling, dry milling, roasting and packing process. They love to educate people on what it takes to make a quality cup of organic Kona coffee and explain why the cost of Kona coffee is so different! Holualoa Kona Coffee Company also mills and roasts coffee for approximately 300 local farms. Reservations are required for groups of 10 or more. Stop by for a cup of aloha!

Title: Rooster Farms
Content:
Setting up shop on the Big Island’s oldest Certified Organic Kona Coffee farm in late 2015, Tara Cronin and Ed Chen have combined their expertise to create a sustainable and productive organic Kona coffee farm. As a matter of fact, Rooster Farms was the only certified organic Kona coffee to claim a top spot in the 2016 Kona Coffee Cultural Festival Cupping Contest! Free educational tours are available on the hour daily by appointment on which you’ll sample freshly brewed coffee in medium and dark roasts, walk through the grounds and processing facilities, and can purchase coffee to take home.

Hourly Tours by Appointment

Title: RHS Distillery
Content: A tasting at RHS Distillery is a uniquely Hawaiian experience. Czech native Karel Kon (the Willy Wonka of Alcohol) brought his passion for distilling to the islands and creates new fusion recipes every three months. Guests get four samples for only $12 and choose from up to 80 different flavored rums, vodkas and liqueurs. Favorites include Lilikoi Liqueur, Ginger Honey Cordial, Hawaii Coffee Vodka, Ginger Cherry Spiced Rum and Kona Mule. Customers can walk out with their favorite bottle after a 25 minute tasting tour of RHS’s intimate set up. Hours:  1-3 pm Thursday-Saturday or by appointment 25 minute tasting tour with Uncle Karel - by appointment only

Title: Grand Wailea, A Waldorf Astoria Resort
Content: Embark on a vacation like never before with 40 acres of lush tropical gardens and endless activities to choose from – the ultimate destination for an immersive Hawaiian getaway. With an endless supply of activities, adventures and excitement, there’s a reason Grand Wailea is consistently ranked among the world’s best resorts by leading travel consumer reports and industry peers.

Title: Kauai Marriott Resort
Content: Treat yourself to captivating sunsets, breathtaking bay views and beachside fun at Kaua'i Marriott Resort. Our luxury hotel features top-tier amenities and modern rooms and suites with ocean, pool and garden views. Dine at our five popular restaurants and bars. Relax in our family-friendly, heated, outdoor pool - one of the largest in Hawaii. Escape to our luxurious spa for massages and a full range of beauty treatments. For your convenience, our hotel offers a complimentary 24-hour fitness center and a 24-hour business center. With an array of superb indoor and outdoor venues, our resort is ideal for destination weddings and conferences. Our Jack Nicklaus signature golf course, the longest in Hawaii, winds past steep cliffs and the bay.

Title: Outrigger Kona Resort and Spa at Keauhou Bay
Content: With an unmatched location on the iconic lava rocks of the Big Island's Kona Coast, Outrigger Kona Resort & Spa at Keauhou Bay offers a captivating blend of adventure, culture, heritage and authentic Hawaiian hospitality. Nestled atop the lava rock cliffs of the Kona Coast, our ocean side retreat overlooks Keauhou's giant manta ray coastal feeding grounds and is minutes from Kona Coffee farms, a short drive from snorkeling in Kealakekua Bay and the closest resort to Volcanoes National Park. Embrace island life in our oceanfront pool, at Ho'ola Spa, or via watersports and traditional Hawaiian activities, such as snorkeling in the bay, cultural tours, and hula lessons.

Title: Island Urgent Care
Content: Along with local communities, Island Urgent Care is proud to serve our visitors too! Whether you have medical insurance or not, walk in for friendly customer service and affordable care. Whether you’re suffering from a jellyfish sting gone bad, cuts, abrasions, heat rash or heat exhaustion, a sore back after an extreme hike or any non-emergency situation, you don’t need an appointment to be seen by a doctor. Check the website for discounts too. Now serving in 4-locations: Kapahulu, Pearl Kai, Kaka‘ako and Hawai‘i Kai

Title: Uluwehi’s Kava Bar & Grill
Content: O‘ahu is known as “The Gathering Place” and it’s here that you’ll find the flavors of many cultural dishes melding into savory menu offerings. Uluwehi’s Kava Bar & Grill is one such place. The popular Guava Smoke Meat plate lunch is a smoked meat that’s chopped and served with a guava sauce and onions. The Kalua Pork and Loco Moco plate lunches are also a hit with isle residents that keep them coming back for more. You should also try the Hawaiian Awa, or kava, an island drink not on many isle menus, that helps one to relax.

Title: TsuruTonTan
Content: Dedicated to making the highest quality noodles, TsuruTonTan serves its customers authentic, handmade udon made with flour and other ingredients from Japan. Their commitment even comes down to installing a water softener that changes the chemistry of the water so that it’s similar to the water in Japan. Here you’ll enjoy dishes that are as delightful to the eye as to the palate. Their suggestions include Wagyu Sukiyaki Udon, Tan Tan Udon, Seared Salmon Crab Roll, and the signature TsuruTonTan Deluxe Udon—housemade noodles and dashi (soup base) with assorted tempura, beef, chicken and egg.

Title: Honolulu Police Relief Association
Content: The Honolulu Police Relief Association is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing health and wellness benefits to Honolulu Police Dept. employees, both civilian and officers, as well as active and retired. You can help support the Honolulu Police Dept. by visiting their website or the shop to purchase t-shirts, caps and visors, children’s toys and tees, and accessories such as keychains, luggage tags, coin purse and more. Help support members of our local police department by purchasing unique souvenirs!

Title: Best of Hawaii Tours & Activities
Content: Dedicated to creating your best vacation ever, Best of Hawaii Tours & Activities offers a free vacation planning service, fast and easy. They have over 50 expert agents who can provide information on all their tours and activities that include lū‘au, zipline, ATV rides, horseback riding, hiking and climbing, Trikke and Segway, scuba diving, kayaking, snorkeling, stand up paddle, surf lessons, ocean excursions, dolphin watches and more, as well as visits to specific attraction such as the Polynesian Cultural Center and Coral Crater Adventure Park. Visiting another island? They have activity information for Maui, Big Island and Kauai too!

Title: The Ritz Carlton Alaloa Lounge
Content:
Named Best Lobby Lounge on the island by the readers of Maui No Ka Oi Magazine, The Alaloa Lounge at The Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua offers an extensive menu of specialty cocktails, domestic and imported beers, premium spirits and signature appetizers and desserts. With its breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean, Alaloa Lounge is the place to view the Maui sunset, enjoy an informal lunch or, from December to April, enjoy whale-watching. A spacious lanai offers outdoor seating or guests may choose to sit inside to enjoy the entertainment in the evenings.
  • Appetizers, light dining and dinner from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m.
  • Live entertainment Tuesday – Saturday from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m.
  • Sushi Station, daily from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m.

Title: The Ritz Carlton Ulana
Content: Named for the Hawaiian word meaning “to weave,” Ulana creates a tempting tapestry of culinary experiences. Lavish breakfast and brunch buffets, replete with a made-to-order omelet station and a Bloody Mary bar, are presented within the beautifully redesigned restaurant featuring pitched ceilings, woven accents and warm woods. Blending different dishes and design elements, Ulana inspires a sense of community complemented by stunning ocean views.

Title: The Ritz Carlton 'Olu Cafe
Content: ‘Olu translates to ‘cool’ and ‘refreshing’ in Hawaiian and perfectly describes the new menu at this ocean view restaurant. Offering hand-crafted cocktails, pupus and lunch favorites made with fresh, local ingredients, ‘Olu Café is the perfect place to enjoy lunch under the warm Maui sun.

Title: The Ritz Carlton The Burger Shack
Content:
Burger Shack is a casual, oceanfront hideaway where guests can savor signature burgers, over-the-top shakes and a selection of featured cocktails, wine, craft and local beer. This alfresco dining venue is the ideal spot to enjoy lunch or simply cocktails with friends and loved ones, while contemplating the waves, surfers and sometimes the whales. These delicious bites can be enjoyed at the restaurant under a natural canopy of more than 40 fully-grown coconut palms or can be packaged in a beach-friendly to-go kit.
  • Open daily from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.
  • Live entertainment and dinner served seasonally until 7:30 p.m. Please inquire with the concierge to confirm by calling 808-669-6200.

Title: The Ritz Carlton The Banyan Tree
Content: Highlighted by a hand-crafted wooden bar that wraps around the center of the restaurant allowing for an open concept with expansive views, the restaurant's transformation pays homage to the history of banyan trees in Hawaii as a gathering place to meet and share a meal. Chef Bella's vibrant new menu embraces that spirit and invites you on a journey to discover the roots of the land while incorporating the island's most unique and Sustainable ingredients. Classic Hawaiian recipes are deconstructed and redesigned with a local twist using Mediterranean cooking techniques to develop a menu that will enliven your senses through the ways of the islands.

Title: Coconut’s Fish Cafe
Content:
Fresh, delicious and generous at reasonable prices are an automatic draw to any popular eatery, and Coconut’s Fish Cafe clicks all the buttons. 

“My wife Carol and I have visited Hawai‘i, in general, for over 20 years, but have always loved Kaua‘i, the best of all the islands,” declares owner LaMont Fisher. “We found Coconut’s during one of our visits to Maui and knew it would be a great fit for Kaua‘i due to quality and cost. We wanted to open a place on Kaua‘i that most could afford.” It was also their dream to live on the Garden Isle. Who can blame them?

Coconut’s has garnered 4.5-plus star ratings on Yelp and TripAdvisor. They’ve also received accolades from Zagat, Travel + Leisure magazine and were featured on CNN’s list of “Top 10 Places to Eat Like a Local.” Fisher says their Fish Taco (one of their most popular menu items) was recently rated the #17 taco throughout the nation by BigSevenTravel.com. It’s made with 17 ingredients consisting of seven layers and textures, and a mixture of grilled mahi mahi and ono.

Pressed to see which is his favorite dish, Fisher replies, “Blackened Mahi Mahi. It provides a perfect seasoning to mahi mahi without overpowering the taste of the fish.”

More than anything, Fisher guarantees a quality meal in a great setting served by the most friendly staff, so be sure to stop by!

Title: Yves Nager
Content: Yves Nager is a renowned author, transformational healer and world explorer whose “soul-led” path through life has taken him to sacred sites and brought him into contact with teachers around the world. “Hawaiian Rebirth” is Nager’s new book dedicated to helping people move toward their life’s purpose while meeting challenges and obstacles head on through questions, stories, strategies and more. Nager also provides private VIP retreats, workshops, life coaching and healing therapies.

Title: Dickey’s Barbecue Pit
Content: The pace at Dickey’s Barbecue Pit is meat smoked low and slow daily for the flavor of legit Texas barbecue. If you’re in a rush, you might want to take it down a notch because every bite of the smoked beef brisket and pork ribs are well worth the wait. Add a side of waffle fries to that and a pecan pie or a blonde brownie for dessert; all are guaranteed to satisfy your need for savory, sweet and homestyle delicious! Their freestyle Coke machine has lots of flavors to choose from too. You can enjoy every delicious bite without the guilt since Dickey’s offers “authenticity with a conscience”—their menu items incorporate responsibly raised, quality meats without added nitrates and no artificial colors or flavors, plus humanely raised, antibiotic-free, cage-free chickens. Be sure to drop by Saturdays for their Big Beef Dino Ribs!

Title: Kaku’s Sushi & Seafood Buffet
Content: Internationally renown Sushi Chef Kaku Makino uses only the best fresh ingredients in his Japanese cuisine showcased at Kaku’s Sushi & Seafood Buffet. Unlike any other buffet restaurant, Kaku’s employs the highest standards in buffet-style dining with a wide selection of fresh sashimi, nigiri, hand rolls and creative sushi rolls in its sushi menu, and Japanese delicacies such as tonkatsu, tempura, yakisoba, gyoza, calamari, clam, beef teriyaki and more, plus salads and original desserts in the buffet. Set prices for lunch and dinner with 50% off for children 4-12 years.

Title: ‘Oahi Entertainment
Content: Changing the perception of a typical Hawaiian lū‘au, ‘Oahi Entertainment incorporates theatrical elements to entertain and educate audiences in its Polynesian Revue, “‘Oahi—The Fire WIthin.” Immerse yourself in Hawaiian history and culture on a journey from Tahiti to Hawai‘i alongside the fire goddess, Pele, and experience the beauty of Polynesia through her eyes. Your unique odyssey to the islands of Tahiti, New Zealand, Tonga, Samoa and Hawai‘i is accompanied by music, as well as fiery drama and compelling storylines, and takes place every Friday evening at the Middle Theatre.

Title: Coldwell Banker Island Properties
Content:
You’re living the vacation dream here in paradise, and the thought crosses your mind: “I wonder if I could ever live here?” That’s a question that Annabelle Smith and Susan McKay have been asked many times in their Kona Coast real estate career. “At one time, I asked those questions,” says Smith, an Ohio native. “When I decided to move here, I also became a realtor so I could determine the best strategy for owning real estate here. There are important differences between here and the Mainland. We help our clients navigate through our unique buying environment.” Call Annabelle and Susan and they’ll walk you through these five issues and more, providing peace of mind in your decision-making process:
  1. Fee Simple versus Leasehold. “Our Mainland clients understand fee simple because that is the common form of ownership. Leasehold means that the property is owned by a landlord, and you are only buying the structure itself. That is why the purchase price is much lower.”
  2. Lava Zones. “This is just what it sounds like,” says McKay. “All land on the Big Island is divided into seven lava zones. We can explain each zone, what each means and the financing consequences.”
  3. Elevation. “Elevation on the Kona side impacts energy costs, which can impact purchase price,” says Smith. “It’s a bigger deal than people think.”
  4. Square footage expectations. “People spend more time outdoors here,” says McKay. “Mainlanders often need to readjust their expectations regarding square footage.”

Title: Mountain Thunder Coffee Plantation
Content: Award-winning Mountain Thunder Coffee Plantation is in the business of making 100% Kona coffee including organic, private reserve, premium and espresso. See and learn about the fascinating bean-to-cup process—from growing to milling, grading, sorting, roasting and packaging on site—on free, fun and educational farm tours every hour, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. daily; no reservations required. For an additional fee, tours such as the Roastmaster Experience, Private 4x4 Plantation Tour and Lava Tube & Nature Walk offer an in-depth experience. Next time you take a sip of your 100% Kona coffee, you’ll appreciate everything it took to make that cup taste just perfect.

Title: KapohoKine Adventures
Content:
Celebrating 15 years, KapohoKine Adventures is your headquarters for air, land and sea excursions conveniently departing from Hilo and Kona. Different packages combine the excitement of ziplining, ATV rides, helicopter flights, swimming beneath a private waterfall and more—it’s all yours for the choosing! The new, eight-hour HeliZIP Package is in partnership with Hawaii Helicopters, offering aerial views of lush rainforests, dramatic coastlines, Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa, and includes a Hawaiian-style BBQ lunch and swim at a private waterfall.

Hilo & Kona pick ups are available

Title: The Flying Turtle
Content: Carey, the owner of Custom Island Tours, has taken thousands of people on private tours around O‘ahu since 2012. In addition to introducing folks to popular isle spots, he’s introduced them to the spectacular night sky on North Shore astronomy tours. Now the public can purchase isle images of turtles, astronomy and more captured by Carey as aluminum or matted prints. Take a piece of Hawai‘i home with you!

Title: The Flying Turtle Gallery
Content: Carey, the owner of Custom Island Tours, has taken thousands of people on private tours around O‘ahu since 2012. In addition to introducing folks to popular isle spots, he’s introduced them to the spectacular night sky on North Shore astronomy tours. Now the public can purchase isle images of turtles, astronomy and more captured by Carey as aluminum or matted prints. Take a piece of Hawai‘i home with you!

Title: 808 Toast
Content:
Looking for something deliciously unique to take the edge off your hunger on your way west? Then before you get out too far, stop at the recently opened 808 Toast food truck located at Waikele Premium Outlets.

Now, before you start thinking, “Toast?” Keep reading. We’re talking savory, flavor-satisfying Korean-style street sandwiches—no bread and butter for you!

“Originally, we had traveled to South Korea and tried their amazing street food sandwiches there,” says Philippe Roque, 808 Toast managing director. “The stalls lining the streets were filled with delicious sandwiches that we really loved. When we came back to Hawaiʻi, there was no food similar to it here, so we wanted to try and bring what we had in South Korea to the streets of O‘ahu. Our first sandwich, the ‘808 Special,’ was directly inspired by some of the food we had during our travels.” It also happens to be Roque’s top pick.

“My personal favorite is our Number One 808 Special,” he says. “That sandwich holds a special place in my heart because it was the first sandwich we developed when we started out. We spent maybe about two to four months selling only that sandwich. For me, I think it’s a great blend of salty and sweet that is just great for my palate, and hopefully for others as well.”

Yelp reviewers also vouch for the sandwich that started it all. Eggs with corn and cheese folded into ham, pickles, cabbage and kiwi sauce laid out between toasted Japanese white bread. That homemade sweet and savory kiwi sauce is killer! (editor’s note: there is nothing like authentic Japanese white bread).

The Loco Moco Toast and Bulgogi Toast are two other top recommendations, and all are available at competitive prices.

According to Roque, it was a long and difficult path to bring 808 Toast to life, but so well worth the effort. He says, “Seeing the enjoyment on the face of our customers is what makes it so rewarding.”

Title: Poke Bar
Content: Enjoy fresh fish with a selection of premium add-ons to create your own custom meal with bold flavors. Traditionally paired with rice, choose from white or brown rice or mixed greens, then add your choice of fish, mix-ins, sauces, sides and toppings. Perfect for a get-up-and go experience that doesn’t sacrifice on quality or flavor.

Title: Bike Share Hawaii
Content:
Ever wonder about those pretty blue bikes people are riding all over town and Waikīkī? Those are Biki Bikes! Access any one of 1,300 bikes at 130 stops 24/7 for quick and convenient pedal power transport to wherever you need to go. Choose from four different plans—the $20 Free Spirit gives you 300 minutes to use whenever you want; pay $4 One-Way for a quick ride around town; the $15 Commuter offers a month of unlimited 30-min. rides; and the $25 Voyager is unlimited 60-min. rides for a month. Unlock a bike via a credit card, the Biki Mobile App or Biki Pass and choose what works best for you!

Map of biki Stops https://gobiki.org/map-of-biki-stops/

Title: Maui Divers Jewelry
Content:
In 1958, master divers Jack Ackerman and Larry Wembly went deep sea diving off Lahaina, Maui, and more than 200 feet below the surface, found something never seen before—Hawaiian black coral. The pair sold some trinkets from their dive shop until the following year when they met O‘ahu entrepreneur Cliff Slater. Thus, Maui Divers Jewelry was born. “Hawaiian black coral is only found in waters between 150 and 300 feet deep off Maui,” says Cole Slater, executive vice president for Maui Divers Jewelry. “From the beginning, Maui Divers was concerned about sustainability so they partnered with the University of Hawai‘i to research the black coral, and adopted methods of selective harvesting, which ensured the the coral’s continued growth. They also worked with agencies to agree on ways to carefully harvest from selected sites to ensure a healthy environment.” Hawaiian black coral is considered the most lustrous black coral in the world, and is featured in one of Maui Divers’ most popular collections, the Yin Yang collection. “It’s an eternal circle swirled into equal halves,” says Slater. “The Yin Yang symbol celebrates the Asian ideals of balance and harmony.” The pieces also include sparkling diamonds. Customers can also select cultured Tahitian black pearls, South Sea pearls, Japanese Akoya pearls, freshwater pearls, Australian opals, diamonds, peridot and other gemstones. Maui Divers carries the most unique Hawaiian Heirloom featuring tri-color gold and exclusive award-winning Living Heirloom jewelry. Maui Divers Jewelry offers a ‘forever guarantee’ that covers the workmanship and materials of every item forever, not just for the lifetime of the customer. “It’s great to know our jewelry gets handed down generations and we’re still here to take care of the products,” adds Slater. “We’re honored every day to be part of visitors’ Hawai‘i experience.” Visit Maui Divers Jewelry at their Līhu‘e locations at Anchor Cove and inside Hilo Hattie.

Find stores near your location: https://www.mauidivers.com/apps/store-locator

Title: The Christmas Bar Hawaii
Content:
The popular Christmas Bar Pop-Up concept at Big City Diner in the Ward Entertainment Center has arrived! See how the space has transformed into a holiday spectacular!

“We wanted to do something really fun this year for the holidays and I wanted to do something with my restaurant friends,” said Elf Lane Muraoka. “We anticipate our Frozen Hot Chocolate and Butter Beer to be our top sellers, and both can be made with or without alcohol. But don’t forget about the Melted Snowman Martini or the Clause-mopolitan. There’s fun for everyone!”

This is going to be a complete transformation of the Ward Entertainment Center location. A limited-time pop-up bar, complete with holiday-themed drinks and food and over-the-top decor everywhere you turn. Prepare to feel hugged by Christmas as soon as you walk in the door!

The 2019 Christmas Bar is a collaborative effort between four top elves in the industry: Lane Muraoka of Big City Diner, with Bill Tobin, Albert Ake, and Michael Miller who all also work at Tiki’s Grill & Bar.

So get out your ugly sweaters, dust off those reindeer antlers, and get into the holiday spirit!

All five other Big City Diner locations are open for regular service and are excited to have you join them for the holiday season at any of their other locations on the island. You can find their next nearest location in Kaimuki. 3565 Waialae Ave, Honolulu, HI 96816 (808) 738-8855

Title: Kauai Vintage
Content: Enter the vintage world of Tim and Betsy Hand, who own Kauai Vintage in Kapa‘a. This quaint shop located inside Orchid Alley is a mixture of love of fashion and love for Hawai‘i for the duo, and they show their appreciation for the islands with some good old-fashioned hospitality that also helps them to preserve the island’s beauty.    “Vintage apparel is sustainable,” says Betsy. “There won’t be a shortage of vintage anytime soon, but there will be a shortage of our natural resources. Fast fashion or cheap and trendy clothing that doesn’t last is one of the world’s largest polluters. Kauai Vintage attempts to offset this footprint by preserving and appreciating clothing from a time past.    “Of course, the romance and nostalgia that the clothing evokes is second to none. The best part is the feeling that the clothing brings us, the stories behind them, and its commitment to the environment.”    When asked to share one of those stories, Betsy replies, “We have a pristine box of beautiful go-go dancer costumes and cruise wear. The original owner would travel to Hawai‘i every year, and each year she bought a beautiful party dress. I’m proud to say every single one of her dresses has a new home and will appear at parties, not in landfills.”    When seeing these beautiful and quality clothing items from the past, we wonder if she has any favorites. “I refuse to sell my most dramatic pieces such as ones with high collars and pearl buttons. I have a fashion problem,” admits Betsy.    How and why Tim and Betsy do business with Kauai Vintage invites a peek into the multimillion dollar apparel industry. We may not give much thought to it, but it just may make us pause before clicking that button or flashing that credit card.    You’ll also find laser-made products courtesy of Tim—wood key chains, coasters, Christmas ornaments and more that make perfect Kaua‘i souvenirs!

Title: Vicky’s Fabrics
Content:
Hula costumes, Hawaiian shirts, prom gowns, cheerleading outfits, wedding gowns, whatever needed sewing, Vicky Masuoka sewed it out of her home for nearly 10 years before opening Vicky’s Fabrics in July 1982 in Old Kapa‘a Town. “She also did clothing alterations, cushion covers and curtains,” says Maile Bloxsom, one of Masuoka’s daughters. “If you could sew it, mom probably made it.”
Bloxsom and her sister grew up in their mom’s shop, doing homework, hanging out and helping behind the scenes. She even learned to sew clothes and did small fixes, but the sewing bug never did take hold of Bloxsom—until she turned 30.
“I was working as an accountant in Los Angeles and had just got a promotion, and a new office with a big blank wall,” shares Bloxsom. “I didn’t like any of the art they offered to hang on my wall office, and I was coming home for a vacation. There, working with a local quilter, I made a wall hanging, two-feet tall and six-feet wide, a series of three kimono in Asian prints, perfect for the wall on my office. The next month, I signed up for a beginning quilting class and haven’t stopped quilting since.”
Seventeen years later, Bloxsom now owns and runs the store while her mostly retired mother continues to sew almost daily. Her 11-year-old daughter, Ashlyn, has just discovered her own love of sewing and has completed some small projects. Bloxsom herself continues her love of quilting and creates small crafts.
Vicky’s Fabrics is a full-service fabric shop for sewing, quilting and crafts. Find a wide variety of fabrics for clothing, satins, linens, stretch fabrics for swimsuits, polyester cotton Hawaiian prints, rayons and cottons. There are also a large collection of quilting cottons, as well as decorator and heavyweight upholstery for home decor. Clothing and quilting patterns, notions are available too.
Customers can also find ready-made quilts or kits to make on their own, plus locally made gift items and products designed in Hawai‘i for sale. Quilting and sewing lessons are also open to all skill levels.
“Coming home to Kaua‘i and taking over the store has been an experience to learn about business and community, and home and family,” shares Bloxsom. Her mom ran the store for 29 years before handing it over to Bloxsom. Let’s see the family tradition continue for at least another 30 more.
